Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mmcdonald82
Reviews.Content: One thing I really appreciated about this hotel is the free shuttle service from the airport to the hotel. The staff was also extremely accommodating. Its proximity to the Vatican and the Hop-on/Hop-off bus meeting point was convenient. The room was nice and surprisingly quiet for such a busy part of the city. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: Dianne P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in walking distance from the Vatican. The view from the room was lovely. The service and food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benjamin8Aars
Reviews.Content: Enjoying your breakfast looking through the big panoramawindows of the restaurant to St. Peter´s Cathedral is a wonderfull excperience. The Atlante Star Hotel is situated in the heart of Rome only ten minutes walk from The Vaticano. The Hotel is very comfortable, and its staff very servicemindede and forthcoming. We were very comfortable in the room and will not hesitate to return to this nice place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: schula1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Atlante hotels both times I have visited Rome. The staff are extremely friendly and helpfull and I have loved both rooms I stayed in. The hotel is close to all the attractions and we were able to walk to them all with ease. The view from the restaurant is amazing. I fully intend to stay there again when I next retern to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: phil186482
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 night break. Our first visit and having read some reviews about this hotel we were bit apprehensive. All we can say dont believe the bad reviews- yes the rooms are small but when you in Rome for short break you are only using them for sleeping. They were cleaned everyday new towels etc the hotel is so close to vatican City and other attractions. The staff were pleasant and so helpful. We booked room only so cannot comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Break in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Tom R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for a long weekend back in April 2011. It was our first visit to Rome so we did not know what to expect. I can safely say when we arrived at the hotel our expectations were fulfilled. The hotel is very quaint, lovely little lounge/bar to relax and have a drink. The room was lovely - rustic and authentic. The view over St Peter's from the room and restaurant was simply breathtaking and quite overwhelming. The food was fantastic and the service was excellent. The wine we were served was one of the best I ever tasted! Location wise very easy to get around with metro stop within easy walking distance. Walk to central Rome took about 20 mins which is great as you take in all the stunning views. We hope to return to Rome and we would stay at the Atlante Star again.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable rooms gussied up by velvet walls”
Reviews.Author: Houstonscientist
Reviews.Content: Claims to be a four start hotel, but is really a three star by normal Italian standards. Fancy wallpaper and velvet curtains do not really make you comfortable. Beds small and excruciating, bathrooms just average, staff not quite up to par. Breakfasts are awful by normal Italian standards. Location is very convenient to Vatican. The next time we are in Rome, we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Marinagina
Reviews.Content: Our booking was for the B & B associated with the hotel but when we arrived we were given a room at the hotel. Our room was small but provided all we needed for our 3 night stay. Who hangs around in a hotel room anyway?? The staff was helpful, providing an electrical adaptor and booking our Vatican Museum tour. Breakfast and the dining room view were magnificent. We appreciated the location near the Vatican and the Fiume Tevere. Following the river gave us a focus to locate the sights we wanted to see. We arrived from Termini on the #60 bus and spent a few moments trying to locate the hotel-directions could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Rome..Rome...”
Reviews.Author: patman10
Reviews.Content: - spent there almost a week.Amazing location, amazing place, amazing people! You can walk most likely everywhere in SanPietro area. Great view of the "cupola" from the restaurant where you can join excellent food. I would warm suggest it!

Reviews.Title: “very good option”
Reviews.Author: Moni_tc
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location. It's very close to Castel Sant Angelo. the breakfast is good and the view from there is beautiful. People are helpful. Rooms are small but clean.I

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of complete repair”
Reviews.Author: Unknown_Traveler1
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel during our stop in Rome on our honeymoon. We had even paid extra to secure a suite for us. Unfortunately, this hotel fell short on every front. When we first arrived at the hotel, it was clear that it was not a "nice" hotel--for example, there are stairs that force you to pick up and carry your luggage to the hotel's foyer. The elevator was small, with dingy mirrors lining the wall, and seemed to have mechanical difficulties. Even the lock seemed to barely work. Inside the room--it was clear that the suite hadn't been renovated in 30 years or so. There was tacky and peeling black-and-gold paint everywhere, more of the permanently stained mirrors, wooden shutters with missing locks, etc. The carpet and cloth furniture looked in desperate need of replacing or at least a steam cleaning. The bed was not kingsize as advertised but a queen--and the mattress hard and inexpensive. The TV and sattelite barely worked, requiring to press buttons hard. In the room itself, there was an aging jacuzzi with a 30-year old Whirlpool logo. The original jacuzzi controls were broken, and the hotel's staff showed us how to control it from the circuitbreaker--basically just "on" and "off" settings; basically unusable. The suite had a second room, but we just used it to store our luggage (which we were afraid to do at first, the room looked like a magnet for bed bugs). Inside the second room was a dingy and nasty mini bar. We kept the windows closed at night, but were subjected to mosquito bites--not surprising given the broken window latches and lack of screens. There was no safe in the room, and the advertised "safe at the concierge" meant leaving your stuff in a mailbox, not the most reassuring measures for your valuables. The thermostat was broken and off by at least 10 degrees. The bathroom seemed ok until we discovered that the toilet flusher was broken, requiring to press the button multiple times to activate the water. Included breakfast was ok and featured cold cuts, cereal, pasteurized cheese / jam, and hardboiled eggs--not bad. However, we found dinner to be a terrible experience--extremely overpriced, with mediocre food, and terrible live lounge music. A big pet peeve was the absence of WIFI or internet connectivity. The hotel forces you to buy a pay-per-use card, but the WiFi signal is too weak to access in the rooms. A kicker is that you have to use the pay-per-use card even to use the hotel's own computer in the lobby. The lobby computer was extremely old and ran Windows 98. In closing, this hotel is in a nice location by the Vatican and Castel Saint Angelo. However, the hotel itself is a terrible value and is in desperate need of complete and total repair. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK just the room a little too small for two persons”
Reviews.Author: Maria Guadalupe C
Reviews.Content: The personal very friendly and answered perfect each question and as many times as we needed. As I said, room too small for two persons. There was only one chair but we were TWO! The bathroom also too small and without any possibility to hang or leave your cloths somewhere. The water from the shower was not strong enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelmanDubai
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, and the location couldn't be better - just 5 minutes walk from St Peters Square and the breakfast room at the top of the hotel has a stunning view across to the Basilica. The front desk staff speak excellent English and are extremely helpful at all times. The room was very cosy, and lavishly furnished. We'll definitiely use the hotel on our next trip to Rome, hopefully sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Boss2210
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and were a bit wary. The free pick up was on time and very good. When we got to the hotel it looks really tired from outside. Our room was ready even though we were early. Room was adequate for me my husband and daughter. With the amount of walking you do ask for the rooms with jacuzzi baths . We didn't get one but could have done with it. Breakfast is lovely. You really don't spend as much time in the hotel but I found all the staff to be very polite and look after you. Analice at the bar was very nice. Couldn't fault it for the price. So close to everything and a good base. Not much noise at night but slightly noisy during day but that's Rome!! Really good location for finding everything and staff have you maps and directed you. Loved it. Was my birthday treat and was wonderful . Thank you to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: zhz_11
Reviews.Content: The room was a little bit small and the decor was a little bit old. It was rated 4* but I wouldn't rate it that high. The service was excellent though. The free airport pick up was on time and professional. The staff also recommended an excellent seafood restaurant just down the street for dinner. The location is also quite handy. It is walkable to Vatican City and a metro line. San Pietro train station is also reasonably close. All in all, it was pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: fineshine27
Reviews.Content: We were booked for the Atlante Garden Hotel but on arrival in Rome was taken straight to the Atlante Star, we were told that the Garden hotel had problems with their water system!!! at first a little miffed that we were not told about this change but we were happy once we got to our rooms, they were very clean, newly decorated and the bathroom was very modern, breakfast and staff were excellent, the location was very good within a few minutes of the Vatican and bus/metro were close by.. this hotel was in a quieter location than the Atlante Garden which was a few minutes walk away and I think we benefitted from this.. all in all I would stay at the Star again, the only issue we had was that the roof garden terrace was not open so we were not able to have breakfast on the roof... also for those who are wary of lifts, the lift in this hotel had a mind of its own and would sit with doors closed for a minute or so before moving, this can be a bit unnerving if you don't like lifts.. the lift to the restaurant however is better.

Reviews.Title: “MIXED FEELINGS”
Reviews.Author: dickd301
Reviews.Content: I love this Hotel, from it's location to the Vatican to the quaint al fresco bar next door. Service by the male front desk manager was tops. Truely the best. After complaining that the rooftop bar hasn't been open for 5 years now, and still isn't although it's prominatly described and shown on the hotels web site. I loved the location for drinks and the great view of the vatican, but really closed 4 or 5 years for what a dining room employee said was "a work in progress"? But i was upgrated to a 3 room suite with a jacuzzi room and all was well. Hell i can sit down on the sidewalk for that kind of treatment. Again for the overaall experience, I will stay at the star of my next trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Maison royale”
Reviews.Author: Rlu0507
Reviews.Content: Quaint and small but cozy rooms. Very close to the vatican and other tourist attractions in Rome. Very helpful staff and good breakfast. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The weird Italian 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: Steelguy777
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not an international 4 star but it's a decent 3 star. Staff is helpful and breakfast is adequate except the Cappuccino and Espresso are really good as the rest of Rome. The location is great. The room smelled a little funny but overall was clean and the bathroom was good and clean. All in all I would stay in this hotel again provided I can get a good offer.

Reviews.Title: “Such a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexia M
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel great. Beautiful room, polite staff, amazing view of St.Peter's Basilica from my room on the fifth floor (and from the restaurant on the top floor). Location is central and I was able to walk everywhere. Breakfast was satisfactory and my companion and I had a relaxing break. Simple!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fabian B
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay in our honeymoon - it was great, we really appreciate the room. Even the service was excellent. Breakfast was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Middle-aged Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Deborah L
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to visit Vatican City and good for central Rome sites too. Larger property then most hotels we stayed in in Italy, with great views of the Vatican from top-floor restaurant. Comfortable rooms, bathtub/shower combo were nice, but would be challenging for older or larger people. Street noise, but not more than to be expected in a downtown location. Staff was very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Mleelee
Reviews.Content: When I planned my destination wedding in Italy, I was extremely excited! I couldn't wait to explore a new country and not sure why I thought that the Italians would be nice. Was I wrong! The airport pick up is an extremely nice touch and the fact that it is pretty centrally located to a lot of things, but the free breakfast at the top, what a joke. If you didn't get there by 9:00 am all the food would be eaten up, and they won't refill, the staff up stairs have a horrible attitude, no smiles or anyone willing to help. I can't believe that for the last two days we were there, they said that they didn't have a cooked breakfast because the chef was off. So we felt completely screwed. Where we stayed, the carpeting had been soak so there was a horrible stinge, thank God it didn't creep into our rooms. Not a great way to start the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation at the Atlante Star Rome, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Annelie S
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel at an excellent location. 5 minutes walk to St. Peter Cathedrale and 5 minutes walk to the underground station. Very good and very friendly service continiously: Very good restaurant on the 6th floor with a spectacular view at the vatikan. Only little disadvantage was the stowage and the size of the room, if you stay more than 2 nights. Absolutely clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Fetsund_NorwayGry
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our anniversary and wanted a nice hotel in Rome. When we got to the hotel we did not recognize the room from the pictures at all. It wasn´t cosy at all and the whirlpool in the room did not function (one of the reasons I booked the hotel) and the bathtub was broke. The nicest thing about the hotel was the view from the breakfast room. Great. The staff wasn´t very nice either and was getting mad at my husband for asking for a new room - which we did not have, -but we got our stay for 50 % of the booked price. The location is good - we walked a lot and found som nice restaurants just around the corner. Shopping is also not very far away.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: INDIRA S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older than st peters it has filty carpets,small dirty bathrooms where you cant even shower properly,the mirrors on the wall wereblackish.greyish.You can never sleep at night because of the nose of police sirens and traffic staff are rude and the wrong picturesare shown ontheir website.Icould not even move around in my first room which was the size of a prison cell.There is a perpetual sewer smell in the foyer in the afternoon.These people must spen money upgrading this piece of junk.Igot locked in my roomand there are actually tiles on the door ,where in the world have you heard of that!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!RENOVATE OR CLOSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSEEE DOWN RIP OFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulaj350
Reviews.Content: Shuttle bus on arrival at airport and welcomed at the hotel by friendly staff. Showed to a very beautiful room in a fantastic location close to the Vatican, the Bridge of Angels and an absolutely fabulous restaurant near-by (Il Bacio, 39 via Crescenzio). The bathroom had a jacuzzi and the bedrooms decoration was gorgeous, bold and lushious. Thank you for a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but the mix up left a bad taste in our mouths”
Reviews.Author: jg212
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel, our reservation wasn't there and was booked at the Atlante Garden instead. We had to stay there for one night and then move to the Atlante Star the next day, which was a bit annoying. The staff was great and accommodating, and they put us up in a really nice room at the Star. The first morning, we were told that we could go eat breakfast at the Atlante Star - even though we were staying at the Garden - but when we got up there for breakfast, the lady in the dinning room gave us some trouble because she asked for our room number and we tried to explain the mix up with our reservation, she was a bit rude and ignored what we were saying, just kept asking for the room number. We told her to call the guy at reception, but she refused. Other than that mix up, the hotel is clean and is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margieandfriend
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in August 2011. It was our first trip to rome during a very hot summer. The hotel was located within a few minutes of the Vatican and a few minutes to public transport to all other landmarks in the city. Breakfast was excellent and served on the sixth floor with direct site to the Basilica. Our room on the first night did not have a working air conditioner but we were moved to a comfortable size room with ensuite bathroom and walk in wardrobe. Daily cleaning etc was very good. Highly recommend the hotel to any visitors to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the sites, quiet, but rooms very compact.”
Reviews.Author: OGSBJ
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was smart in apperance and the front desk was efficiently run providing that there were not any more than 2 people waiting. Rooms were so compact that you could not swing a mouse never mind a cat. WARNING the roof garden is under repair and does not re open till next year summer 2012 this was a massive disappointment as it was the deciding vote as to where we stopped no mention of this on the web site or by staff when we called.

Reviews.Title: “Short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 78Kath
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location!!! Ideal for a sight seeing holiday in Rome. Only a few minutes away from St Peters and the Vatican, was lovely to have dinner and then be in walking distance for a moon lit view of St Peters... Just round the corner was lots of bus stops for the Sight seeing tours. Only 15 min walk from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. Very helpful and friendly staff, they made the airport loosing my luggage alot less painful advising me on local shops and doing what ever they good to help. I miss the view from the resturant, one of the best ways to start the day!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the the main reason our trip was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie L
Reviews.Content: Two co-workers and I flew to Rome to spend a few vacation days after a work conference in Switzerland. We located your hotel off one of the websites...I think Travelocity. We were just looking for an inexpensive air/hotel package so we could spend a few days in Rome before heading back to the States. Something close to the Vatican and with easy access to other sites. I don't think we could have picked a better hotel. You provided a clean, quiet, comfortable, stay. The hotel staff was so kind and helpful with all our questions regarding tours, directions, etc. And the little bar next door (Fonclea or something like that) was the perfect little pub with fantastic live music to let us kick-back at the end of the day! It was a perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: SpainCarolinaSpain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property back in 2007 and it was awful. When I was booked into the same property again for a business trip the first thing that came into my mind was "it cannot be as bad as before, I am sure the property is better now". But it was NOT. Do not be fool by the pictures, the room are size ok, but they are old, not clean, the breakfast was one of the worst I´ve ever seen, could not even drink the so called juice. the only good thing is the views to St Peter form the breakfast room but this is not even well furnished or decorated nor well maintained. Rooms are very noisy and I could not close the window properly and for a 4* bathroom amenities were poor or inexsisten. It is located closed to Vatican but not the best area to stay in Rome for after work hours, and of course, this is not a 4* property, prices are high and quality, cleanliness and service are really horrendous

Reviews.Title: “Really luxurious, comfortable, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: backpacker-couple11
Reviews.Content: Booked this really last minute (the night before!), originally had a booking for the Atlante Garden, however they upgraded us to the Atlante Star. We had a deluxe room with a jacuzzi bath, beautiful decor, really soundproof (padded walls!). The restaraunt upstairs served a really well stocked and good quality buffet breakfast (dinner was quite pricey, but you'e paying for the panoramic view of Rome - including St Peter's Basilica. Hotel is excellently located for Vatican City and St Peter's Square - bit more of a walk to the Coliseum, but Vatican City was really the highlight of the trip. There aren't a great deal of restaurants around, however we were only there for five days and didn't do our research in advance! There was, however, a little cafe at the end of the road to our hotel which served by far the best pasta dishes I have ever had and the best lemon sorbet I have ever had!!!!! Perfect romantic getaway hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star views”
Reviews.Author: harrasedmum54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlante Star for a 5 night break 10th August 2011. I had read the negative reviews so was well prepared. It is true that the hotel is not a 4 star , but if you want modern this is not for you- BUT if you want QUIRKY and a GREAT LOCATION then you cant beat the Atlante Star. We requested a top floor with a view and our request was met. And what a view. As we pushed open the old weather worn authentic shutters we were rewarded with an uniterrupted view of St Peters Basillica, we could hear the bells of a morning [ but they didnt wake us]. The breakfast room has a similar view - unmissable. The view alone is 5 star. The room is small - there are no tea making facilities- but it is spotless and the staff are so friendly and helpful. Breakfast is the typical continetal style but plenty of it. As a previous reviewer has said everything is a 20 minute walk away - 30 minutes in the August heat !! The vatican is 5 minute walk - the Tiber is a 7 minute walk. A hop on hop bus [the 100] stops just outside the vatican and we found this great to see the sites and get back to the hotel on tired legs. Also they had a deal of 2 days for the price of 1. would definatley go back . Loved the hotel and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, convenient location, delicious breakfast with wonderful view, we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: Hotel Atlante Star is very conveniently located a short walk from Vatican City and Castel Sant'Angelo. There are several bus stops close by and the closest metro station is a 10 minute walk. Popular dining destinations such as Piazza Novona and Campo De Fiori are 15 minute walks from the hotel. The service was excellent. Professional and friendly. The woman who cleaned our rooms was absolutely delightful and went out of her way to be helpful. The complimentary breakfast offers a wide variety of very good foods and is served in a large room with picture windows on two sides that offer spectacular views of St. Peter's and across the river towards the heart of Roma. The complimentary airport pick up is very convenient with little to no wait after clearing customs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 154913Marc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Atlante Star for three nights. Great staff, location, and good price. We had our touring bikes with us and the staff kindly found a safe and secure place to store them. Our room was clean and quite large by European standards. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: michaelb722000
Reviews.Content: Picked up efficiently from Fiumicino airport and was pleasantly surprised to find the hotel rooms weren't vastly different to the photos on the website. The view from the restaurant of St Peter's Basilica is every bit as good as the photos too!! The room was very clean, spacious and room service made the beds and replaced towels every day. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: onlineprof
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Atlante Star. It is ideally located, clean, and well serviced. We brought children with us and stayed in the quadruple room, which was quite large and comfortable. The air conditioning worked wonderfully and the hotel staff was very helpful. I had to do some business and the hotel helped with taxis and made me feel secure. We were greeted by a lovely woman each night in the lobby, where she offered us wine and cold drinks for the children. She was so pleasant and patient and one of the reasons we'd return. The local neighborhood is wonderful and we had amazing local meals (sans tourists), within a block of this property. I chose to stay there on our second trip, even though I like to try new places, and I'd choose it again! Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: JVTully
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right between St. Angels Castle and St. Peters Basilica and although its considered to be the "wrong" side of the river, we were very pleased by the location. The hotel itself was probably very dramatic and luxurious a few years back but needs some maintenance, upkeep and updating now. The lounge is a lovely way to end a very full day and the bartender was a great way to get insider tips. We only used the restaurant for breakfast (included) and the selection was very European but adequate with a tremendous view of St. Peters dome. The only complaint was the maitre'd that insisted on provided Italian language lessons and became quite upset when people wouldn't play along to the point that he would ignore you. Definitely, a drawback to starting a relaxed day. There is a restaurant just around the corner from hotel with a blue awning. This was amazing for dinner as the food and service were impeccable. There is also a bakery one street over that has delicious snacks or a substitute breakfast or buy a few groceries at te small supermarket in the alley behind hotel. They have an a good selection of fruits, cheeses and deli. Also, you can buy a good olive oil for about half the price of the same thing on offer in Florence. Rooms are so very different that you can finally get one you like and don't be afraid to insist (some front desk staff is very surly while some are very pleasant). We tipped the housekeeper very well initially and were looked after extremely well for the rest of two weeks. She really went over and above the call of duty. All in all, the hotel has alot to offer because of the location and surroundings but needs a bit of work on customer service.

Reviews.Title: “We had to change hotels”
Reviews.Author: IreneElysse
Reviews.Content: The minute we got there, it was Sunday so the streets were super quiet. We were hungry so the bellboy escorted us to probably THE WORST RESTAURANT in Rome. It smelled really weird, not air conditioned, the food sucked and we were the only people there. It made us feel so sketched out and not to mention it was so expensive. We checked it but when we got to our rooms, it was a struggle to get our doors to open. When we got inside the rooms were tiny and I had a lot of complaints even though I understood it was a fairly old building. We made reservations to a different hotel right away. The breakfast was pretty nice though. Breakfast is included with your stay so its not the best food but its located on the top floor so it has a nice view of the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JSKrysinski
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a room in the Orange Garden Bed and Breakfast that is associated with this hotel, but all of the B&B rooms were full when we got to Rome. We were immediately given a room in the Hotel Atlante Star, no questions or fuss. The room was very comfortable and having the restaurant attached was quite convenient. The restaurant breakfast was amazing and the dinner was delicious. And the view from the restaurant...breathtaking!! Great location - close to the Vatican and Metro Station. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeresaMiller
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Such a great location in Rome. Staff was great. Room was spacious and very clean. There is a seafood restaurant down the street behind the flower stand. It does not have a name on the outside, just "Restaurant". Ask for it at the front desk. It's CRAZY good! Also the lobby bar is always a fun place to swap info with other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Alracyoj
Reviews.Content: We had booked for a room at the Atlante Garden Hotel, and when our complimentary shuttle from the airport brought us to the Atlante Star instead, I was concerned. However, Niko, our wonderful front desk clerk (or maybe he was the manager, he was always there and always helpful) assured us our room here would be lovely, and he was right. The hotel is charming, the service top-notch and the room was comfortable and clean. Unfortunately the roof-top terrace was closed for repairs. I highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay there again should I ever be so blessed to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We didnt like it and wont be back”
Reviews.Author: heleng04
Reviews.Content: The reason we booked this hotel was due to the heavily promoted roof garden. Visions of sitting there sharing a bottle of wine remenicing on the day. However the roof garden does not exist and has not done so - apparently - for the last three years!! The hotel continues to use this feature as a main part of its advertising and I find it deceitful to say the least. The hotel itself is tired and a bit grubby. - Horrible bath with yellowing jacuzzi holes. - Chrome bathroom fittings stained brown. - filthy lift mirrors - Grubby outside entrance - Safe that didnt work meaning we had to take passports and all our money with us every day - Unable to buy a coffee in the hotel lobby and no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. - Staff nice enough but not terribly helpful. However the woman who cleaned the rooms did a great job and was lovely. - Rooms very small and dark not a place to linger long. - Breakfast room lovely but not very clean. Wilting flower displays beginning to smell of rotting vegitation on the tables - luke warm coffee In summery no way is this a 4 star hotel. They need to stop advertising the roof garden.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: anita_and_jay
Reviews.Content: Wow! Just returned home from a short break with my elderly Mother. We were allocated a beautiful room on street level. Felt very safe as the windows were high up and protected by shutters and railings. There was no street noise due to the padded walls which were very decorative. A clean modern bathroom supplied with toiletries and a well stocked mini bar in the room. If you had time to view, there was a TV in the room with Sky channels. Breakfast is served on the 6th floor with amazing views of St Peters and the surrounding areas. Continental Breakfast consists of rolls, pastries, cheese's, cold meats cereal, eggs, jams etc, plenty to fill up on. The staff were fantastic, everyone was so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble and always a smile. The mini bus was there to meet us upon arrival and you can pre book one back to the airport for just 40 Euros, this is well worth doing as the airport is a good 40 minutes away. The hotel is beautiful with lots of character and in a perfect location for visiting the Vatican area and other places of interest. Needless to say, we had a wonderful time and would definitely recommend this hotel for the service, comfort and prime location.

Reviews.Title: “No bed of Roses”
Reviews.Author: Tourists016
Reviews.Content: We booked for the roof garden which is heavily advertised by the Hotel so were very disappointed to discover it's been closed for years.This quickly clouded our enthusiam and made it harder to overlook the old and tired decor,musty smell in room,broken safe,faulty TV, wobbly shower, cold coffee etc-you noticed these small things more when disillusioned. All that said, Rome more than made up for this. The views from the dining area are good, shame the windows could'nt be opened or the area better used for residents at night.Don't book this hotel for the roof garden, 'it may open next year' we were told as we were checking out!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay with you”
Reviews.Author: bellbird_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a lot of character, wonderful service, comfy bed and lovely bathroom. We loved breakfast looking out to St. Peters cathedral and found the staff very pleasant and helpful. I would recommend it and wouldn't hesitate to stay again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mandarijntje
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at hotel atlante star. The rooms are modern and clean. Breakfast is served at the sixth floor and so you have an amazing view over the Vatican. Breakfast itself is very good (plenty of things to choose from and always enough). The hotel is situated near the Vatican and Angel’s castle; a great location to start visiting Rome! We were very happy to have chosen this hotel (and the fact that we got engaged during this trip only makes it better We will be coming back, that’s for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: mike_s0729
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe and we were fortunate to have picked the Atlante Star. the hotel staff was friendly and helpful; the room was a suite which nicely accomodated the four of us- as others have said, you are close to everything here and we found shopping in the Prati district as easy as walking to Central Rome and all the sites. The rooftop restaurant was very nice and the complementary champagne was a nice touch. We thought the best pizza was in the little storefront directly next to the hotel- we ate lunch there three times. :)

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: sportspup
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a balcony/jacuzzi room and loved the photos of the roof. I got there, spent over 100 euros higher a night for the suite and when I arrived, did not receive a balcony, nor a jacuzzi room and the hotel's roof top area has been closed for THREE YEARS! When I went to the desk, the front desk clerk was a bit condescending and said "well, you're only staying a few days anyway." The rooms are decorated 1970's and the king beds are just two twins shoved together. The location is ok, but there are MANY hotels that are closer and nicer. I was incredibly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto.”
Reviews.Author: Steerpyke
Reviews.Content: Every time I travel to Rome, this is the hotel that I stay in. The staff are extremely friendly & helpful & the location is second to none. Quiet enough to be able to relax & not too far away from the action. The nearby Metro stations make it very easy to navigate around the city. The local restaurants & bars are also very good. I really like the area around Via Ottaviano. I would recommend the breakfast to anyone, including the view from the dining room. All in all, a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lissa57
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful and the location was perfect. Located 5 minute walk from the Vatican. Breakfast buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER”
Reviews.Author: Benedikt_11
Reviews.Content: I was in the Hotel Atlante Star for several times (over x-mas- or New-years-days, some times with my 85 year old mother, sometimes alone. The Hotel is very charming, with good rooms, a beautiful view from the breakfast-room to the St. Peter's Square; very clean rooms, situatated 5 minutes by feet to the Vaticane. The receptionists are always polite and helpful and take always friendly care for the individual wishes and questions. If I would go to Rome again I would chose this familiar and nice hotel every time again - like I did sevaral times.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: PaulTravelNyc
Reviews.Content: I spent a very pleasant weekend with my girlfriend in Rome at the Atlante Star Hotel. Everything was just perfect from arriving with the complimentary airport transfer, a quick and easy check-in and lots of assistance from the front desk regarding tours, local restaurants & shopping. Our room was just fantastic, lovely style, very modern and spotless. Breakfast consisted of a complete buffet on the sixth floor with floor to ceiling windows overlooking St. Peter’s and most of Rome! Strolling the area at night past St. Peter’s square & St. Angel’s castle was simple beautiful. Just outside the hotel is a crisscross of tiny streets called Borgo Pio which is full of restaurants, bars and late night eateries which seems very popular with the locals. Nothing more romantic than Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good The Bada & Not Sure”
Reviews.Author: ade3
Reviews.Content: Good: Location next to vatican. Very close. Good: Very helpful & friendly staff. Not sure: Parking two streets away with no real ability to off load your luggage I suppose to be expected given its location. Bad: Room was quite dark with dark green wallpaper. Good: Great view from the balcony. Not Sure: Had breakfast in restaurant which was great, but looked at dinner menu which was very expensive even for Rome. Ate out instead. Bad: Very small lift had to make two trips with three cases. Good: overall a good experience, room could do with a bit of an update, but friendly staff and the location out way any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “THREE FOR THREE!”
Reviews.Author: kkmpizzo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Rome three times in the last 15 years and have stayed at the Atlante Star each time. The location (walking distance from Vatican City and Piazza Navona), is perfect. They offer FREE shuttle service from the airport! The staff is extremely friendly and exceptionally knowledgeable. Don't know when we'll be returning to Rome but I do know that when we do, we'll be staying at the Atlante Star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kfindlay1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at the Atlante Star. Location - can not be beat! Blocks away from the Vatican and the Metro station. Two blocks away, down a side street is a series of very delicious and affordable restaurants. There is lots of great shopping nearby also. Rooms - all hotel rooms in Rome are small by North American standards. But I found our room size to be more than adequate. Lots of space for our luggage, and a small closet to hang our clothes. The bathroom was generous with a full soaker tub. Having a bath after a long day of walking felt amazing. The only drawback to the washroom is during peak water usage times, such as the morning, it could take a while to get the really hot water. But I never had a cold shower. We had requested a quite room, as I had read the rooms could be noisy, and the request was granted. Our room overlooked the courtyard and every night we experienced peace and quiet. Rooms and bathroom were always very clean. Beds are hard, and the pillows are tiny, but this did not stop me from sleeping well. Service - Amazing! The staff is very helpful and very friendly The shuttle bus from the airport was very much appreciated. I recommend eating in the hotel restaurant. The view is amazing and the food is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: Leila088
Reviews.Content: Nice and friendly service, it was very enjoyable to start the day with a good breakfast at the restaurant offering a nice view over Roma and the Vatican. We were happy to have the possibility of a room for 3 persons (couple + teenager) that was spacefull enough. The location was very good for us, we visited Rome walking. The location, breakfast restaurant and friendly service is what we liked the best.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Perfect Location, Phenomenal Service”
Reviews.Author: danaloops
Reviews.Content: Hotel Atlante Star was a wonderful and delightful experience. The rooms were very well decorated and accommodating, with a great bathroom and comfortable beds. It was very quiet and the location of the hotel was great... only a few minutes walk from the Vatican and several major plazas. The service was very impressive, I left my jacket at the hotel and they shipped it to me free of charge right away. I would highly recommend to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean tidy rooms, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: janepats
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 friends spent 4 nights in the Atlante Star. We chose this hotel as it was near to the Vatican City, we are in our late 60s and it took us about 8 mins to walk to St Peter's. Our rooms were very comfortable with king sized beds and en-suite bathrooms. The rooms and the bathrooms were clean and tastefully decorated. Our 2 rooms were at the end of a corridor, with it own door, so we could leave our doors open and the 2 rooms were quite private (ideal for a family). There was no kettle in the room, but we had packed our own travel kettle, and there was a fridge in the room for milk etc. The hotel has a lift which was necessary for us as we were on the 5th floor! The rooftop restaurant was closed for 3 days during our stay so we had to go to the sister hotel, The Atlante Garden, for breakfast. This wasn't a problem as it was only 5 mins walk away. On our last day we had breakfast in our restaurant , so were able to appreciate the wonderful views right across Rome. The breakfast was good, cold buffet, but plenty of fruit, yogurts, Danish pastries, rolls, cheeses and ham, with as much fruit juice and coffee as you want. We didn't eat in the restaurant at night as we usually ate earlier in the day. We found the food in Rome expensive compared to England, Pizza and Pasta usually 10euros per person. Chips, green beans, spinach about 6 euros each( just enough for 2 people), and this was in small cafes not near the 'tourist' areas. " 2 Beers and 2 coffees were 15 euros, on average, although it was very good coffee - unlike Starbucks! Behind the hotel there is a Spar shop where we bought wine and soft drinks for our rooms and we bought rolls to have for lunch. If we returned to Rome we would stay at the Atlante Star and would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: valuetraveller50
Reviews.Content: great location, very friendly staff, basic style but brillant value and going to go back in autumn

Reviews.Title: “Hotel - OK. Roberta (manager) - awesome”
Reviews.Author: sburca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Atlante Star on Dec 20-23. We booked through Priceline, so our price for a 4 star hotel was unbeatable. However, sometimes being a Priceline bidding customer comes at a price. A 4 star hotel in Europe is NOT a 4 star hotel in the USA. Not even CLOSE!! I'm not talking about the size of the rooms only (which we were aware of being MUCH smaller), but the amenities and quality of the rooms / bathrooms. When we first checked in, the front desk wanted to charge us a whopping 40 euros PER NIGHT for our child ,7 yr old (we paid less than $80 USD for the room initially!!!). We told him she'd sleep with us on the same bed, but he said it doesn't matter, as my child would still be using water from the shower, soap, and flush the toilet!!! Whoa .... there was no way I was going to settle for this kind of crap, so I asked for a manager. He didn't want to get one, so I made noise, so that the other customers in line could hear the absurdity. I didn't want to sound like an obnoxious American, but this was ridiculous. Our room was already paid for in advance. That's when Roberta (the manager) came into play, and everything from there on was as smooth and pleasant as it should've been from the very beginning. She apologized for the idiot at the front desk, moved us to a room with 1 double and 1 twin beds at no extra charge, and gave us free breakfast our last day of stay (the breakfast was AMAZING... great local produce, and super fresh). BTW, no breakfast included (or a 30 EURO charge per person (sigh) per day, quote by yours truly, the idiot at the front desk) and no free WiFi (super expensive to purchase as well!). But two doors down, at the cafe / sandwich shop, there is free WiFi (but be courteous and purchase something from them if you want to use their internet!!!) :) Worth mentioning: we stayed at a different 4 star hotel 2 week prior to this, in Rome, near Roma Termini, Hotel Morgana, and full breakfast was included every day, price per night was cheaper than Hotel Atlante Star, and had a lot more rooms remodeled MUCH NICER, and having a child with us was not even an issue at all! Just saying ... there are other options out there. The hotel and room we stayed in were clean and with nice decor. Although, not all rooms were created equally, we have seen 2 others. So it depends if you get one of the more recently upgraded rooms. The bathroom was not so great. Mold everywhere in the shower, clogged sink, lime & grit on the faucet preventing water from flowing without splashing everywhere, crackling pipes, whistling faucet, low water pressure in the shower ... The location was excellent, a few blocks away from the Vatican, and within walking distance to some of the most impressive sites in Rome (too many to list here, now). Walking so much around the area was GREAT! The hotel is small, everything is tight, but clean. This is Europe after all, but that's fine, for it made a very cozy stay. The elevator fits 2 people with 2 luggage, or 2 adults and 1 child, nose to nose. :) Yes, very small!! I didn't mind the closeness to my husband and child, but if this was a business trip and if I had to smell someone's breath that close ... I don't know! We used the stairs when we didn't have to carry the luggage. There is no pool or spa or jacuzzi or fitness center on the property. No lobby bathroom, only in rooms. Old / dirty bed sheets, as they were doing room service each day, would ALL sit in the small and narrow hallways, in HUGE piles, from morning until the wee hours at night, blocking several rooms on each level, and stairway or elevator access! Bottom line: in comparison to a 4 star hotel in the US or nordic EU countries, this hotel is an average 2 (two) star hotel at best. The only reason I gave this rating a 4 star, is because Roberta really did everything she could, ABOVE and BEYOND, to make up for the front desk idiot (who was upset that she treated us so nicely!!!) and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: MaltaBear
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline. Looking at website I thought I was getting a great deal. Imagine our disappointment to find we were given a small room containing two single beds that would not stay together. We also had to move the single chair in front of the door so that we could watch the TV. The toilet was so close to the wall it was difficult to sit on it properly. The experience was made complete by finding that the much-vaunted rooftop restaurant with views of St. Peter's was closed for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cgarmer
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Rome was plagues with issues from the start. Luckily the staff at Atlante Star was there to help us out. We were the first plane out of LA going to Heathrow after the big snow storm. Our flight from London to Rome was delayed 2 hours and customs took over 2 hours to get through because only 2 windows were open for non-EU passport holders. To our amazement, the courtesy shuttle was still there! Oh, did i mention British Airways had lost our luggage???? The driver helped us get the needed information for our luggage claim. He also called ahead to inform the hotel front desk clerk that we were on our way and to have our room ready. Check in was non-existent. They knew who we were, handed us our keys to our room, told us how to get to our room and expressed their concern for our luggage and offered us help in finding out when it would arrive without having to pay any international charges on our phone or any charges for the calls from the room. Long story short, they went above and beyond in trying to help us retrieve our luggage. Now to the hotel and room. The location is wonderful. My wife and I were able to walk the ENTIRE city without feeling like we were on the trail of tears. The Vatican is steps away. Castle St Angelo is right down the street and Piazza Novana is just across the river. The room we had was small but very nice. The walls were plush with padding in between the fabric wall coverings and the walls. The ceiling had a stair step effect and the bathroom had Jacuzzi tub fit for 2, well it fit my wife and I at least.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: emmy_bug
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the sister hotel (Atlante Garden) but was sent to this hotel (no reason was given). This happened to other people staying at the hotel. It seems that the hotel doesnt care which hotel they put people in - as long as they're in a room. I originally chose the hotel because it was walking distance from the major attractions and just off the beaten track. We were picked up by the free shuttle service so was very happy to be greeted by a friendly driver. When we arrived at the hotel they were very friendly and were shown to our room. The staff were friendly and helpful when asked and i found them to always have a smile on their face. It just appears that the hotel lets them down. The room was small and not what i'd expect from a "Superior Double". The bathroom was old and the shower was broken (taps came off and the water came out of every hole). We reported this to reception and they sent a man up to fix it, but it didnt resolve the problem and we could only use the shower if we held the hose in a certain position. The rooftop garden and restaurant were a building site and we were not told that they were not available at checkin. Breakfast was in another hotel entirely and it was very annoying to have to walk 10minutes just to get breakfast in the morning. The walls of the rooms were cotton thin. You could hear everything that was going on next to you - and as a result we were kept awake by other residents. It was a loud room and side road but we took that to be a sign of "authentic rome". Another negative for me was that there were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: msjackie
Reviews.Content: As a single lady traveling with my family, I sayed in a double deluxe room alone(room with double bed). Room and bathroom was very very small and the lighting was very dim. The beds were very comfortable, the room was very clean, and the staff was very helpful. The wi fi did not work in the room. We were not given breakfast with this room as we requested so we only ate breakfast in the restaurant one time during our 16 day stay. The breakfast cost 15 euros each and was adequate, boiled eggs, cheese, pastry etc. The hotel was close to St Peters and The Vatican Museum. The hotel was close to groceries and restaurants. You just need to explore a little to find them. My room had a little balcony that I really enjoyed in the mornings. As an American, I am use to having ice in my room but not here in Italy, we had to go up to the restaurant with our ice buckets to get ice. The restaurant staff got use to us with our ice buckets and we didnt even have to ask for ice they just saw us coming and got it for us. This hotel offered free pick up from the airport was very helpful on arrival. We had to pay for their van to take us to the airport for departure which was a very reasonable price. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: ehm1217
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay during New Year 2011 at the Hotel Atlante Star. By European hotel standards the room was spacious, with a small entry foyer and closet, double-bed area with TV and small desk and updated bath. The room was nicely appointed. I am bit confused by some of the negative comments in some of the reviews, as we found the service throughout our week-long stay to be excellent -- and we were there during a busy holiday week. Every request was promptly accommodated, and staff -- from the front desk to housekeeping -- were cordial, cheerful and helpful. The airport pick up and return service worked with no problems. Breakfast was typical -- charge was 15 Euros if not included in your rate. Internet in the room (corded) worked fine (10 Euros for an eight-hour pass, 5 Euros for three hours). The hotel is in an excellent location for visitors -- quick walk to St. Peter's and about a 15-minute walk to the Metro. ATM is located right outside the building. A small supermarket is about a block away. We'd also recommend the Porto Costello Ristorante for lunch or dinner. It's a block away (exit the hotel and go left to Largo di Porta Castello, 27). Coffee shops and other restaurant choices abound in the neighborhood. All in all we had an excellent stay in Rome and the service and accommodations at the Hotel Atlante Star played an important part in making our trip successful.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mobiel
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days / 3 nights in this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The rooms, not so big but big enough because anyway you don't spend much time in your room in Rome. The rooms were very clean and beds were comfortable. The showers (in the bath) were good with enough water pressure (not always the case in other hotels). We had a room at the street side but didn't have a lot of noise because the street was rather small. The only minus was that you had to pay for the internet. You have a nice view from the breakfast area on St Peters. The location was good, very close to the Vatican and only 15mins on foot to the campo dei fiori. Also very well linked with public transport. Very good hotel for Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Italian style and class”
Reviews.Author: Steve from Bristol
Reviews.Content: We have visited Italy many times, love the food, the history and the people. We have visited Rome several times but this was the first time at the Atlante. The hotel is well situated for the Vatican and still close enough to the sites and shops so see Rome on foot. In a residential area there are loads of good value great quality restaurants and bars nearby, with local food shops as well. The building unspoilt, the rooms well maintained and quite lavish (fabric covered walls, old style windows and marble bathrooms) – so very Italian. We were collected from the airport and made most welcome, our room on the 2nd floor was reasonable size and comfortable. Breakfast was included and the only disappointment. Sparse choice and not really to the standard we would expect. As you would expect the tourist areas are more expensive but if you want a cheap coffee go to McDonalds. If you want authentic experience with service on a street café in a beautiful square of avenue just pay a little more and don’t moan. Even so we found many places offering great deals so it’s not difficult to enjoy the Italian experience without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful adventure in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Margit2010
Reviews.Content: In October my husband, my grandchild ( girl 14 years old ) an myself had one of our best vacations in Rome, staying in Hotel Atlante Star Hotel. The staff was very helpful, co-operative. The room was beautiful furnished and stylish. We enjoyed to live there, the cleaning was very good. The Hotel was a perfect starting point to experience all the treasures of Rome, and there are lots of them. The last day, I asked my grandchild what she thought was her best experience: The breakfast, she said. And it was magnificent. And the view from the restaurant to The St. Peter Cathedral was a great view. We will certainly come back to Rome and stay in Hotel Atlante Star Hotel. We have told friends, family about our stay, and they are very interested in a holiday i Rome and your Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Typical overpriced Euro hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardch_2
Reviews.Content: Spent a week. Room small for $340/nite. Roof garden closed for work entire stay.Great location. Very noisy. Breakfast/incl was very good. Staff were courteous and helpful. Extra facilities i.e. gym,swim limited or none.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel and stay at the Atante Star Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: DragonMark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Atlante Star in September 2006 for our 10th Wedding anniversary. I chose this hotel for its location to the Vatican and other sights and the promise from the hotel to pick us up from Rome’s main Airport. I can say that the hotel did not let us down. The hotel was clean and the service was excellent. The restaurant was at the top of the hotel with an amazing view of the Vatican. Breakfast was excellent value with lots of choice. The walk to the Vatican was short and also good for all the other sights of Rome. Overall a very good stay at the Atante Star Hotel and would gladly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was beyond expectations and ideally located”
Reviews.Author: happiness67
Reviews.Content: We were very cordially greeted and a problem we had with the pick-up from the airport was taken care of on our bill. Everybody we encountered there was quite friendly as well as helpful. The room was very comfortable and the hotel was well located - a good hike to most sites. We'd go back again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: janet081
Reviews.Content: from the pickup from the airport (complimentary) to wonderful breatkfast with view of St. Peter's we found this hotel a great place to stay for our 4 days in Rome. The area was quiet(no problem sleeping) and safe. Lovely inexpensive reaturant down the street. Grocery store behind the block. We would stay here the next time we were in Rome so would definately reccomend!!

Reviews.Title: “Location second to none, staff go out of their way to help.”
Reviews.Author: travlin_cat
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Atlante Star Hotel for 9 nights in September while we toured Rome and area. The room was very clean, beds were comfortable and staff friendly and helpful. My only complaint would be that our room had only a small window overlooking the airconditioners, etc so we had very little natural light. On the up-side, the room stayed cool while the temperature outside was in the 30's. The hotel had a nice lounge where you could sit, relax with a drink, watch tv, or just visit. And the restaurant, Les Etoiles, was excellent and you can't beat the view!

Reviews.Title: “The Atlante Star Hotel helped make our visit to Rome a memory of a lifetime.”
Reviews.Author: Mom047
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. On the day we arrived the hotel van was waiting for our arrival and delivered us promptly to the hotel. There was a problem with our room being large enough upon our arrival but this was remedied within 24 hours, and we were moved to a larger room without lifting a finger. The staff was helpful and kind and we were very pleased with the housekeeping. We'd recommend this hotel to our family and friends and feel good about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff. Would definitely visit time and time again.”
Reviews.Author: michaelmarsh
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Star Hotel is in a great location, set on a bustling street in the heart of the city. Only a short walk to Vatican City and close to the Tiber River. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Roma. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms and hotel were very clean and maintained to a good standard. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in ROME”
Reviews.Author: Apereznoy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly, courteous, and very professional staff. The location was excellent, apprximately 2-3 blocks to the Vatican, (easy leisulely walk), with easy access to taxis and buses to go the the other must see places in Rome. Only draw back that we did not get to see/use the rooftop restaurant because it was closed for repairs/improvements, however the restaurant below it was more than a match for this slight inconvienience. I would most definitely stay there again, and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sampford
Reviews.Content: Good Points Restauraunt had super views of the Vatican Bed Linen and Towels clean and changed regularly Staff helpful and tried to rectify faults asap downside booked double room on arrival given room on 4th floor tiny dark but the real problem was the bathroom bath so small you had you knees up to your chest shower head - rather not go there - bathroom not upgraded since dont know when and really not acceptable. net curtains dirty room nothing like any of the hotel photos complained on day 2 and given a much better room on day 3 and compensated for earlier dissatisfaction but in a 4* hotel shouldnt have been given such a room in the first place dont go on holiday to complain

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: TaylorMcStrat
Reviews.Content: We booked online and paid in advance at this hotel for our first visit to Italy for our 30th anniversary. We booked a superior room, and after walking around the hotel, noticed we had been given the worst of the lot. When we returned from our visit to Tuscany, we stayed another two nights before our return to the US. When we checked in, we were told there was a "problem" in that the hotel was overbooked. I said it wasn't my problem because we had prepaid. They acted put-out, but proposed an option. They had the bellman escort us to a basement apartment they owned three blocks away. Although it was larger than the room we had, it had no services such as a restaurant, bar, or even someone to ask how to turn on the A/C. The A/C didn't work, the bathtub drain was broken, lights were sketchy, and we had to sleep with the windows wide open just for some air. Of course, that meant we were woken several times during the night with loud cars, sirens, etc. Yuck. The staff were condescending and snotty, unlike the many other natives we dealt with on this trip. If you're Italian, you'll probably be OK here, but they treated us (and the other guests from the US) like so many bothersome cattle. If this hotel was my only experience with Italy, I wouldn't bother to recommend a visit. They claim they are a 4-star "Superior" hotel, but it's not up to any 4-star standards anywhere else in the world I've travelled. Avoid this low-rent dump, even if you have to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: LuvMyPug2008
Reviews.Content: Overall a good value - rooms are small but clean. Located very close to the Vatican - 5 minute stroll. Area can be kind of quiet at night but it is easy enough to find good restaurants/bars etc a short walk from the hotel. If you are looking for nightlife and/or action at night stay over by the Spanish Steps etc. Concierge was very helpful -

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Clandub
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Atlante Star for our 10th Wedding Anniversary. We had a fantastic time again. The room was compact, clean and a perfect base in central Rome. The dining room is surrounded by huge picture windows where we enjoyed our breakfast looking out over the roof tops of this great city including the Vatican. We were looking forward to sharing a bottle of the local wine on the roof terrace, but sadly it was closed for renovation - next time! We found the staff very helpful and friendly and would go back tomorrow in a heartbeat! A couple of tips, we bought a 24hr bus ticket each day handy for hopping on and off whenever you like, metro included. We walked down by the river to the Trastevere area to eat every night.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Jpizz3
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Atlante Garden Hotel, where we booked, we were moved to the Atlante Star Hotel. While they have shuttles, we were walked by a bellhop the two blocks to the other hotel. While not overly taxing, I found it to be somewhat rude to be told they overbooked the one hotel and then had us walk to the next. The changing of hotels also screwed up some of our tour prebookings as we had to walk back to the other to catch our arranged rides. All of that aside, the hotel was clean, the hotel staff was always nice, and the location is primo. The included breakfast was not much, perhaps as we are Americans and breakfast food is different here, but I found myself eating Salami and cheese sandwiches for breakfast and then buying a cappucino next door because their coffee was quite mudlike. All in all, I am a guy that is won over by location and you can't get much better than where this hotel is at. I would recommend, just know what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless Vatican view”
Reviews.Author: tokyo2van
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip online and this hotel was a good bargain. The breakfast was lovely. The view of the Vatican was breathtaking... it was hard to leave after breakfast was done! Our room was small but clean. The water pressure was awful so it was actually hard to shower properly. There was confusion about breakfast included in our hotel stay. The first deskman said it wasn't included, then the other staff person said it was, so we assumed yes. As we checked out, the first deskman (quite rudely) insisted on charging us over 200euro(!) After speaking with the manager, we were exempt however if you do book through an online package, purchase the breakfast as the views are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Five days at the Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: StephyGil
Reviews.Content: Having spent five days at Atlante Star my boyfriend and I are sure where to return to celebrate our anniversary! The staff was extremely courteous, quick and efficient. Breakfast was not only good and abundant but also at the top floor of the Hotel the view is simply amazing, really! When I booked I mentioned it was going to be an anniversary trip and upon arriving to our room we found cold champagne and a basket of fruit. I also booked the restaurant which is situated at the top floor of the hotel for our anniversary dinner and was so happy with my choice, the incredible view of St.Peter's basilica at night, exceptional food and atmosphere... absolutely priceless. I have traveled extensively but I can easily say this is my favourite place in my favourite city. I so look forward to going back that I recommended Atlante star to all couples near and far from Rome. I'd recommend upon booking the dinner to ask for a table with the best view.

Reviews.Title: “Antlante Star: A-Mazing!”
Reviews.Author: kmw1121
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel! My husband and I came for our honeymoon/1 year anniversary and the staff was so very nice! Also, it is in a great location! We recommend Giggi's right around the corner and Old Bridge Gelato! Enjoy your stay in this fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel95
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderfully located to the Vatican and to the subway system. Our dinner in the restaurant was superb! The staff was friendly and the rooms were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “I could not ask for a better hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jann7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Atlante Star exceeded my expectations. The room was impeccable and cool. It over looked a lovely courtyard. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood two blocks from the Vatican. It provides a lovely walk to the Tiber River and to all the monuments and Trastavere. The breakfast buffet was extensive, fresh, and delicious. But most of all, the staff was incredibly kind, helpful, generous, and accomodating. I left a memory card in the room, and they offered to send the card to me as a courtesy. The service of this hotel is the best, and that means a lot to me! They treated me like a family member rather than just another guest.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cool and efficient.”
Reviews.Author: TatianaSmirnoff
Reviews.Content: The triple room was clean, plenty of linens and towels available and the air conditioning was amazing. The hotel is quiet and well managed. I appreciated the complimentary shuttle from the airport. The hotel staff were helpful in every capacity and the location near the vatican was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service a pleasure to stay could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Amy039
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay was close to the Vatican city beautiful restaurants and local market accommodated to all needs and were very pleasant and friendly. Spoke English excellently no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, great buffett breakfast, a bit noisey from street traffic, would recommend to a friendo”
Reviews.Author: yodaboda
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for small , but comfortable room. Bed takes up nearly entire room, fair size bathroom. Clean facility. Close to all sites. would take public transportation to one side of the city and walk back. I would do the same the next day doing the the other half of the city. Hop-on, Hop -off bus is okay, but the same can be done on your own. For Vatican City, definitely take a guided tour, it saves waiting in line before you get in and the guides are very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “everyting was excellent”
Reviews.Author: sanzianna
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent holiday in Rome which was due to fantastic weather even it was really hot durring middle of the day . The hotel was really great hotel. It is in an ideal location, very near to the Vatican (only 10 mins walking), for public transport, sight seeing and shopping. I thought the hotel staff was well-mannered, friendly and very helpful. The room was very nice, well decorated, very clean, comfortable bed, I was very pleased with my room. The breakfast also was most enjoyable and the view from restaurant windows was really great. I plan to stay in the hotel next year when I want to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great location, but the services are below expectation, not clean....”
Reviews.Author: Vacati0n10
Reviews.Content: We have to wait almost two hours to do check-in for the room was not ready. it happens to others while waiting in the reception area. the corridor was so narrow, I wondetr how it pass the regulation of fire-route. the room was very tied for three people, mold around the corners, smells dump. no coffee or Iron, neither safety box. Some of the staf were helpful, but others look like they are the guests themselves. We requested hot water for our tea, they say that they don't provide such services. they lack customer service talent.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel Has Seen Better Days”
Reviews.Author: csg
Reviews.Content: This hotel probably was great when it first opened and everything was new. The rooms were spotlessly clean, however, and that's always a plus. The hotel in general, is just old and worn. The air-conditioning was almost non-existant in our room, and my complaining didn't get action. Thank goodness I had a small electric fan with me, or we would have been very uncomfortable. The wallcoverings and bed coverings were very nice, but the furniture was very run down, as was the bathroom. The fixtures were chipped and worn, and the bathtub was so narrow that you could hardly stand in it without putting one foot in front of the other. The rooftop restaurant served a free breakfast which was lacking and there was no free internet. I saw a lady turned away one night and sent to another hotel even though she had already prepaid in full for her room. We also prepaid and got a decent rate, so I am glad that our room was not given away! This hotel is rated four stars, but it should be rated 2 1/2 at most.

Reviews.Title: “The Atlante Star gave us great service, set in a prime location, and has a terrific staff.”
Reviews.Author: ktc3tls5
Reviews.Content: First, the provide airport pick-up. The service is outstanding and the hotel staff were delightful and very helpful. The complimentary breakfast with its incomparable view of the Vatican and Castle San't Angleo was a great way to start the day. They helped with taxis, offered great places to eat. There are bakeries and deli's within walking distance.........and quaint local restaurants as well. The location is terrific in that you are within walking distance of the Vatican, the Castle San't Angelo, and Piazza Novanna. We were there with two other couples and enjoyed the lounge with great service and drinks...........and met other travelers for a very warm experience. We would definitely stay there again............and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, with great views.”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireDuck47
Reviews.Content: Atlante star was a great base to stay and view the sights of Rome. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English. It was not too long a journey from the airport and the hotel was very clean and comfortable. We literally turned right from the main entrance and within 10 minutes were at the Vatican museum or St Peters basilica. Turn left and a 5 minute walk took us to Castle St Angelo and the River Tiber. There were a few bars/cafes on the surrounding streets and also a local shop to buy fruit, drinks snacks or even food to make a pack up! Within an hours walk you were among the hustle and bustle of Rome's streets and piazza's and stumbling upon other historic sights such as the colosseum, Trevi fountain and spanish steps etc. Our room was small but had everything you would need, the decor was fitting for the place and its surroundings. The maid came in every day and cleaned the bathroom and provided fresh towels and replenished any products used. The only thing we had a problem with was that the jacuzzi did not work however this didn't spoil anything! The restaurant was a little expensive, we paid 130 euros for a 2 course meal and bottle of wine, however it was gorgeous food and excellent service. We were also welcomed with a glass of champagne on arrival and the atmosphere and views were not to be missed. The inclusive breakfast was brilliant and served from 7.30 up to 10am, again the staff were helpful and polite. There was a great selection of food including fruit, cereal, yoghurts and croissants or danish pastries. Plentiful amounts of tea, coffee and fruit juices and also hard boiled eggs, selection of breads, cold meats and cherry tomatoes! All in all a lovely hotel, excellent location and somewhere we would return to!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: bellaroma10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic, the location is perfect, almost within the vatican city walls! The interior was amazing, our rooms were very italian with a gorgeous 4 poster bed and chez lounge. We thoroughly enjoyed exploring Rome from the comfort of our amazing hotel, I will recommend this hotel to frineds and family visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Vatican and street restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: DocManny
Reviews.Content: Within a five minute walk to St. Peter's Square. Two streets over filled with outside restaurants. The hotel has medium size rooms. The front desk staff and restaurant staff are friendly and helpful. My brother and his wife had to ask for bathroom soap, since it wasn't replaced. The breakfast is sufficient and acceptable, although the same everyday. Free shuttle from airport, but you need to pay to return to the airport. We would stay there again if we wanted to be close to the Vatican. Restaurant has a great view of St. Peter's.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but not that great either...”
Reviews.Author: idontlikechina
Reviews.Content: The airport pick up service was pretty nice, although I did have to call and then wait, but can't complain too much as it was free... I was slightly dissapointed by the room I was in, room 82 or something like that on the first floor, as it was small, desk chair broken, dark room, broken shower hose, but was in the back of the hotel and actually was pretty quiet for sleeping. Pillows a bit hard, bed had some rough spots too, Sat TV was nice and helped keep me up on that dang volcano that changed my plans for the week...But as they always say, you don't spend much time in the room... The restaurant was a bit over priced for what I ended up getting (dinner)...but I had just arrived that night and not ready to venture out too far, but my company paid for it, so no skin out of my pocket... Breakfast was not bad, but they could have done a better job restocking the buffet, as the selection seemed sparse and that was around the mid point through the breakfast period. But the view is pretty awesome, but to me, not worth spending my or my compay's $'s for a view that you can see by walking a few blocks and for "just OK" food... The best thing about the Atlante Star was the location. I found EVERYTHING within walking distance from this hotel. The first morning I took off and headed to St. Peter's, then to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, The Pantheon, a quick fly through Piazza Navonna, then back the Vatican Museum for my afternoon tour.
