The next day I headed over to ancient Rome, the Forum, Colusseum, Circus Maximus, and then back to the hotel to rebook flights and change business meetings around the volcano, then took a Hop on Hop Off Bus tour to see what I might have missed. I took advantage of the transportation for Euro 40 or so back to FCO, which is what a taxi costs, so that was worth it too...and is a great service that the hotel offers. I am considering another trip to Rome and even with the room experience, I haven't disqualified this hotel yet from being a possibility on that trip. I wish I would have asked to see some of their other rooms while I was there, as I know my wife would not be happy with a room like I had on this trip, but in all fairness, it was a basic room, so maybe their deluxe or higher end rooms are much nicer...

Reviews.Title: “Highly efficient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: dolls111
Reviews.Content: Spent one week at this hotel while in Rome; very efficient staff and concierge service; made the stay worry free and enjoyable. Location is excellent for getting about Rome. Bonus is the free pick-up from FCO airport and full breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel with excellent service ,location ,cleanliness, and value”
Reviews.Author: eentante
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a short walk from the Vatican and has easy access to the Metro. It's location adds to the charm of Rome with its boutiques and charming restaurants close at hand. Upon arrival the staff extends warm and courteous service. The hotel is extremely clean and welcoming and offers several ammenities such as a free airport shuttle (one way and a reasonable return charge to the airport), internet accessability ,and a roof top terrace with stunning views. The room was very clean and the bathroom was very clean and spacious. The Atlante Star exceeded all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fronk58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Rome with our children and grandchildren (11 total) to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. It is a short walk from the hotel to St. Peter's and Castel Sant Angelo, and about a half hour walk to other major sites. Public buses are minutes away for rides to the Colosseum, Roman Forum and other attractions. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and most accommodating. In September my wife and I are returning to Rome and have booked the Atlante Star once again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to discover Rome”
Reviews.Author: nabilouou
Reviews.Content: We decided to book the Hotel because it is close to the main Rome sights (the Vatican, St Angelo Castle, Villa Borghese) and Colosseum where you can get to by Metro without making changes. The area where the hotel is located was safe to enjoy walking and eating out late at night. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff is nice and really helpful. The breakfast with a view on St Peter's church is a unique and unforgettable experience. So we would recommend you this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernArizona
Reviews.Content: Hotel had helpful, courteous staff. Room was very clean. Great views. Great location...close to the Vatican. Shuttle from Airport was very convenient. Will definitely stay here on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: GoRangers1
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! Do not waste your money here. Overpriced. Not a 4 star hotel, more like 2 star hotel. Small rooms. Thin walls. 1 small elevator. Unfriendly staff. No irons. 12 euros each for breakfast. Transfer to and from hotel/airport was supposed to be free but we paid 20 euros each. 4 euros for 1 hour internet. 10 euros for 6 hour internet. Do not stay here! Do not waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: JustDaveLongBeach_CA
Reviews.Content: The very kind, experienced and patient staff of Atlante Star played a very large part in making our 25th Anniversary Trip to Rome the huge success it was. No matter how many times we needed tips, assistance or questions answered, they were unhesitatingly warm, helpful, friendly and patient. A top notch hotel with a top notch staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, nice room, tiny elevator & narrow hallways”
Reviews.Author: Comfam
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at Hotel Atlante Star. The location is walking distance from most of Rome's famous attractions, including the Vatican. The complimentary breakfast service was also wonderful. My biggest criticisms were the tiny elevator and narrow hallways made it difficult to move luggage around other guests. The service was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a fake smile”
Reviews.Author: aussietrek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome for a conference and stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. First the positives: Great location! 3 minute walk from the Vatican and within a half hour walk from every other major tourist attraction in Rome. But Rome is a walkable city so this is probably true for most hotels. Suite was reasonably sized by European standards. Having said that, we did get a suite so I'm not sure what the standard rooms are like. Now the negatives: First, the hotel offers a free pick-up service and told us they'd be waiting with a sign when we arrived. They were two hours late picking us up! We were arriving from Canada after 2 flights and a total of 15 hours of travel on an overnighter, so waiting in the airport for 2 hours was about the last thing we needed. We called and they kept saying "the driver will be there in 20 mintes." On the phone we were told that traffic was bad, which turned out to be untrue. In fact, the driver told us he had to wait to pick up passengers on a second incoming flight that arrived just as the driver arrived. The traffic was perfectly fine in both directions. Second, the beds are not comfortable.They are cheap mattresses and much less than I would expect from a four-star hotel. Third, the breakfasts are not great. Some boiled eggs, pastries, a bit of cheese, and yogurt. I have nothing to compare it to in Rome but we opted to eat out. Fourth, it's noisy! The hotel overlooks a busy street and the rooms facing the street get a lot of noise. If you are a light sleeper this is NOT the hotel for you! Finally, on our return trip to the airport the hotel offers a transfer for 40 Euros for 2 people. We should have learned our lesson from our pick-up experience, but instead we signed up for the hotel transfer. Because it was Good Friday, we booked a transfer to leave 3 before our flight. We got a call in our hotel room half an hour before we were to leave saying that the traffic was terrible and we had to leave early. So we rushed around to get all our stuff together and ran downstairs. The driver sped to the airport but there was no traffic at all. We asked why he was rushing and he told us that he had to pick up passengers from an incoming flight (probably people who had been waiting 2 hours for their pick-up!). We realized they lied to us about the reason for leaving early and were doing this for their own convenience, and not ours. In short, we would not stay at this hotel again nor would we recommend it. Given the cost and the rating, we expected much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of cleanliness and dated interiors.”
Reviews.Author: DevonPanda
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Atlante Star was memorable but for all the wrong reasons. Our first room, a deluxe option(304) that we paid more for, was extremely small with a tiny wardrobe which meant we couldn't unpack our bags. The room had been refurbished a year ago, we were told, and there was a year's worth of dust. I had to clean the headboard of the bed it was so thick with dust you could write your name in it. The extractor fan in the bathroom was clogged with thick grey grime. The lampshades were covered in dust too. We complained but were told we had the best room available. On our third night the water stopped working and we had to be moved to another room (84) This was grotty the room had a smell of damp, especially in the bathroom. It was cold and not clean. I found toe nail clippings from a previous client on the carpet, yuck! We complained again and were given a heater (the heating and air conditioning didn't work in either room) and treated to a visit from the porter to vacuum the floor. We saw several rooms as friends were staying there too, the interior design was based firmly in the 70's and very tired. We spotted bare wires, broken plugs etc. The breakfast was basic, though the restaurant has a fabulous view of the vatican. This is not a four star hotel by any stretch of the imagination, the staff were generally friendly and we did receive an apology from one of the management team and a free transfer back to the airport. The roof garden a big selling point on the website is still closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Beds. Great Service. Great Jacuzzi Tub. Great ride from Airport”
Reviews.Author: jendbe1
Reviews.Content: After traveling a great distance, it is nice to have included in your hotel stay an airport pick up. This set the tone for the excellence in service from the Hotel. They promptly checked us in (even though we were very early). At no charge they contacted our tour operator for an independently booked tour to Pompeii to schedule a door to door pick up for the early morning tour the next day. They provided us with maps and directions to sites. And, a GREAT big old jacuzzi tub in our room. TOTALLY great pick and totally value oriented. Moments away from the Vatican and from the Metro Station. Very excellent. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for senior travellers.”
Reviews.Author: NHtoFL
Reviews.Content: Staff was attentive and took care of rental car. Close enough to Vatican Museums and St. Peters for all except poorest walkers. View from rooftop lounge was fantastic. Breakfast and dinner very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service and Tourist friendly”
Reviews.Author: retiredhealthcare
Reviews.Content: We did not use a travel Agent when we booked this hotel-our first time in Europe. We looked at their internet website and what caught our attention was their location very close to the Vatican. They have a webcam and you can see the Vatican. Their staff answered our questions via the internet and helped us with transfers from the airport and to the Cruise port. This is a four star hotel in all respects. The food in their dining room was excellent and all their staff were most helpful and understood english.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reddibear
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights in this hotel, great location for all the sights of rome the room was cleaned every day if you are looking to eat out in rome and want to save money go to the smaller back street bars We had most of our meals in one of the main streets it cost around 70 euros each time

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: JellybeanGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia last minute for a 3 night break in Jan 2010. I had been to Rome before and wanted to stay near the Vatican City end this time. The hotel has a free pick up from Fiumcino airport which was great, and you can arrange a pick up for your return for 40 euros per couple which actually works out pretty reasonable if comparing it to the train fare from the Termini station since there is absolutley no hassle getting to the airport this way. The hotel decor was very nice (looked like it had not long been done up), and there was a TV in the room with English speaking channels and news etc. Jan was obviously a quiet time, but there was no noise in the hotel at night time. Free safe in the room. Reception staff very knowledgeable and helpful. Breakfast room and restaurant look over St Peter's Basillica which is a plus point for the hotel. It is easy to get around from this hotel and is close to Ottavania metro station which I would recomend people use to get themselves to the Colosseum end of town. 1 euro a trip on the metro is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful quiet location, shame about the noisy refridgerator in the room.”
Reviews.Author: peppermintpoppy
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were greeted imediatley, the staff were friendly and keen to help with any problems or queries we might have had, we waited only 5minutes for the room to be available and were shown straight there our bags taken for us. The room was small and quite dark, the shutters were heavy and when they were closed it was impossible to see anything in the room and we had to rely on feeling our way to the bathroom at night, the room had a refrigerator that was incredibly noisy, the noise would start and get extremely loud, enough to wake us from sleep and then die down and it did this nightly every 20minutes... the noise from the elevator was also quite disturbing.. Overall i feel i didnt sleep very satisfactory due to these reasons. Breakfast was pleasant with again very friendly staff, the room was amazing and the views of St Peters and the Vatican were amazing, really nice wake up view. The food selection was pastries, meats and bread with cereal, yoghurts, tea, coffee and fresh fruit, very tasty. The location of the hotel is perfect for those who want the hussle and busle of busy Rome during the day, and a retiring quiet neighbourhood in the evening, there arent too many restaraunts imidiately close to the hotel but a 10 minute walk leads back to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful and trustworthy.”
Reviews.Author: Travellingsakick
Reviews.Content: The location is perfekt. All the most famous buildings are in walking range. The breakfast is very good with a perfekt view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: marktree
Reviews.Content: The service, room and food were excellent. The location to the Vatican is great --- easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Kzego
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located for visiting the Vatican City. Also, it is a good brisk walk from the ancient city. I found the hotel staff to be very pleasant, and in one instance to be very helpful when it came to selecting a restaurant for the evening. I found the room to be very small and the bath/shower to be even smaller. However, the fact that they had Sky TV which allowed me to watch the Major League Baseball World Series and even NFL's games.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phantomjww
Reviews.Content: We stayed there prior to a cruise. We waited for the airport shuttle about 1 1/2 hours to arrive even after calling. When it did arrive, we loaded and then had to wait while the driver went to another terminal to pick up others. Hotel was okay. It was very warm in Rome and the room was hot and hard to get fresh air. Location was nice and close to Vatican City and to shopping. The view of the dome is great from the restaurant. Breakfast was well done, ample and many options. I would stay there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GregKl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice hotel close to the Vatican this is where you need to be. The staff speak English very well and are very helpful in anything that you need. When they say they are at your disposal they mean it. The hotel is very clean and I would suggest it to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel and I cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: DougHeatherLouisiana
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled with my two teenage daughters(13&16) to Rome arriving November 21, 2009. Upon arrival, we were picked up at the airport and delivered to the hotel at no cost as promised. We knew that we were close to the Vatican, but when we opened the shutters from our room, there was St Peters in all its glory. It seemed we could almost reach out and touch it. The family room was great as they separated our daughters from my wife and I. The room and bathroom were clean. The breakfast was very good and made much better by the incredible view of St Peter's. On our first full day, we walked to the colliseum and all points in between from the hotel. We have nothing bad to say. If you are going to Rome, you need to consider this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stunning restaurant view!”
Reviews.Author: SRSmithBroadstairs
Reviews.Content: Definitely I would recommend this Hotel for its location and convenience. As a first time visitor to Rome the view from the Restaurant was stunning and the general location suited the purpose of our trip superbly. All staff very courteous and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spring break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ABFrench
Reviews.Content: This break was booked as a surprise for a special birthday for my husband and the hotel and Rome itself lived up to our expectations. We would certainly go back to the hottel and recommend others to stay there. We found a couple of nice restaurants close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So close to the Vatican you can see St. Peter's as you have breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: aztecmyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept.26-29. I had booked though Priceline and was originally given the Atlante Garden Hotel, the sister hotel close by, but was switched to this hotel when we checked in. The ACs were nice and cold in the room, and you could buy internet. It was a large corner room, with a nice bathroom. However, the bed was two beds pushed together. This was fine since they didn't split apart as we slept. Breakfast was good and the restaurant had a wonderful view of St. Peter's Basilica. We could never go to the rooftop garden. I'm not sure why it was closed. It's a 10 min walk to the Ottaviano metro station. There's a little convenience store near by where you can buy soda and water for under €1, just in case you're tired of spending €3 everywhere else. The best thing about this place is that it had Sky sports on the television, so I could watch some NFL games as we ended our day.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights there and one was hell”
Reviews.Author: frezz
Reviews.Content: This is a review filled with very mixed feelings. We booked this hotel for 3 rooms on priceline. We had been driving throughout Italy but decided to return our rental cars early before we got to Rome. The hotel was kind enough to pick us up at the airport and bring us to the hotel. When we got to the Star I told them my reservations were at the Garden, their sister hotel. The desk clerk then told me that they had no hot water at the other hotel so we were switched here. I knew this was most likely untrue (and that was confirmed to me later on) since I have seen so many reviews of these 2 hotels switching people back and forth. We brought our luggage to the rooms and mine was very hot. I turned the ac on but it was so stifiling in there that I got on the bed to check the vents. Nothing. I told the front desk and they said a collegue would be up to fix it. The front desk clerk kept telling us about the wonderful restaurant on the top floor for dinner. Tired, and not wanting to go in search of a meal at 9 pm at night, we went up there. This was the biggest disappointment and costliest mistake of our trip. The food was expensive and bad. Only one of the 6 enjoyed their meal. The staff, upset at our attire, even though we asked the host if we should change and he said no, ignored us and was slow even by European standards. We ordered drinks with our dinner and didn't get them until we got the bill (we sent them back). I was sick the rest of the night and my husband was sick all morning. Upon returning to our room the ac was not fixed but a window was open. The front desk clerk, a new one, told us it was broken and there was nothing to be done as both hotels were fully booked (I guess the hot water was fine now huh?). He handed me a fan and said too bad. There were no outlets the fan could work in as both the plug and its adapter didn't fit anything inthe room. The room was on the first floor and facing the busy street. Between my husband and i we got 2 hours of sleep and roasted. I have never been so angry at a hotel in my life. The next day we were able to change rooms and that issue was solved. We were charged for the shuttle back to the airport the following day although they had originally told us it was free both ways. the barmaid, the hardest working person in the hotel, was excellent and pleasant even when being run ragged. The second night room change and the help with the shuttle from the airport is the only reason this hotel is not getting a lower mark. Go to the restaurant for the free breakfast but skip it for dinner. Be prepared that when you book here you may not wind up staying here and that everything they say may sound pleasant and reasonable, but may be a very large lie.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: platti1950
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, excellent location and wonderful view of St Peters’ from the rooftop restaurant. Stayed in room 308 (3 twin beds), room was clean and while facing the street the windows/shutters kept out much of the street noise. Breakfast was nice but would have like a variety in the types of eggs served, not very fond of hard boiled eggs every morning. Still one of the best breakfast buffets around. Reception was always helpful and polite. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ivy83
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently came back from our trip to Europe. We stayed at Atlante Star for 3 nights in Rome. The best element is definitely the location. We walked to the Vatican, Castel d'Angelo, Piazza Navona (maybe 20 walk?), the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese. The Colosseum and area will require metro. We had room 301. It was clean, no view of the St. Peter's but it was expected since we got an excellent deal with Expedia. A pleasant surprise was the TV! It had English channels! We didn't venture out at night past 9pm so it was good evening entertainment. The buffet was not as good as expected.... I guess the reviews from Tripadvisor kept our expectations too high. I know it is probably the wrong place to say this but I have recommend a local restaurant, 2 mins down the street from the hotel. It's the one with dark blue and yellow table cloth. It was the best tasting and value restaurant we found during our whole trip! The pasta was excellent! One note of caution, do NOT ask the reception for a restaurant recommendation. The one we went to was BAD... they charged us 4 Euro for "reservation fees". The shuttle to the airport was a bonus. We would most likely stay here again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Alright but highly overrated”
Reviews.Author: Bellafemina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlante Star and the only thing that I personally liked about this Hotel was the terrance view. The rooms were okay but small. I didn't personally like that everytime I had to leave the hotel I had to give the reception my room key. To me that didn't sit very well as i had all my important documents locked away in my luggage as i had no choice cause the room did not come with a safe. Found out later in my stay in Italy that every hotel i stayed at they require that you give them the room key...weird.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Huande
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel following a recommendation by a family friend. Nice, quiet (although close to a street, the windows seal off any noise). Room was very small, but that's seems to be common in Rome esp in the old town. The Location is great - 10min walking distance from the St. Peter's Dome and Vatican Museum, etc. The restaurant/breakfast room has an unbeatable view - enjoyed the simple but good breakfast. Staff was helpful, esp for a lost and found issue. We made use of the complementary airport pick-up which worked out very well... otherwise might have been bit hard to find, esp when the first time in Rome. Would seriously consider this for my next Rome stay.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL ATLANTE STAR IS A STAR!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: littlelucydog
Reviews.Content: The HOTEL ATLANTE STAR made my first visit to ROME amazing!!!!!! The staff is EXCELLENT!!!! They also spoke English very well. They have a driver to pick you up from the airport which was a HUGE benefit. The staff gave me a walking map and even told me what tours to take. I over slept for one tour and a member of the staff was kind enough to make the tour wait on me and he came up to my room to awake me. The view from the restaurant of the free breakfast is lovely! Make sure to go eat breakfast up there every morning and enjoy coffee and the view. They do not have free wireless, so be prepared to pay for internet service. The room consist of just a bed, side table and a small desk with a t.v...very simple yet very traditional. I enjoyed sleeping with my window open and feeling the breeze. HOTEL ATLANTE STAR made my first time to Italy a trip I will never forget. Just ask the friendly staff any questions and they will be there to make your trip as GREAT as mine!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome was fabulous - Hotel Atlante Star just right for our needs”
Reviews.Author: geoff_hodson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely presented and we were lucky to have a standard suite - basically two adjourning rooms, which was just right for our family. Staff were all very friendly and helpful especially the cleaning lady who spoke good English. Breakfast was dissapointing as it was adverised as "Full breakfast"....but turned out to be a cold buffett. The plumbing could also do with an overhaul.....but all in all we had a brilliant time. Rome is just one of the most splendid cities in the world .....well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Star is a very good hotel and has a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rudy004
Reviews.Content: The staff is very polite and professional! The hotel has a very good location! The breakfast was nice and tasty. There was a lot of choice. There was fresh fruit and also a variety of cornflakes, yoghurt and sandwiches. The rooms are ok and clean. When you have your breakfast, you have a great view at the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoverHouston
Reviews.Content: Middle of the road was my experience. We had 3 rooms booked. They gave this in the same floor. But one of the rooms was reeking of smoke. When we complained, the guy from the reception came and told me it doesn't smell of smoke. But luckily gave us another room. Only issue was it was a little room on the 4th floor. The rooms were clean. The bathroom was very little so was the room. The A/C was not working very well. We were there for 2 nights. We had to pay to go to the airport. They advertised for free pickups but didn't happen. The location is great. That is the one positive thing about this hotel. Their common areas were great though. They had WII for the kids to play and nice comfortable chairs to sit in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was everything I could hope for for my 1st international trip!”
Reviews.Author: luketich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Atlante Star. When you book on line you can't help but have some doubt if everything is as shown. It is and it was! From picking us up at the airport (no charge), very clean room, very nice staff, complimentary bottle of Spumanti, wonderful breakfasts...need I say more! Everyone one so helpful and there was no language barrier. We were amazed at the location, too. We would look out our window and see St Peter's Basillica. Easy access to metro and trains. Lots of great little cafe's close by. We would not hesitate to stay at the Atlante Star again!!!! They only downside was that the room was pretty small, but we expected that!

Reviews.Title: “No way a 4 star, would NOT return”
Reviews.Author: Sn00pycat
Reviews.Content: We walked into our tiny tiny room, with strange fabric walls that were so thin! There were no drawers whatsoever to put clothes in, the TV was sat on what can only be described as an old metal filing cabinet. The 'jacuzzi bath' was just a small normal bath with knobs on it, 2 of which were broken. The AC wasn't working until we told the front desk and then it worked. Very dark room as windows have shutters over them and we had to keep them closed because of the cold, the view when we did have a look outside was of the brick wall of the building next door. After a while we did just see it as somewhere to sleep and it felt cosy, but first impressions were not good and for what there was, it's a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “A view to die for with service and ammenities to match!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Deal-Guru
Reviews.Content: The impeccable service, friendliness of the staff, the restaurant with exquisite food and an incredible view of the city and St. Peter's Basilica, made this the perfect hotel choice for our first trip to Rome. The room was as described and lovely in its almost historic Venetian décor, had a huge bathroom by European standards and one of the only tubs we encountered on our 16 day trip throughout Italy. The room was also very clean, was maintained every day with fresh towels and linens, had A/C, a mini-fridge, and even though was located close to the elevator, the room was virtually soundproof; we never heard our neighbors or traffic in the hallway. The breakfast at Les Etoiles was as photographed on their website and probably the best we experienced on our trip. The view was incredible and there wasn't a bad seat in the house in which to overlook Rome as you calmly started your day by eating incredible pastry, meats, cheeses and breads while staring at St. Peter's Basilica. The best service had to be the complimentary airport shuttle service from FCO to the Hotel. I would have been lost without this service. Finally, the front desk staff was always there for you if you needed help and were extremely accommodating. I would stay here again and have already recommended this hotel to friend and family.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Dave164
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Atlante Star, Rome in May. Found hotel very welcoming and friendly. Brilliant location, able to walk or bus to most attractions. Restaurant was fabulous,amazing views, really felt in the centre of it all. Breakfast was relaxed and lots of it! Disappointed that roof terrace was closed due to repair. Would definately go back if only to sit on roof terrace! Free airport pick- ups a real bonus, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “delightfully authentic true European style hotel -spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: NYsLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome. We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. The hotel is a European city hotel which is so different than American hotels. It has the modern conveniences of hair dryers, internet service, wireless area, flat screen tv, etc but do not expect it to look like a Sheridan, Hilton or another American modern large scale hotel. The hotel is old and it looks old. (It reminded me of some of the hotels we stayed in Ireland.) The heavy room keys hang behind the desk with classic burgundy tassels. You return them to the desk each time you leave the hotel. The halls and room was set up so differently than an American hotel, at first I was apprehensive until I remembered that if I wanted to have an American hotel experience, I should have stayed in America in a Holiday Inn. I noticed that the rooms and public areas were very clean. The marble stairs and floors gleamed, no dust in any corner. The front desk clerk was so helpful. He called to confirm all our tour arrangement and helped us solve a tour mix-up. Since we don't speak Italian this was invaluable.He advised us on where to find local places to eat and how to walk to local tourist attractions. We loved the breakfast include package. It was served buffet style in the beautiful 6 floor restaurant with a view. The garden top floor was closed due to renovations so we did not see this area. This hotel is located an easy 15 minutes stroll from the Vatican Museums and St. Peters Square.It was delightful to walk to the square in the evening and enjoy looking at St Peters Basilica in twilight . We found many restaurants and sidewalk cafes about two blocks in either direction. I did not experience any of the negative aspects that I read about in other reviews. If this is your first trip to Europe, you will find that the hotels (even the 4 or 5 star hotels) are not like the American hotels. Many are older that our country and they do not rip them down and build modern buildings. I enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: texoma22
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Atlante Star and would highly recommend it to anyone. The staff were very helpful and went above and beyond in helping us track down our luggage (which didn't arrive with us). They also arranged a shuttle service to take us to the port for our cruise. The free shuttle from the airport and the breakfast served at the hotel's restaurant were great plus we were within a few blocks of the Vatican and several other "must see" sights.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service by desk management. Stay away. Shady in a nutshell and I am Italian-American.”
Reviews.Author: tonymr21
Reviews.Content: First day they had to put us in a small cramped room because they didnt have the triple room we reserved. They did give us two rooms after complaining but they were going to try to get away with just giving us the cramped single room. The man who works the morning to afternoon shift at the front desk comes off as a shady individual. The next day we did get a nicer triple room and the cleaning lady Cristina was very nice. We woke up to banging and hammering as construction was going on in the hotel early in the morning. One day 8am and one day 6am. Talked to the front desk and they said no construction was going on in the hotel. They lied about it. I dont think anyone likes to be lied to. This definitely isnt a 4 star hotel. Maybe a 2 star only because of location. I stayed at a better hotel in Bologna and that hotel only charged 62 dollars a night and I trusted the front desk staff. The last night we called for a wake up call and the guy at the front desk never called us. I was prepared and set my cell phone to wake me up. This hotel is relying on the fact that they have a decent location near the vatican. I really think this adds to the poor service because they know they dont have to do much because people are going to book with them anyway. One good thing was breakfast on the 5th floor with a view but thats about it. Also the ROOF GARDEN IS CLOSED so dont book if you think your gonna go see a roof garden because your not. They arent gonna tell you this if you call them.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and within walking distance to Vatican City and Castel St. Angelo”
Reviews.Author: ajg114
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very pleased with our stay at Hotel Atlante Star. Our stay was during the second week in July. We had a very nice view of St. Peter's Basilica from our room's balcony. The room was small, yet clean and cozy. Room service came in and provided clean towels each day, made the beds, and emptied the waste baskets. The hotel staff was friendly and the desk clerks were always helpful (the desk clerks spoke English very well). There are only 2 English TV channels (which you will find in most Italian hotels) - CNN International and BBC World. You also have the option to pay to view various movies (in your language of choice). High-speed internet access is available at this hotel. 3 euros for 1/2 an hour and 5 euros for 1 hour. Once you pay at the front desk, the clerk will give you a code to access the internet. You have the option to use your own laptop which can be connected to the cable in your room or you can use the computer in the lobby (which is connected to a printer that you can print to for free -- a plus!). Ask about charges for telephone use before you use it. I tried to use my calling card and was still charged but didn't find out until check-out. The bathroom was very clean, yet narrow. The shower head can be used as a hand-held or kept mounted. Instead of being mounted on the side wall, the shower head is mounted on the wall directly across from the shower curtain. Be sure to press the shower curtain against the sides so the water doesn't end up on the floor (a problem we had particularly during the first day of use) because of where the shower head is mounted. But we got use to it after that. Breakfast is served every morning from 7 to 10AM on the 6th floor. The breakfast room provides a great panoramic view of the city including St. Peter's Basilica. Breakfast included foods such as croissants (plain and jelly filled), rolls (regular and wheat), jelly, honey, sliced cheese and meat, three or 4 cereals to choose from along with milk, yogurt, fruit; and drinks such as orange juice, pineapple juice and water (naturale or frizzante). I only wished there had been a way to warm up the bread and croissants; and the juice didn't taste like the OJ and pineapple juice that I am used to drinking. One day we noticed that the pineapple juice tasted a little watered down. But other than that, everything was nicely laid out and provided a nice selection of breakfast items. There is a supermarket around the corner from the hotel. Make a left outside of the hotel's main doors. Make a left at the corner (where the hotel's restaurant is located) and then make a left at the next corner. The supermarket is on the other side of the same block as the hotel. Here, you can shop like the locals. We found the best deal on bottled water -- 27 cents a bottle. There is a mini bar in the room where you can squeeze a few bottles in to keep cold (the items in the bar are overpriced and you can purchase your own at the supermarket for a better deal). You will hear a lot of noise throughout the night if your room is on the main road (Via G. Vitelleschi) which faces the Basilica, but you'll get use to it. After all of the walking during the day, you will probably be so tired and will quickly fall asleep like I did and the noise didn't even matter. It seems like the trash pick-up is done late at night which may be responsible for the majority of the noise. We got a great rate on this room because we stayed for 4 days. When you book in advance for 3 days or more, you receive 25% off your entire stay. The hotel is in a great location in Trastevere between Vatican City and Castel St. Angelo. These two attractions are in walking distance. The closest metro station is Occtaviano which allows you to reach other major attractions. Although the station isn't nearby, it's a nice walk down Via Occtaviano (maybe 15 minutes) which is filled with clothing and food shops. It may take you longer to get to the metro if you like to window shop. Stop by the Blue Ice gelateria for a nice gelato. My husband thinks their gelato is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location but within reach of all sights”
Reviews.Author: Vonular
Reviews.Content: Roof top terrace is closed until Sep 2009 but the restaurant still had lovely views of St Peters. We stayed in room 505 and it was very small but still nice. You have to walk about 15 mins to get to the main attractions but you walk everywhere in Rome anyway! Staff were very helpful and friendly - my only complaint would be that there wasn't an iron and ironing board for use in your room but only a chargeable laundry service. For pizza hit Baffetto 2 near Campo Di Fiori - fantastic pizza and cold beer For cocktails - we had a great time in On the Rox in the Trastervere region! Carlos is a legend! Eden tours were great for walking tours - highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Gardens-would come back and stay here”
Reviews.Author: Howlight
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our saty at Atlante Gardens. Excellent service, good location, especially for Vatican. We would stay here again. Howard

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: phototeacherfcps
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my daughter and her fiance's family. They booked the Atlante Garden but when I arrived that hotel told me they overbooked and had to move me to the Atlante Star a couple of blocks away. I knew I was in trouble when my daughter saw the room and said it was 10 times better than the one she had at the Atlante Garden. I was shocked by how small the room was. I could barely maneuver around the bed. I had read earlier views on this hotel and expected the worst, but it seemed adequately clean. The wall to wall mirrors were a bit much and the room was VERY dark. It felt like a sensory deprivation chamber. and I did manage to fall asleep..UNTIL the guests in the next room started a conversation. I woke up thinking there were others in the room. The walls must be made of cardboard. My daughter and I spent one night in Florence and that hotel (the Davanzati) was so amazing, we regretted having to return to this place. The front desk staff were professional and courteous. Maybe they read all of the horrible reviews about them on this site? In any event, there are better places to stay in Rome. This should be a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Belissimo!”
Reviews.Author: licensed2party
Reviews.Content: Our dinner at the LesEtoiles restaurant was a memory to last a life time. The Chianti Sirloin was the best steak I've ever had in Europe. The view is marvelous, and the staff attentive. We had a 2004 Chianti Riserva from a label called Carpineta. It was the best bottle of wine I've ever had. I strongly recommend dinner here when in Rome. It is simply a must.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch, Italian Style”
Reviews.Author: Austin2SanDiego
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room for one night through Continental Airlines. I did research and had a whole plan, with my base being the Atlante Garden Hotel. Then everything went wrong. The driver was no where to be found when picking me up at the airport, once he was located he actually yelled at me for missing him. Checked in, got to my TINY room (couldn't even walk all the way around the bed), felt pressured to tip the man who walked me to my room because he stood there looking at me until I did tip him, and then went outside to wait for my car service as I had planned a quick private tour. No car, I phoned the company, they said they are waiting outside. This is when I realized I was at the WRONG HOTEL. Obviously, I went in to speak with the manager, who would not be on duty until morning and the man at the desk refused to answer any of my questions (which is pretty important given I am at the wrong hotel). Long story short: there was a large group that needed more rooms at the Garden Hotel, so they moved my reservation (never letting me know this). The manager stressed that I was at the better of the hotels and offered to pay for my dinner (although I was leaving that afternoon). I hated my room. The service was unmentionably bad. The breakfast was very nice and the view from the dining room was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DfwFrog74
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near the Vatican, only a 5 minute walk to the Vatican and maybe 8 minutes to the subway - if you don't stop and shop. Staff was great, communication was excellent. Bath rooms small compared to American hotels. Breakfast was a continental breakfast that was served from 7 to 10 and had lots of bread, cheeses, etc. Lots of places to eat near by. A great place to visit is the Vatican Necropolis which is located under St. Peters Basilica but get tix several months in advance they only do 10 tours a day with 12 to 15 people in each. Have fun

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel close to Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: traveldog59
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Atlante Star is within walking distance of Vatican City and offers a spectacular view of St. Peter's from it's rooftop restaurant. The rooms are large by European standards and were clean and comfortable. The staff couldn't have friendlier or more helpful. Very enjoyable stay. The free shuttle from the airport is a plus although you may have to wait for it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - great location but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Phil_uk51
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a free arrival transfer from Rome FCO airport, which is very handy, albeit that we had to wait about half an hour for our pre-booked driver to meet us. The hotel is fairly uninspiring from the outside and could do with a refresh. Location wise this hotel is ideal as it is about a 5-10 minute walk to St Peter's square and the Vatican, and not much more than 30 mins walk to even the furthest of the central attractions. It is a little away from the main tourist strips meaning you don't feel hassled the moment you step out of the hotel. The location is really what you are paying for. The room itself was a real disappointment. We had booked a 'superior double', but am not sure how this differed to the standard room. First of all we were given a twin room, but the hotel did change that for a double when we asked. The rooms are very dark, meaning we had to have all the lights on whenever we were in the room. Our room was pretty small for a four star hotel, with none of the amenities you might expect like a room safe, robes or tea and coffee making facilities. The decor was not to our tastes and looks a little tired in places, it also adds to the feeling of a dark small room. The bathroom was adequate, though the toilet was a little close to the sink. The bath is probably too small for most people to comfortably have a bath in. The shower over the bath is good, although it is very easy to drench the entire bathroom in water whilst using it. We couldn't get the Sky to work, though admittedly didn't try very hard. The air conditioning was good, not too noisy and easy to control. Our room had a small balcony overlooking the unattractive back of the hotel. It had a table and single chair, along with some long dead window boxes. Fine if you had wanted to smoke, but not somewhere we wanted to spend any time. The views from the restaurant are excellent, probably the best part of the hotel. Breakfast is served up there which is a fairly standard continetal breakfast - fine but not outstanding. As many other reviewers have commented, the roof garden is closed until October. A real shame as the views would be spectacular, and a little dishonest that the hotel still hasn't updated its website to reflect this. You can use the roof garden at the Atlante Garden - we would suggest you don't bother, there are not really any views and there is no bar up there. Overall, the hotel is a little tired in places but is in a good location and has spectacular views from the restaurant. However, it is overpriced for what it is and we found the room a real disappointment. I would say it was a good 3 star, lower end of four star hotel and would be a good bet if it was priced accordingly. Unfortunately it is not and we wouldn't stay again - even at the "discounted" rate of £180 per night we felt we were overcharged for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL LOCATION - EXCELLENT SERVICE - VERY EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: rangeview
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at the Atlante Star Hotel, the first thing to strike you is the location rather than the look. Situated within a few minutes' walk of St Peters Basilica and the Vatican, there are few quality hotels in Rome that can boast such an idyllic proximity to almost everything. The exterior of the building is rather tired and would benefit from a facelift. Once inside though the splendour and quality of this hotel become clearly evident, although it is compact. Space is at a premium in central Rome so this is hardly surprising. Rooms all vary in size, but the decor is splendid and recently updated. Some of the larger rooms are very opulent, and if you have a choice then a 4th or 5th floor room overlooking St Peters is a must. A few have small balconies, which allow you to stand outside and enjoy the hustle bustle of Rome street life. For the light sleepers who prefer to sleep with the window/door open the noise outside may be a distraction, although this is only really relevant in the rooms at the front of the hotel. Those to the side and back are much quieter, although do not offer the classic Roman views. Rooms are climate controlled, though the effectiveness of these systems is doubtful and may become a problem in the height of summer. May is an idyllic time to visit Rome as the weather and temperatures are perfect. The most extraordinary feature of the Atlante Star is the top floor restaurant which has majestic and breathtaking views over Rome, most notably St Peters and the Vatican. The breakfasts are well presented with hot hard boiled eggs being the only addition to a traditional continental breakfast. The restaurant is also open to the public for dinner and has an apparently excellent reputation although we didn't eat there as there are thousands of lovely restaurants around the city, many within a few minutes' walk. Meal prices are generally good, although it does pay to look around and check the menus before committing as a few restaurants may charge significantly higher prices. The service in the Atlante Star is excellent, as they work hard to make your stay a pleasant one. We judge hotels by how they respond to problems, rather than whether they are perfect all the time. The Atlante Star is a high quality, smart and excellently positioned hotel that really responds to the typical minor hiccups any stay will have. The only real criticism of this hotel is regarding the price as rooms can exceed 400 Euros a night, which is high wherever you are in the world. Negotiate with the reservations department and they are often flexible enough to offer discounted and group rates. Beware though that the sister hotel, the Atlante Garden, which is just a block away, is far inferior in every way to the Star. It may be classified as 4 Star but certainly is not, and more like 2 or 3 Star. Some guests are placed in the Garden Hotel when they think they have booked into the Star, so ensure you confirm where your room is located when booking. The only thing the Garden has are larger rooms for small families, so if the hotel can only locate you in the Garden insist on eating breakfast in the Star to enjoy the spectacular view. Finally a few minor words of warning: firstly, the roof terrace on the Atlante Star is closed for refurbishment until October 2009. This is a real shame as the views are almost certainly second to none in Rome. The Garden has a roof terrace but the views are very limited. Secondly, the hotel website for the Atlante Garden uses many photos from the Atlante Star which is very misleading and can wreck expectations if you have decided to stay in the slightly cheaper Atlante Garden. Thirdly and finally, the hotel does offer a free transfer from FCO airport (and not any other Rome airport), but will charge 42 Euros (for 1 passenger) and 48 Euros (for 2 passengers) for the return leg. If you do not want to use the good underground and rail service to the airport then this option is quite expensive, albeit convenient. In conclusion, the Atlante Star hotel is excellent in almost all areas and could not be better positioned for access to many marvellous sights, restaurants and bars. The price is quite steep, although this IS Rome and one of the most wonderful cities in the World, so 'nothing comes for nothing' in this day and age. Treat yourselves to one of the top floor suites overlooking St Peters and the rest of Rome, and when the roof terrace is open, relax in the open air with panoramic views of the whole of Rome and suck in the atmosphere and history of such a marvellous city. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Its all about location in Rome and Atlante has it”
Reviews.Author: BobWellesley_Ma_
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights at hotel. Had a chance to walk by many of the hotels recommended in Rome. We were given an upgrade when we complained about the size and location on the backside of the hotel. The rooms on the street and on floors 3 and 4 cannot be beat for views of the Vatican. Would definetly go again if we could be assured of one of the larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Jen71a
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice bath! That's about it really. The main reason we chose this hotel was the roof garden which was closed and there was no information about that either on the hotel website or in the hotel. i had to go and ask why the lift would not go up to the 6th floor. However we were able to use the roof garden of the nearby Atlante Garden where we were in fact booked to stay but were moved without notice or explanation. It was good to be collected by the airport mini bus and that was a bonus on arrival as was the fact that the room was ready on our arrival at 11 a.m. The room was tiny! There were 4 of us and we had 2 rooms next to each other, both incredibly cramped. The worst part of the holiday for me was that my IPOD and English money were stolen from my locked room during the 1st day there. Both were hidden away in drawers and cupboards. The guy at reception was not overly sympathetic and gave me an insurance claim form to fill in and directions to the police station. We also had an ant problem in both rooms during the week which the reception did nothing about even though I went and complained. Breakfast was dull (i.e. each day was the same) but adequate but the view was amazing. i would not recommend this hotel for the money - it certainly was NOT a 4 star hotel! One last thing - the hotel did a special offer lunch on the Friday - excellent value - 3 courses £50 per head! Needless to say we did not try it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome in a day”
Reviews.Author: Backpackit
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with transportation from the airport upon arrival included which was a plus. Driver on time. We stayed in a junior suite which included a king bed, flat screen tv. Bed pretty much took up all the space of that room with two end tables but was tastefully decorated a pleasant. Bath was not huge but was more than adequate with a jacuzzi tub and enclosed shower within. There was an additional sitting room with flat screen with desk, small piece of furniture to hang clothes and an additional sleigh style day bed. Certainly fine for a shorter stay. Staff was very, very helpful and spoke English. Did not see the breakfast which was included however.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Vatican, solid 2star hotel, free FCO transfer a plus”
Reviews.Author: soxfan401
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2nights 3-5APR09, were happy to find it only a 5min walk to the Vatican area where we spent our first 2 days touring Rome. At DaVinci airport (FCO) we were promptly met by the van driver for our free inbound transfer to the hotel. He spoke virtually no English so it was a boring 1hr ride to the hotel. We'd hoped to have someone more animated - and at least bilingual - to point out all the areas we transited. At reception, they had our room ready early - before 10am - which was a tremendous gift, we'd had almost no sleep on the 9hr flight. The room was newly decorated - in black/brown/grey tones - which made the small room seem even tinier. There was a quite comfortable king bed, with a window which opened - to a noisy street below. Horns and sirens could be heard all night long, even with windows closed. The bathroom was big enough for only 1 person at a time - with a shower "door" which swung both ways over the tub, making for a watery mess every time the shower was used. BIG UPSIDE- breakfast was served in the rooftop ENCLOSED dining room. There were plenty of choices - meats, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit with delicious croissants and coffee - overlooking a skyline full of Rome's rooftops, including St Peter's Basilica, the view was breathtaking! The outdoor rooftop terrace which is featured on this hotel's advertising is closed until further notice; the front desk person said there were bureaucratic problems with repairs being done. Only the front desk staff spoke English fluently; the bellmen, driver, breakfast waiter did not. IMPORTANT NOTE-- As our room was located at the far end of a long maze-like hallway, this hotel would not meet US Fire/Safety standards; there was no fire escape with reasonable access near our room. For hearty walkers, if you are looking for prime location near Vatican City (5mins), to Trastevere (15mins), Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain (20mins). Overall, this hotel is a fair value, especially with the free ride in from the airport, meets the need for a decent hotel in a safe, walkable are with plenty of restaurant choices within walking distance. Just keep expectations at a minimum and you'll likely be pleased with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: etldoret
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, cordial and very friendly and helpful staff! I would recommend the Atlante Star to anyone and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: pwaytraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Atlante Star and cant say enough about what a great hotel it was, what a great staff it had, what wonderful facilities it included and what a perfect location. The hotel provided a free pickup service at the airport and zipped us to the hotel. We arrived in the very early morning but the hotel provided us with our rooms anyway. The front desk was extremely helpful in setting up tours, guiding us to great restaurants and answering even the dumbest of questions. The view from of our rooms of St. Peter's Basilica was second to none and the rooftop restaurant in addition to great food had an unbelievable view. I have already recommended the hotel to several friends and recommend it to anyone who wishes to be taken care of during their stay like they were at home.

Reviews.Title: “do not believe what you see on the internet”
Reviews.Author: skoda08
Reviews.Content: hotel staff very arrogant not at all helpfull. breakfast poor ,booked a superior room got a very basic small double room. when went to see manager to complain was told you do not get what you book asked for an early morning call which we did not get when we went to see the manager no appology. in my oppinion do not bother with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Europeanpass
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Star is everything its website boasts: great view of the Vatican from its charming rooftop restaurant, very good atypical European breakfast, and friendly staff eager to assist you. Two blocks over from one of the main, and affordable, shopping streets, the Atlante Star is well-situated close to the Tiber river and 5 minutes from the Vatican and several other attractions. A walk to the Coloseum takes about 20 mins., but is doable on a nice day; the Spanish steps however, and Trevi Fountain require an extra 20. Rooms are very small, but have full bathrooms and satellite TV. There are no clocks or radios in the rooms so bring your own alarm clocks if scheduling is important. The staff went out of their way to assist us, including calling nearby restaurant staff to meet us in the street to show us the way to dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Not again!”
Reviews.Author: orish1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for me and my wife for a nice weekend in Rome, Its not cheap but the location very close to the Vatikan very cool. The hotel is famous for his roof view to the Vatikan. But. The yhave no running internet. On a saturday evening their internet connection said 'number of simultaneuos users limit exed'. A 4 star hotel and not enough internet fpr the guests? This is middle age! The food in their famous restaurant was horrible. I ordered a beef fillet and got a steak and not a fillet. They have no late check out. The rooms are very small and have not enough space for your cloth also not the bath room. On saturday morning they had workers making big noise at 8(!) o'clock. In a 4 star hotel? Oh, I didnt believe. Summary - I will go there twice. Never.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you came to Rome for...and more!”
Reviews.Author: greatitalytravels
Reviews.Content: My criteria for a good hotel in Rome is location, comfort, hospitality. Atlante Star gets high marks all around. From the moment we arrived, my niece and I basked in the warmth of this hotel starting with the Reception Staff who sent us immediately to our room with a friendly porter. Bathroom was small but attractive with its own window. Wardrobe was quite adequate for two and we were able to organize our belongings and keep out of each other's way. I really like the corner street location of this hotel, quiet, yet an easy two-block walk to a major piazza & bus hub (Risorgimento). But you don't need a bus or taxi since you can walk to many points of interest, crossing the river to Piazza Navonna and beyond. In P. Risorgimento you'll find a terrific little pizzeria where you order by the piece from a dozen tempting varieties. The sun encouraged us in late November to lunch at an outdoor table. The hotel is between Castel S. Angelo and St. Peter's. Just around the corner to Via Porta Castello (becomes Borgo Pio) leads straight to St. Peter's. You'll pass past two great little trattorias, where you'll want to return for lunch or dinner: La Pancia Felice (the Happy Tummy) and Arlu` at Borgo Pio, 135. Buffet breakfast is a highlight at the Atlante Star. You'll look out over the dome of St. Peter's and enjoy a huge variety of rolls, croisants, coffee cakes, cheese, cold cuts, fruit and juices, and more. The restaurant, Les Etoiles, serves lunch and dinner in this gorgeous room at the top of the hotel and at the outdoor terrace and bar in warm weather. We didn't spring for the lofty prices but would be tempted for a special celebration. Comfy beds, great location, wonderful staff. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Benissimo!”
Reviews.Author: Jama214
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected pleasure! My wife and I were looking for a hotel near the Vatican City and "God" blessed us with a great hotel within walking distance with a very friendly staff in my opinion a 5 star restaurant where you have a view of the Vatican church and also able to watch the sunset as you enjoy your meal,I loved the steak the wine and the service.The room was decorated perfect to include a whirlpool tub which was great after a day of site seeing.The cleaning staff was so friendly.I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area of the Vatican City!

Reviews.Title: “good points and bad points”
Reviews.Author: SarahGMerseyside
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a two night trip to Rome with our two sons and my husbands parents. we booked the Atlante star hotel because of its position near to the Vatican,and also because of some of the good reviews we had read. The position is great for Vatican only. All other sights are the bus,train or taxi away. when we arrived i felt a little dissapointed at the outside appearance of the hotel, it seemed like it needed a little maintenance, there was scaffolding up at the buildings next to it, which didn't help the appearance. The area seems a little run down, with a lot of graffiti on some buildings. which is a shame as it is in a prime position. The staff were friendley enough,but the rooms weren't ready when we arrived and we had to wait about an hour. The rooms were the standard rooms, the decor was nice,with an Italian feel to them, with shuttered windows. The bathrooms were small, a little tired, but clean. The bath and shower, although quaint, was a nightmare, it seemed impossible to have a shower without getting water everywhere! The view from the restaurant is great of the Basilica, but the rooftop garden was locked and when we asked if we could go there, we were told, no! The breakfast on our visit was to be honest, substandard, very little choice and quantity. I wouldn't say I was fussy, my opinion does seem to contradict other reviews i,ve read. But the breakfast I thought was below the standard of a basic hotel like Travel lodge, say. The restaurant at night was ridiculously priced-£80, average price for a main meal! Yes, £80 per person, for one main meal! Well over priced for an average hotel! You are paying well over the odds for the view from the restaurant. Our trip was great, and Rome is a great place to visit, but I feel the hotel has ideas of gran'deur, it is pleasant, but I rate it as average. We ate in a lovely little restaurant around the corner, and paid £160 for the six of us, for a delicious three course meal with two bottles of wine!! I would suggest booking the deluxe room if you can, the reviews on these seem to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: molliegirl
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel in a great location! The Atlante Star Hotel offers walking distance to the Vatican, great restaurants, museums, and is close the #23 Bus (1 Euro) which makes frequent stops to areas of interest. The staff is very professional, rooms are neat and clean, and we relished the free buffet breakfast! The Atlante Star also offers free pickup from the Airport, which saves you about 55 Euros. Internet access is available in the lobby. We will be returning to this wonderful hotel soon-it will be our 4th time! Also-check out the Roof Top Restaurant-what a panoramic view of Rome and the Vatican..

Reviews.Title: “Fam. Byrialsen”
Reviews.Author: stellaCairo
Reviews.Content: Austanding location, Rooms small but clean. Friendly staff !!! Restaurant OK, Breakfast some days OK some days very poor. Overall we had a great time in Room. Would return to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for experiencing Rome!”
Reviews.Author: flbell
Reviews.Content: We had originally been booked into the 'Atlante Garden', but were offered a free upgrade to a Deluxe room at the 'Atlante Star.' Despite arriving well after midnight following a delayed flight, we were made welcome, and retired to a superb room, sleeping in the most comfortable bed we had ever experienced. A very comprehensive buffet breakfast awaited us in the 6th floor restaurant, with superb views of the Vatican, only a few hunded metres away. We found the 'Atlante Star' to be perfectly located to enjoy the sights and sounds of Rome; centrally located, yet quiet and away from the noise of the traffic. It is certainly one of the finest hotels we have ever experienced. F.B. & P.B., Suffolk, England .

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday '08”
Reviews.Author: garretson
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Star Hotel has a great location, but it doesn't stop there. Their staff is the best. Efficient, knowledgable, and fast at their job, e-mails to check-in, cocktails to dining room, they all are very good at their individual assignments. The Hotel is small, the rooms are small, but the Hotel is very clean...Spotless. And, I saved the best for last. The restaurant on the sixth floor has the best view, the best food and just the right atmosphere morning or night to enjoy yourself before you venture out or after a long day of sightseeing in Rome. Prego

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, Dont expect to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: joanark
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star, if that, hotel. Do NOT expect the Ritz. It is clean and the only truly good thing is the proximity to the VAtican and the view from the breakfast room. There are no robes(as stated on web site), no iron, no safe in room, elevators are slow, and NO concierge. One person at the guest gave incorrect weather info. If I had listened to him, I would have cancelled my trip to Florence.YOu ARE ON YOUR OWN as far as trips or info. We asked for a wake up call and they werre 45 minutes LATE! If I had not heard the plumbing through the walls, I wouldnt have woken up and would have been late for the flight. ALSO< they DONT have a shuttle before 7 AM, so beware of them calling you a cab, who can charge more than the 48 euros they will charge. I am writing this in all honesty and I hope this helps other people. P.S. Being by the Vatican is OK, but it is away from most other sites in rome. So expect to take lots of cabs from here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: EssexClara
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay in Rome for my husband's 40th birthday. We wanted a family room as we were travelling with our 2 children aged 9 and 12. Having checked the hotel's website and other reviews we booked up the trip. Now we've been there, I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Rome. The reception staff were extremely courteous and helpful and the hotel was very clean. We had a suite on the first floor with a room for the children and a separate room for the adults with a shared bathroom. The accommodation was very comfortable and ideal for our needs. The view from our room was into a typical Rome side street and fine for the amount of time we spent in the room. The breakfast room has stunning views of St. Peter's basilica which took my breath away. We were early to breakfast each morning to make the most of our stay but also to ensure a table overlooking St Peter's.The choice and quality of the buffet breakfast was good but we didn't eat dinner in the restaurant as it was a bit beyond our budget. (The road Borgo Pio is lined with independantly owned restaurants which provided good value Italian fare and is only a couple of streets away from the hotel.) Location, location, location!! The hotel is within easy walking distance of Piazza San Pietro, the Vatican and Castel Sant Angelo. During our stay it was great to be able to stroll to Piazza San Pietro whenever we fancied it to soak up the atmosphere. We found it easy to get around Rome by bus to see the sights returning to Piazza San Pietro and a short stroll back to the hotel. The hotel has a car park but it's quite pricey at 40euros per day. This reflects how difficult it can be to find a parking place on the streets in the centre of Rome. With a bit of patience however we were able to park on the surrounding streets and paid less for parking for the whole trip than it would have cost for one night in the hotel car park. As the hotel offers transfers to and from the airport and the public transport is so good you only need to rent a car if you want to venture outside Rome. It was my husband's and children's first visit to Rome. We had a fantastic trip and fell in love with Rome. The Atlante Star was a great place to stay and I'm sure we'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay in rome italy”
Reviews.Author: dodoCraiova
Reviews.Content: me and my wife had a nice vacation in atlante star hotel in rome. the hotel sent transfer from the airport to the hotel in rome.the transfer was free of charge.location in rome very close to the vatican .only few minutes walking to the san petrus basilica or the vatican museum.the room was very good.the restaurant is on the roof and having the breakfast looking at the san petrus basilica we shall never forget. wery goog hotel. we shall come back to this hotel.i am tour manager and i shall recomand this hotel . karpel family

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel - an oasis of friendliness!”
Reviews.Author: Artizanne
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit Rome for my 60th birthday. We did some prior research of hotels in Rome using the internet and, after taking a virtual tour online, decided to book a week's stay at the Atlante Garden Hotel. On arrival however, there was a problem with the availability of rooms at the Atlante Garden so we we were sent to it's sister hotel, the Atlante Star. Despite our initial disappointment, we had a wonderful stay. Our room on the second floor was comfortable and well appointed. The housekeeping staff are meticulous about hygiene and cleanliness. Breakfast is served in the "Les Etouilles" restaurant located on the top floor with its breathtaking 360 degree views over St. Peter's Basilica and Rome. The range of foods available for breakfast each was quite extensive - bacon and scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, cold meats, cheeses, yoghurts, fresh fruit and a good range of tinned fruits, a range of cereals, various bread rolls and preserves, croissants, chocolate pains, danish pastries and various tarts etc. and the usual fruit juices, tea, coffee, mineral waters. I, myself, am Coeliac and have to follow a medically prescribed gluten-free diet. I had e-mailed the Atlante Garden before my visit to ensure that they could cater for me. This information was passed to the Atlante Star and the hotel went out to great lengths to ensure that I had a good supply of gluten-free bread during my stay. We also had an excellent evening meal in the restaurant - again carefully prepared by the chef. This restaurant is very popular because of it's breathtaking views - ensure you book before-hand! This hotel is extremely close to the Vatican - a plus if you want to get there early to avoid the queues to get in to the basilica, the Sistene Chapel and the museums. It is also very close to all bus routes and the metro, enabling you to get right around the tourist sites such as the Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps etc. On our last day, my husband had the misfortune of having his wallet stolen while in one of the shops in St. Peter's square. It was a professional job by three individuals - he was aware of it happening while it was taking place but was powerless to do anything about it. Fortunately, as we were only killing time waiting for our airport transfer they didn't get much in the way of cash but there were a couple of credit cards in the wallet that needed to be cancelled immediately. We went straight back to the hotel and the management immediately took charge and helped us to contact the credit card agencies. Management and staff at all levels at this hotel are extremely courteous and friendly. We had a wonderful stay and would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Family Owned Excellence at the Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: Michelle5250
Reviews.Content: My parents and I spent eleven wonderful nights at the Atlante Star in September. We arrived on the 14th. The weather was ideal...the end of September/early October is definitely a fantastic time to go to Rome. We were impressed with the family atmosphere of this hotel. Because it is family owned/managed you get more personal service and attention. Roberta, who is the daughter of the owner, was the manager that we encountered the most and couldn't have been more pleasant, and really went out of her way to help us. My Dad wanted to golf in Italy, and she looked up and printed out golf courses in the area, etc. for us. We had a Junior Suite on the fourth floor. The best part about it was the view! It overlooked the Vatican. Doesn't get much better than that in Rome. The fourth/fifth floors definitely have that view if you are on the street side. The third floor may also have the view as well. The rooms appear to have all been recently renovated. Wood floors, new wall coverings, small flat screen tv's, etc. The neighborhood around the hotel had gelato shops, grocery stores, small restaurants, and a main street of shopping including a department store called "Coin." We also ate at Les Etoiles one evening which is rated in the top ten restaurants in Rome according to many magazines/guides. The view again, overlooks the Vatican, which is beautifully lit at night. The garden terrace was closed during our stay, but apparently you have a 360 degree view of Rome from that rooftop. It would seemingly be a great place for a wedding and/or reception. Basics in the room such as air conditioning, water temperature, etc. all worked great. There is traffic noise, but when both shutters/windows are closed it really minimizes that. The housekeeping staff were all very friendly, and the bell men were helpful and efficient. There is internet access for a small fee in the reception area, and normally there was never many people using it. One of the greatest aspects of this hotel was the downstairs lounge. There is a small bar (bartenders were very friendly and accomodating), and the general feel of it is cozy...as if you were in a home/living room. We loved the Atlante Star, and the family/staff running this hotel are genuinely concerned with their guest's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Molto Ottimo Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: BeaWanderer
Reviews.Content: From the meet / greet at FCO to the taxi call as we departed, our stay at Atlante Star was delightful. We thoroughly enjoyed the sense of being a part of the community as opposed to being in a crowded, tourist-centric part of the city. The staff was very friendly and helpful; the complimentary breakfast offered a wide variety of tasty selections; and the view of Basilica di San Pietro was an amazing way to start each day. The hotel is very clean (our room was spotless) and is situated is a pretty spot of Rome with Citta de Vaticano, Basilica di San Pietro and Castel Sant'Angelo in the immediate area. Interesting little eateries can be found almost around the corner. A short walk (about 5 minutes) across the Tiber River offers additional dining opportunities. Each day during our four-day stay, we walked from the hotel to all of Rome's many scenic spots but taxis were readily available from the hotel's entrance. If you're looking for a memorable and comfortable hotel to call home during your visit to Rome, Atlante Star is the spot. Happy travels. Point of Reference -- My husband and I are a professional couple in our mid-fifties; we enjoy clean, comfortable, nicely-appointed accommodations for which we will pay an appropriate (but not overly inflated) price. We were celebrating our 30th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome not the hotel so much...”
Reviews.Author: california100
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to our 4 star hotel I was a little dissapointed, I would definitly not rate this as a four star hotel. Our room was really dark and dingy, and the decor very gaudy. If you are looking forward to the roof terrace restaurant I really wouldn't hold your breath. We were informed it ' was being refurbed ', having read reviews on here before we went it seems it has not been open for a long time. On a positive note the cleanliness was to a good standard. It is a reasonably priced hotel and can't really fault the location, 5 - 10 min walk to the Vatican. Overall we were hardly in the hotel, so we weren't that bothered but if your lucking for luxury I wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jballesfc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my wife and 2 children. We had 1 jr suite with a connecting room which was very clean, comfortable and beatifully decorated. The concierge and staff was very helpful and polite. This hotel is wonderfully located, you can easily walk to the Vatican, the Spanish Steps or the Pantheon. The view from the roof garden restaurant is fantastic, lovely in the morning for breakfast and in the evening for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Do not take chances at Atlanta”
Reviews.Author: Alvarorrr
Reviews.Content: I have only myself to blame for taking my chances with Atlante Hotel in Rome.
