I had ignored the previous reviews that referred to this hotel practice of overbooking the rooms to then suggest desperate guests a room at the not-at-all luxurious B&B next door. That’s what happened to me. I came on my own to Rome (no wife to impress) not as a tourist or on business, but to a funeral, all I wanted was a bed where I could peacefully sleep. I called in the morning to ensure that I had a room and the receptionist confirmed that everything was ok and the hotel sent a car to pick me up at the airport. They knew I was coming. Yet it is only when I arrived that they told me I had no room and offered a lousy and smelly room with no light. To be completely honest, the receptionist finally found another hotel which was a bit lower but ok, as I said all I wanted was a quiet room. Meanwhile, what I think was the hotel manager sat in the back office and had a great time with her colleagues, at no point she attempted to apologize. If you come to Atlante, there is a chance your stay in Rome will involuntarily be elsewhere. Do not take chances and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Room Without a View”
Reviews.Author: Keen2wander
Reviews.Content: The hotel was incredibly disappointing. Upon arrival we were given a very small and dark room, that was in bad repair. The hair dryer was not working, there were stains on the carpet and marks and tears on the fabric covered walls. When I opened the wardrobe we found that the cupboard doors were broken and that there was a large hole in the ceiling! We asked to be moved to another double room. The hotel seemed very reluctant to do so. They did move us to another room on our second day. This was an improvement, but had twin beds - when we asked for a double the hotel reassured us that they would move us again. When we returned to the hotel later in the day, we found that we were in the same room and that they had just pushed the beds together. Unfortunately this room was also very 'tired' and greatly in need of refurbishment. Plug sockets were hanging off the walls and there was a hole in one wall where cables had been run through it. As the reception staff hadn't made it very easy for us to move rooms, we decided not to ask to move rooms again and just to try and spend as little time in the hotel as possible. The hotel was advertised as four star, but was anything but. Breakfast was quite nice, though the coffee was often cold if you went there for the earlier part of service. Service was mediocre, communal spaces as tired as bedrooms and the roof garden - our main reason for choosing the place as it offered a panoramic view of St. Peter's Basilica and Vatican City - was out of bounds due to repairs. Before making our booking we did check the hotel's own website. On the site the roof garden featured as the hotel's prime selling point. Nowhere on the website was it advertised that the roof garden would be closed for the duration of our visit. I really regret booking this hotel and in particular paying the full amount in advance via a lastminute.com deal. This left us with no bargaining power. It really felt as if the staff knew this. So we were unable to pay up for two days and leave to find another better hotel. The best thing about this hotel is its location (as well as a really lovely chambermaid.) This was a real shame as Rome is a truly amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: mary96a
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic! It was very clean,the rooms were very comfortable and the view to the vatican was magnific.The stuff was very helpful and friendly.I have passed my birthday there and the coockers baked me a delicious cake , i have really passed the best birthfay in my life.The location was very good: a few blocks from the vatican.The breackfast was excellent and the rooms were very tidy and new.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Didifox
Reviews.Content: We spent a week-end in Rome. The hotel "Atlante Star" is convincing externally by his Vatican nearness, quiet situation and good transport binding. In the surroundings there are numerous restaurants with good prices and numerous purchasing possibilities. Our "Deluxe" room was not gigantic, but very comfortable. The bathroom had jacuzzi and bidet. Cleanness and affectionate details rounded the whole. The breakfast very felt well. Three kinds of scrambled eggs, numerous fruit, cold cuts variations and various other delicacies spoilt the palate. Also one could enjoy various coffee specialities. The employees were very friendly and obliging. The "Atlante Star" is a town hotel and with it one should make in it other demands than in a holidayhotel. To our expectations it was fully complied and they would be excelled. Completely many thanks over again for the nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view of St. Peter's Basilica”
Reviews.Author: zlarinka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights. The breakfast each morning was good and the view of St. Peter's Basilica could not be beat. It was something we looked forward to each morning. We had dinner in the restaurant one night, we had looked forward to the rooftop dining experience, but since it is under renovation now, hopefully next time. The food and service were outstanding, and the evening view was breathtaking. The location near the Vatican was fantastic and it was easy to walk or take public transport into the rest of the city, for all that we wanted to see and experience while in Rome. We would recommend the hotel to others and would stay there again. Even though the weather was extremely hot, each night we got a good night’s sleep because of the air conditioning in our room. All the staff was exceptionally helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterTwinsmummy
Reviews.Content: We had read some of the other reviews but I can honestly say that we had fantastic service and the hotel was lovely during our stay. Our flight was 1 hour late but the hotel complimentary transfer service was waiting in arrivals for us. We checked in with no problems, an American family who were checking in at the same time were offered a transfer to the Atlantic Gardens but declined the transfer and was offered a room at the hotel, we were worried about this happening to us after reading other reviews but luckily it didn't. We had a double room with 2 patio doors leading out onto a terrace with views over St Peters which was amazing, the only thing I would say is that the front of the hotel is on a main road so if traffic noise bothers you ask to stay at the rear of the hotel. Breakfast was served in the restaurant which also has amazing panormic views over St Peters, the usual selection of continental breakfast which was all very nice. The staff were all very friendly and even gave us advise on where to eat and to buy bus tickets to visit the tourist spots. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Atlante is a Star”
Reviews.Author: JTTBirmingham
Reviews.Content: As my wife and I consider ourselves far removed from sight seeing tourists, more sun, sea and a quiet beach for us. We were apprehensive about this trip, our first holiday in a big city however, it's great to be surprised. Firstly, the hotel location could not be any better, it's perfect for all the main attractions and good places to eat and drink. The hotel restaurant and terrace are also excellent and have great views of the city and Vatican. The breakfast and evening meal menus are ample and compliment the hotel very well. Staff at the hotel are very polite are very helpful no matter what was asked or requested. And the main thing my wife and I noticed was that for an inner city location, the hotel was very quiet and we had no trouble sleeping. We intend to return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: rkreppel
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our family of 5. The rooms are small by american standards but average size by European standards. More importantly, the rooms were impeccibly clean. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. They spoke enough english to really help us. I thought the location was fantastic. A short walk to the Vatican and also a short walk to the subway that can get you to other sites. Always felt very safe. And the breakfast was much better than other european hotels. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Would Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: clmz
Reviews.Content: We spent a fabulous few days in the Eternal City at the Hotel Atlante Star! The place was beautiful, the service friendly and we met the most interesting people. We especially loved the view of Rome as we ate our breakfast every morning - which included a wide variety to suit everyone's tastes! Our dinner there was delicious, the view incredible and the service attentive and friendly. The location of the hotel is also a plus. Everyday we walked to the Borgo section and of course to the Vatican. We hopped on a tour bus also within walking distance. All in all, we had a wonderful stay in Rome and we would recommend the Atlante Star to any of our friends embarking on a trip to beautiful Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Oversold”
Reviews.Author: MemberGuildfordUK
Reviews.Content: I booked a "junior suite" but the accommodation was a regular bedroom. The bathroom was good. The location was excellent close to the Vatican. The breakfast was the worst I have had in a hotel at this price range, albeit the view of St Peter's was good. The reception and the bar were good and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: IndianaSlim
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The food was delicious. The room was spotless. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: coolnoshoes
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel i read some of the reviews on this site and was really concerned. However, Our stay at this hotel was wonderful. Upon reading on this site that the hotel roof terrace bar was shut i emailed the hotel to ask whether it would be open on our stay. They apologised that it wasn't and i advised that that was part of the reason why i had booked as it was for my 30th Birthday. On arrival we entered our room to find that we had a bottle of champagne waiting on ice for us. The room was very tradionallt decorated with a very large comfortable bed, sky with every channel bar the the films, a large cupboard, massive window with velvet curtains, a large bathroom with jacuzzi and shower over. Could have no complaints about the room, although not massive it wasn't as small as some people have made out! The staff were as helpful as possible and very professional, advising us on anything and booking us taxi's etc.. The bar downstairs isn't really a bar but you are made welcome to have a drink in the rooftop restaurant which is beautiful and has wonderful views. Breakdfast is a std continental brekkie which you get anywhere and had a large choice of everything although the coffee wasn't the best. Room was a little noisy but if you stay in the centre of a city this is always likely!!! Comfortable 15 min walk into the historic centre and 1 min walk to St. Peters! Loved it and would def return!!

Reviews.Title: “You've been warned!”
Reviews.Author: bigworldlittletime
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. You will regret it. Rudist staff in Rome. Very, very loud rooms. You feel as though the traffic is in the room with you. Staff extremely unfriendly and downright rude.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4jay
Reviews.Content: We only had a few days in Rome and your hotel was in a great location for walking to many of the wonderful historical sites. We had a great little suite of rooms and the service was great. The breakfast was wonderful and the wait staff really great fun. We would definitely stay again, it was so quiet and peaceful. The Stieber's Wausau, WI USA

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and charming”
Reviews.Author: MickeSweden
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just spend a long weekend in Rome for our 20 anniversary. Our visit at Atlante Star was a nice experience and didn’t disappoint us. The booking was easy and a free shuttle service to pick us up at the airport worked like a clock. I probably told someone at the hotel that it was our anniversary, even though I don’t remember it, because when we arrived there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us at the room with compliments from the management! We staid for four nights and all the staff we met were always friendly and helpful. There are some on going renovation at the hotel but it didn’t disturb us at all. I have read that some guests are disappointed that the interior are old and out of style but we just found it charming! The breakfast was good, not the biggest or best I ever had, but fully acceptable. Location is perfect with walking distance to almost everything but yet a little bit calmer than the hotels around train station or i.e. Piazza Navona. The only negative thing I can think of is that they don’t inform at the website that the rooftop garden are under renovation and closed for a long time, but there are a lot of places in Rome where you can sit in the sun and enjoy a glass of wine so it wasn’t a big deal for us. We hope we come back to Rome soon and for sure we will stay at Atlante Star again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: carol066
Reviews.Content: Our family (me, my husband and two teenage sons ages 17 and 19) just returned from a a fabulous vacation in Rome and Greece. We stayed at the Hotel Atlante Star in Rome which I had booked primarily because it was one of the few hotels in Rome offering quadruple rooms and complimentary pick up service at the airport. I read some mixed reviews on the hotel after booking so didn't really know what to expect. I sent our travel details to the hotel before leaving the US for pick up and their response was immediate with instructions on where to find the driver who was ready and waiting for us. Our family room was charming - a small suite including a room with two twins, bathroom and room with a queen bed. The beds were very comfortable with high quality linens and the flat screen TV with lots of English stations was a plus at night after long hours of walking all through Rome. The staff was professional, helpful and friendly at all times. The location of the hotel is great - a couple of blocks from St. Peters and the Vatican, a couple of blocks from one of the bridges to central Rome and very close to a street with lots of great family friendly restaurants. We never took a cab anywhere and for those who don't like to walk, public transportation is close by and the front desk gives great directions.The breakfast buffet was wonderful with everything from pastries and breads,fruit and juices, cereals, eggs, meats, coffee and more. The view of Saint Peters from the breakfast room is breathtaking - the hotel website does not do it justice. We stayed on the concierge floor of a Marriott after leaving Rome which was comfortable, predictable and very American (not a bad thing) but we all agreed that our stay in the Atlante Star was the highlight of the trip and gave us more of a flavor for Rome. I'm sure anyone who complained about their stay was either used to high end luxury accommodations (check out the range of prices of hotels in Rome!), had a bad overall travel experience, or isn't happy anywhere. I highly recommend the Atlante Star and would return in a New York minute!

Reviews.Title: “Better deals available”
Reviews.Author: KayRogers
Reviews.Content: The hotel room at 250E/night was a grave disappointment. Bizarrely decorated (if you could call it decorated), furniture so old it was falling apart. If you touched something a piece fell off! Wall sockets hanging out of the walls etc. A tiny bathroom with broken light fittings, electric wires left hanging out of the wall from ? not sure what the original use was. Shower fitments broken. Terrible! Gaining entrance to the room an obstacle course of huge dirty laundry bags, 24 hours a day! Hotel staff seemed oblivious to our requests to secure the live wires hanging out of walls. 'Not my job" was the reply. Restaurant and bar ok though we were disappointed that the much touted roof terrace was not open and has not been for 3 years apparently! Wonderful view of the Basilica. The only reason to stay here. Suggest traveller's do not believe everything they read on the official web site but stay at the vastly superior B&B.next door which is managed by the hotel "Maison Royal" . Now that was fabulous value for money including breakfast in the hotel for 145 Eu.

Reviews.Title: “Strange .... but not necessarily in a bad way”
Reviews.Author: madfamilly
Reviews.Content: If you want an indentikit international hotel, this is not for you ! The room we had took some getting used to - high wooden ceilings, dark, eccentric furnishings. However, it was clean and comfortable and everything worked - including an ultra modern TV with a good selection of international channels. We found the reception staff helpful and there was generally a friendly atmosphere. Location is also excellent - within a 5-minute walk of the Vatican and 20 minute or so walk to the other attractions - that's if you can make any progress on the pavements with the locals, who seem to have entered en masse a slow walking competition ! There are also some excellent local trattorias / pizerrias within walking distance. Just avoid anything on the main square or on a road adjacent to the Vatican. The general rule is that the best (certainly best value) places are tucked down the side streets. There are plenty of them. A few things about the hotel we'd recommend noting. Firstly, some of the rooms face the main street and are bound to be very noisy - we heard two other families complaining. We asked for a quiet room on booking and again on check-in and the one we had was fine. Strongly suggest anyone else does the same. Secondly, if you haven't booked with breakfast included, don't be tempted to eat in the hotel. It is 15 euros each (which they don't tell you until afterwards), which is a complete rip off for what is no more than a modest continental selection. There are lots of good cafes / bakeries where you can get a better beakfast for a fraction of the cost - including one in the street opposite. However, don't let the above put you off - the hotel is fine, paritcularly when you see some of the alternatives and you remember that as an ancient city which needs to make little effort to continue to attract tourists (and frankly doesn't !), you are never likely to get a gem for a bargain basement price or anything remotely modern anywhere near the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Please Do Not Stay Here - Far Better Options Out There!!!!”
Reviews.Author: noraspence
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were taken to what we assume was an overspill from the hotel, some 70 yards or so down the road and not part of the actual hotel that we appeared to have booked. The room smelt damp, had mould in the bathroom and the paper was bubbling off the walls in places, we refused this room and was offered a similar room within the same small block, This was small and dark but at least did not have mould and damp. We accepeted this, but was disappointed as we expected a 4 star room and paid for this qualitiy. The furniture in the room was old and tatty, the jaccuzi and bath did not work, to the point that a printed sign was on the bathroom door - and had been for some time. we had hot water only two days out of five and The reception staff were arrogant and did not appologise for our inconvenience, we were not offered another place to shower and the staff did not even seem to care. On the plus side the location was within walking distance of all the sights but then in fairness any hotel in the centre of Rome would be within walking range of most of the sights. Rome is a fantastic beautiful city and i would recommend that anyone holiday here, please look at other options as we felt scammed by how we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “Star service...lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LisaFrench
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mom to celebrate our birthday (it is the same date!) We booked directly with the hotel and they offered to pick us up from the airport free of charge.....unfortunately we were flying into the budget airline one and they don't go there but were very helpful about transport anyway. The staff and service at the hotel were better than any hotel I have stayed in before, the room was nice too and was plenty big enough for the two of us with a small bath and shower. There was some noise at night from the street below but nothing major. The real beauty of this hotel is tucked away in the sumptious dining room, a spectacular view of the dome of St Peter's Basillica. The roof top garden restaurant is still closed so we didn't get a chance to dine there but it would be stunning I'm sure. Would definitely go back to this hotel.......especially if the rooftop is open!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: LondonLivia
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Atlante Star was just amazing thanks to the wonderful staff of this beautiful hotel. They were always willing to give advice and even called the airline for us to sort out our lost luggage. We had an incredible view of St. Peter's from our balcony and the location in the suburb of Prati is full of restaurants and shops. The Spanish Steps and other historic monuments are a 10 minute walk away and if feeling lazy there are always taxis around and the metro line is very close. On my next trip to Rome I will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: pb05
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline. The problem was that we missed the notice that the booking was for two persons per room ... we had two rooms and seven people! We caught our error before we left to Rome and added beds, but when we arrived the beds were not available due to a language mis-communication. The staff quickly made arrangements for us to stay in a private apartment, that was modern and quite nice. While we didn't actually stay in the hotel, we did enjoy breakfasts there and the view was a highlight of our stay in Rome! The Vatican is a stone's throw away and there's pretty good shopping and dining a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: fullers17
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fine. It was just a short walk to the Vatican and St Peter's. The breakfast and view from restaurant was also good. The room and bathrooms are really small and we got bed-bugs from our stay. We were promised a room with a view and balcony but instead we got a view of the back alley. The free pick-up service from the airport was nice but they were 30 minutes late and don't pick you up before 7.30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, Comfortable Room, Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Erin-and-Josh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for two days before leaving on a Mediterranean cruise. Originally, we asked our travel agent to book us in a CHEAP hotel because we were on a somewhat tight budget--while our room at the Atlante Star was more expensive than what we had in mind, in the end it was worth every penny. Our luggage was missing when we arrived in Rome, and both airlines involved were denying responsibility. We were stressed, to say the least, but the staff at the Atlante Star did everything they could to help us, including making phone calls to the Italian airline and offering us a shuttle ride back to the airport when we had to return to deal with airline staff so that we could save money on taxi fare. They were patient and empathetic, and always greeted us warmly and personally. We could not have asked for more from them! In addition to the staff, we enjoyed the accommodations as well. Our room (which apparently was a suite, according to the notation on the door) was spacious, if a little bit dark (that just made it cozy, we decided). It was nice to be able to open up the windows entirely with just the shutters to block out light--the cool air was really refreshing. And finally, while we were unable to eat on the rooftop deck due to renovations (it was November, the off season--it probably would have been too cool, anyway), we did LOVE the view from the Etoile restaurant. The continental breakfast was fresh and delicious, and was made even more special by the view of St. Peter's Basilica. All in all, it was a great way to start our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Italian hospitality at its best!”
Reviews.Author: DrLKW
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! The staff went out of their way to make our first trip to Rome a wonderful experience! The breakfast on the roof terrace was plentiful and excellent--warm rolls, eggs, variety of meats, fruit, pastries, great coffee, and so much more--plus the inspiring view of the Vatican! What a way to start the day! The rooms were immaculate and comfortable. The location is excellent, especially if the Vatican is the highlight of your visit. The concerige made tour guide arrangments for us and we could not have been more pleased. Availability of other sight seeing programs is excellent and the desk staff were very helpful with arrangments and with suggestions. Definitely worth the price and the experience. Never have I had better service in a hotel--especially in a Eurpoean hotel--and I travel to Europe several times a year. I am a travel agent who does group tours and this hotel will definitely be the hotel of choice for our future trips.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Martin021
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel.Reception staff were without fail unhelpful,rude, and generally unpleasant.The room supposedly a superior double was a cupboard with no way of allowing light into it unless the windows were open-- not so good in December.We complained only to be offered( in an arrogant and dismissive way)another roughly the same size that smelled bad.Breakfast was mediocre until the last morning when they were so understaffed and disorganised the there were hordes of angry residents milling about looking for food and a table.We cut out to the cafe on the same block 3 doors down for great coffee and pastries.Only good thing about this Hotel is the view from the breakfast room

Reviews.Title: “For "Star" Treatment stay at the Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: LynnNeenah
Reviews.Content: The reservations for the Atlante Star through Sandro and Mami by email were prompt and efficient. The free transportation to the hotel and the friendly greeting by the staff at the hotel started our 10 day trip to Rome perfectly. Everyday we had a fabulous breakfast of fruit, pastries, breads, cheeses, meats, juices, coffee, tea, and eggs at the restaurant with a perfect view of St. Peter's. The cleaning personnel were definitely dedicated to their jobs and the rooms were always sparkling. We had access to the internet and a nice lobby meeting area. Every staff member was helpful and a pleasure to talk to each day. The hotel location is also great for visiting the Vatican, using the subway, and catching the tour buses. All in all I would say it is an excellent value and one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. Helen Limberg, Neenah, Wisconsin, USA

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay At Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: bemr1954
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our week (11/20-11/26) at the Atlante Star. The Staff, including the Front Desk, Housekeeping, Restaurant, and Bar Service were all outstanding. It was our 2nd visit to the Atlante Star, and we found our remodelled room (#84) extremely comfortable. We were celebrating our 20th Wedding Anniversary during our stay, and the Front Desk Staff provided us with many Dinner Recommendations which we really appreciated. The key reasons we would definitely stay at the Atlante Star again are as follows: 1)Complementary Airport Transportation to the Hotel. 2)Complimentary Breakfast with our Reservation. 3)Quality of the Staff and Room. 4)Location of the Atlante Star. Thank You for a Lovely Experience, and we hope to visit with you again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Romeandbeyond
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel with very friendly helpful staff and very good maid service. Rooms are larger than the European norm with each individually decorated in classical décor with lots of marble and bright bold colors. The lobby is smallish and the elevator slower than you would like, but the top level restaurant gives a great view of the Vatican and offers a superb breakfast buffet that could be enjoyed either at leisure or for a quick bite before the excursion of the day. The bar was a great place for sharing stories of the day and getting to know the bartender and fellow patrons. Memories of our stay at the Altante Star are good. 5 Star’s * * * * *

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: gwizPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a huge disappointment. The roof garden restaurant is closed, the wall coverings and carpets were dirty and worn, there was mold on the bathroom walls, the door keys were awkward to use and the doors hard to lock and the service was poor. We would not recommend this hotel nor would we stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Star Topnotch!”
Reviews.Author: BlueDevil2273
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Star was recommended by a friend who had stayed there, and we thoroughly enjoyed our six days there. Ms. Roberta Mencucci was most kind in our email exchanges setting up the reservation. The online website gave us a good preview of what to expect, but nothing can compare with actually being there. The hotel is just a few blocks from The Vatican, and there is a spectacular view of St Peter's Basilica from the 6th floor restaurant and rooftop bar. The hotel staff were all extremely pleasant and willing to assist with recommendations on nearby restaurants and tips on getting around Rome. A full breakfast buffet was included in the room rate, and there was a wide variety of selections to meet almost any preference. We had a double deluxe room, with two full beds joined to make a king. The bathroom, though typically small, also had a bathtub equipped with jacuzzi jets - a great way to finish a day of walking through the streets of Rome. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The only bad thing about our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: Brimmacombes
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the sentiments expressed by other reviewers who draw attention to the filthy surroundings, the rude and dismissive reception staff and the complete absence of 'luxury' advertised elsewhere. We booked a quad room and were told on arrival that we were to stay in a building nearby and that breakfast was a mere five minutes walk? As my jaw dropped further and further the manager assured me that if we were unhappy with the accommodation we could move... We were walked to an anonymous building about 5 minutes away and taken into a ground floor apartment - there were stains on the paper, the lavatory seat was cracked and the sofa bed made up for our children was broken underneath. My son shut himself in the cupboard and cried. I immediately asked to be moved but was told that there were no other rooms. We were promised a quad for the next night but, interestingly, the manager flatly refused to show us the room. He also refused to find me another hotel for some time, but as I stood there and persistently and loudly reminded him how filthy the room was when other English speaking guests walked by, he finally found me another hotel. So I recommend the Michelangelo! It's nearer St Peter's and the centro storico. It's clean, light, friendly and probably about the same price. I lost a considerable amount of money not honouring my booking at the Atlante and I strongly suggest you don't make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Atlante a star!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieX
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience! This hotel had everything - location, exceptional staff, great rooms, the works. Where to start! The complimentary shuttle to/from the airport is a wonderful way to start your stay in Rome. Cut out the middle man and sit back and enjoy the ride. The hotel itself is very welcoming from the road and the staff on arrival could not have been more attentive or helpful. Our early arrival was accommodated, the room prepared whilst we enjoyed a late breakfast buffet and the sumptious views from the restaurant overlooking St Peter's Basilica. The room was exceptional. Our two adults and a child were accommodated in a suite, with a double bed in one area and closing door through to a single bed in another area. The decor was delightful, calming, and welcoming - in the room and throughout the hotel. Breakfast buffet included, as mentioned before it is situated on the top floor with exceptional views. This is compounded by the location ... just a five minute stroll to The Vatican walls, to St Peters and a 10 minute stroll through gorgeous pedestrian friendly streets to Castel Sant'Angelo. I cant praise this hotel enough ... we were very sad to go. If you can I strongly recommend crossing the road for a dinner extravaganza that is La Barca restaurant (the hotel staff will make reservations for you). Luigi and Roberto really turn it on and the food and decor is to die for. Then back to the hotel for one of Giacomo's exceptional drinks at the bar. Send them my best!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you can't find anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: JMorel
Reviews.Content: Do not be decieved by the internet phots or descriptions. This hotel is less than wonderful. The staf is indifferent and less than helpful. The triple delux was really a sleeping chair and one bed in a very cramped room. The up side is the location and the breakfast. There must be something more comfortable in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: menal
Reviews.Content: We were only in Rome for a couple of days, so our spectacular view of St. Peter's was an added bonus. We were close to the bus stop, restaurants ( the restaurant in the hotel had a great breakfast) and some of the main sights of Rome. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. We actually ended up at the airport without having prepared our hotel transfer, which is supposed to be done three days prior. The hotel sent two seperate vans to acommodate us as we were seven people and twelve bags. They were very friendly and courteous!! Our rooms, as well as the hotel, were very clean and beautifully decorated. I would definately stay at the Atlante Star Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Conned by the Hotel website etc.!!”
Reviews.Author: noelj1
Reviews.Content: We booked a Suite for a weeks Honeymoon online. I picked the Hotel because of the fantastic roof garden restaurant etc. overlooking the Vatacan (which is on their website). We got married in the UK on the Saturday 4th August, arrived at the Hotel Monday the 6th August. On arrival were told that they did not have a suite for us, as another famly wanted to overstay. We were given a deluxe room with an offer of 20% discount. This amounted to 40 Euros more than the internet price!! When leaving at the end of the week, still had to argue to get 20% off as if I had booked the room they gave us directly on-line. Tried to book dinner in the roof top restaurant, guess what, closed indefinitely! We had a buffet breakfast in a restaurant each morning, but not the rooftop and after that, eat out all the time. I only booked this hotel because of the rooftop restaurant as a selling point and it was all a wast of time! The desk manager was very argumentative and found it hard to accept that it was fraudulent to advertise something which was not available! Not even a bottle of wine or flowers was offered for our honeymoon stay.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOURSELF A FAVOUR AND STAY ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: McToosh1
Reviews.Content: Although it was 2 years ago reading some of the latest reviews nothing appears to have changed at the Atlante Star. I didnt know about Trip Advisor at the time I wish I had! We took advantage of a Romantica package that they were offering in Feb 05 and from the moment we hit Reception I knew I had trouble. Like another reviewer they instantly tried to bump us firstly, to a staff accommodation block and then when I resolutely stood my ground to their sister property. A peroxide blonde who was supposed to be in charge refused to come out of her concealed office to talk to this by now very angry Scotsman. It was clear from the as yet uncollected envelopes from their slots that despite the fact that we had arrived earlier than everyone else the hotel was still overbooked and as we were on an offer we were the team to be bumped. Over my dead body! We were given a room eventually in the main hotel but it was all a very uncomfortable and tedious experience. The rooms are mega tiny but that is normal for Rome and at least it appeared to have been recently decorated in an attempt at Boutque style. To be fair the free dinner with wine that was part of the package was excellent and the view from the rooftop restaurant is pretty at night. If enough people turn their back on the Atlante Star then in time they will go out of business which will be good for us all. Stay at the Hotel Diplomatic 10 minutes walk down the road its 500% better.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Sweet Rome”
Reviews.Author: xxOljaxx
Reviews.Content: My family and myself enjoyed our stay at the Atlante Star very much. We were taken care of all the way from the airport pickup to local dining tips and sightseeing. We had a great room with St. Peter’s just outside our window sill. Upon stepping outside the hotel we had the Vatican just down the road one way, St. Angels castle just round the corner and the Pantheon and more than we could see right across the river. If you like to shop then just walk over 3 blocks and there is a wonderful boulevard lined with all sorts of shops. Housekeeping made sure our room was always perfect and tidy and the reception and bellboys were always ready to help. Breakfast was a treat with a full view of the Vatican and the rest of the ethereal city. For anyone who is looking for a central, practical and friendly hotel then this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Great and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R-Square
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 days in Rome in June, 2007 and stayed at the Atlante Star Hotel. Although the room was small, as in most nice European Hotels, it was quite comfortable for our needs. The Hotel Staff, especially the concierage, were extremely helpful. The included breakfast buffet was satisfactory and could be consumed while engaging in a remarkable panoramic view from the surrounding windows on the 6th floor. I do look forward to returning at some time in the future and hope the top floor garden will finally be finished when I do. The location of the hotel, near the Vatican, seems very safe and is central to a number of fun destinations, while also being somewhat secluded. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Francesca13
Reviews.Content: I have never written a hotel review before but felt compelled to write this one! We had booked this hotel for our last two nights in Rome. The entrance to the hotel was a steep narrow flight of stairs. While the men at the front desk watched, we struggled to get our bags up the stairs into the lobby! The hallways to the rooms were narrow and dark. There were construction workers working right outside of our rooms and we had to climb underneath their ladders and manuever our luggage around tool boxes and piles of construction material to even get to into our rooms! We had a terrible time getting the locks on the doors to work properly. The doors themselves, were hollow and flimsy and when they were shut and locked you could see light through the chewed up door jams. When we entered the rooms they were dark and dingy and it was even an effort to get the shutters to open properly to let light and fresh air in. When I went to the front desk to tell them that I was very disappointed in the rooms and they were nothing like the pictures advertised on the Atlante Star website, I was sarcastically told "I shouldn't assume that the rooms are going to look like those pictures!" I told him about our trouble with the locks and asked to see any other available rooms. He gave me the keys to 4 other rooms on 3 different floors, all of which either smelled like dead fish or vomit, or faced the garbage dumpsters so we wouldn't want to open the shutters. We stayed in the original two rooms and later that night found out that the air conditioner was broken in one of the rooms. (It was 90 degrees outside and they brought up a fan to re-circulate the air) If that wasn't enough, we found a huge cock-a-roach running across the bedroom floor and the shower sprayer kept falling on us as we tried to shower! I called Hotels.com and told them we were not staying the second night. They said they would refund the 2nd nights' stay. The next morning when we checked out we, once again, struggled to get our luggage down the flight of stairs without any help from the staff, even though they stood and watched from the windows in the lobby. We were lucky enough to find a wonderful hotel in which to spend our last night in Rome, the Hotel Pace Elvezia, but unfortunately that wasn't the case for a woman who approached us outside of the Atlante Star. She asked us if we were given the rooms we had paid for. She said she was not. As mentioned in some of the reviews on this website, she paid for a room in the hotel and when she arrived she was sent to an apartment down the block because there were no rooms available in the main hotel. She was very upset and said she would never recommend or book this hotel again. We told her that IF she was planning on staying..........we knew for a fact that there were NOW two rooms available!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: BrianNorthbrook_IL
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. From the moment we entered, the front desk staff were rude and not helpful at all. The first room we were given smelled as if a skunk was the previous occupant. The room we finally ended up in was not much better, and included one of the largest bugs I have ever seen. I could not wait to check out in the morning. Worst hotel I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel next to Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: Scrooge1977
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the heart of rome right next to the Vatican City and Castel St. Angelo. Unfortunatley the roof garden was closed during our stay and we were neither informed by our travel agent nor by the hotel at check-in. The restaurant Les Etoille offers a fantastic view over rome but the service and the quality of the food is not the money worth.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: wsafer
Reviews.Content: I am amazed this hotel has been highly rated. From the moment you enter you can tell it is dirty and in disrepair. Fabric on the walls is torn or poorly patched over, the staff was indifferent to our presence, the room itself had stains on the carpet and on the fabric lined walls. We had the sense that lots of problems and quick repairs had been covered up in order to do things on the cheap. Find yourself another hotel. You will have a happier stay in Rome. I wish we had.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!”
Reviews.Author: jowanner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was gross. Staff was rude. The room had mold in the bathroom and in the air vents. The walls had stained carpeting on them. Had not been updated since the 70's, carpeted walls, brass fixtures, mirrored walls. Unsanitary, dirty. Small and cramped. Was supposed to be a four star hotel, no way! Not worth the money. All together a really bad experience. Stayed there for three days - could not wait to leave! Had to take pictures of how gross this place was.

Reviews.Title: “Close this place down.”
Reviews.Author: polcat
Reviews.Content: For all the reviewers who rated this hotel as anything above terrible you must be insane. I have never in my life experienced anything so dire. The hotel was booked by my husband for our honeymoon but as a result of an appaling stay we are having a 2nd honeymoon to make up for the upset this dump caused. The website should be banned, I challenge any one person to find the honeymoon suite within that hotel as it most definately is NOT the one they show. This hotel should be closed down. The rooms are filthy with almost brothel like decor - mirrored doors anyone? The staff need a rocket up their backside and a lesson in hospitality. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: dreckman
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! We booked at the last minute on Travelocity and got a room for about $225 a night; less than the going rate. This is an older, but clean and neat hotel. It is pretty well managed and the staff was helpful and friendly. Now, when we got to our room, on the 6th floor, we found it to be very small. It was sort of trapezoidal, about 8x13 feet in greatest dimensions. Just barely room to walk around in with the double bed taking up most of the room. But it had a full sized bath with shower, not a little 2x2 corner unit shower like so many European hotels. BUT, when we opened our window and took a look out over the evening scenery of Rome from our sixth floor window, the Vatican was lit up about 300 yards away. Magnificent! And looking the other direction we had a view of Hadran's Tomb just a few hundred yards away. This place was located so that we could walk to almost all the major attractions in central Rome. It offers great breakfasts with just about anything you could want in a continental breakfast. The breakfast room also offers spectacular views of St. Peter's Basilica, and they also have a rooftop restaurant which we didn't have the opportunity to use, but must be great. The menu looked pricey, but the views must make it worthwhile. There is internet access in the lobby, but it isn't free; in fact, it's about 15 cents a minute. There are internet cafes close by, but they charge almost as much. There are a lot of small restaurants within a few blocks, book and souvenir shops near the Vatican, and a taxi stand near the Vatican if you need to find a cab. The city shut the water off one day while we were there, but we had plenty of warning from the staff, so we could shower the night before. However, that didn't help with the toilets not working all day. Hey, it's Italy! Summary: it's comfortable, wonderful views if you're on the south side of the hotel, excellent breakfasts and close to most of the things you'll want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Read first before booking!”
Reviews.Author: H0nest
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Atlante Star Hotel in the morning, we were told there was a problem with the plumbing in the room and it may not be fixed until the afternoon, however they had a replacement room for us in a near by hotel. We were only staying for one night and because we didn't want to waste our day waiting for the problem to be rectified we agreed to stay at the other hotel. We advised the manager that we had a reservation in the roof top restaurant which we had booked for my fathers 60th birthday but he said that was fine and the restaurant was still open. We were ushered into a taxi and taken to a hotel that was a 25Euro trip away from the Atlante Star, which the hotel paid for. The replacement hotel was apparently a 4star hotel but not at all by our standards and further away from the attractions, one of the main reasons why we booked the Atlante, also we didn't go for the meal because it would of been a 50Euro round trip. Do not book into the Atlante Star.

Reviews.Title: “Read first before you book!”
Reviews.Author: jestersgems
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel's tactics: Several other guests have also experienced the following: We had our rooms booked at the Atlante Star since July 2006; however, upon arrival were told there were no rooms available at that time, but they would offer us (there were 2 of us) two "palatial adjoining apartment" in the building a couple of doors down. The apartment rooms were dark, dingy, old, and without telephones. When we went back to the hotel to complain, we were told there were 2 rooms presently available at the Hotel Atlante Garden (their sister hotel) which was close by. We agreed to the rooms at the Garden, although there is no restaurant at this hotel, nor is there room service. We literally ran after the bellboy as he took our luggage through the streets of Rome to the Garden hotel. Days later, we found he actually had broken the handle on one of the bags as he dragged and ran with them through the city. Our review of the Atlante Garden is posted on Trip Advisor as well. Needless to say, we do not recommend this hotel (which we chose after a recommendation by Fodors Rome 2006.)

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: Indiana2Hoosiers
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful and in english as well. We walked to many places and took the bus one way and walked back from the more distant ones. The pickup from the airport was on time and the return for 45 euro worked well for us. The room size is European = small for Americans. The breakfast was good and we usually lunched in a street cafe on our way back to the hotel. The location was great for tourists with shopping and dining opportunities and the Vatican all a short walk away. When we return this hotel would be our choice. It has been our experience if you act in a courteous manner you will receive courteous treatment. The people of Italy were wonderful hosts to these two American guests.

Reviews.Title: “No way 4 star but what a view”
Reviews.Author: BJC56
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights there. On arrival we were taken to an apartment room on the 3rd floor about 20m down the street. It was dark and dingy with no telephone and an ancient TV rather than the satellite TV advertised. There was also a broken bottle of water in minibar. When we complained this was not a 4 star room we were moved into the main hotel where the room was much nicer. Breakfast on day 1 was excellent with plenty hot food but on subsequent days they were understaffed and ran out of clean cups, bread, cheese, meat, pastries! Dinner is ridiculously expensive but we dined in three excellent trattorias within two blocks walk. Would we go back? Well the answer should be no BUT sitting at breakfast looking over St Peters is absolutely stunning and the hotel is in an excellent location for Vatican and central Rome. Feb 25th, Edinburgh

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but not the worse”
Reviews.Author: cnblackman
Reviews.Content: My ex-boyfriend and I decided to spend an "after New Years" trip in Rome. The hotel was in a decent location, very close to the Vatican and St. Angel's castle. The first night we went to check in we were told the hotel was overbooked and we were put in another hotel a few blocks away that left much to be desired. After that first night we checked into the "Star". The room was clean, but basic... nice bathroom. The continental breakfast was usually cold, and unless you are a big ham/prosciutto person you may not enjoy the breakfast, but the pastries were good enough to hold you over until you're ready for lunch. It wasn't the worse since we only came to the room to sleep, otherwise we were out sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiretraveller07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlante Star Hotel for 4 nights and had a fantastic time there. We enjoyed our Deluxe Room, which was big and very quiet. The en-suite bathroom was also big with a bath, shower, sink and bidet - all very clean. Our room was very reasonably priced, we booked it directly with the hotel over the Internet, where they offered a special rate during the winter months. The reason why we chose this hotel was that it has an amazing breakfast room on the top floor with views directly to St. Peter's. In the evening you can have dinner there and enjoy the breathtaking atmosphere. The hotel is conveniently located in the Vatican district, just a few minutes away from St. Peter's and the Vatican museum. It also offers a free pick-up service from the airport. We will definitely stay there again (we had stayed with their sister hotel Atlante Garden before and that's how we found out about this gem). We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor was a great help to manage what to expect”
Reviews.Author: Sandhurst
Reviews.Content: Atante is a 4 star and the hotel restaurant has a 5 star view. We booked the pick up service and they were there within a few minutes of us landing. Not immediately but hey this is Italy not Heathrow! They drive like someone possessed but that's normal and can be alarming for some. The location is very close to the Vatican and there are some great restaurants close by that are well-priced. We used the Dorling Kindersley guide book and followed the restaurants for every meal - not one was bad and the most we paid was Euro 150 with tip for 4 people. We spoke to some paying more for only 2 people, so take care. The hotel restaurant is priced for the fantastic view and for dinner it will need to be a special occasion to put up with the hefty bill. As we saw the view every morning we didnt see the need to pay the prices for the evening. Cobbles, cobbles, cobbles everywhere. Forget the fancy footwear and get into something comfy. The ambulance sirens that seem to be constant in Rome are scooping up tourists with ankle and feet trouble due to cobbles! Breakfast was best eaten before 9.30am as in got a bit silly near to the 10am cut off. As the restaurant is top draw the leftover fruit is superb and the choice wide enough to suit all tastes. We particularly liked the hot crossants and pastries! The hotel is across from the Adriatic - yuk! and puts it to shame. The bar is comfy and has a big screen and the waiters friendly and multi-lingual. You need to ask for what you want and they nearly always served with a smile. We had tea every afternoon with room service and it was served to perfection. ...but if you dont ask the experience may be a bit less exciting. Having read other reviews we chose this hotel as it is sensibly priced for a capital city hotel. We felt comfortable and safe and yes it needs some updating but it was all very servicable with clean, fresh linen and enough room for 4 of us. I think on balance the cost and the hotel facilities are equal. We looked at another 4 star while we we there and it was not worth twice the price of Atlante Star, yet it was full up weeks before this one. While we were there the water went off in our block and the hotel gave us mineral water and helped out as much as they could. Some guests moaned and shouted at staff and yet the water van was digging the road up for all to see only 20 feet away. Some people are just plain rude. It is an ancient roman city not a disney re-make!! We felt the staff dealt with the situation very well and although inconvenienced we felt they were sympathetic and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Truthful review”
Reviews.Author: Kaz34
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I would suggest you get the shuttle service offered by the hotel if you are going to stay here, or risk getting ripped off by the 'Tom Cruise' wannabe local taxi drivers!!! On arrival our first room was tiny with twin beds, we had booked a double so were taken to a second room. The room's air con was obviously faulty and making a horrendous noise, so we were taken to a third room. The room had some broken fittings. There was a constant smell of cigerette smoke through the air con. The room was small and dark and extremely noisy. Don't believe the website - they state sound proof rooms. What a joke!! Also, we weren't informed immediately that the roof garden restaurant was closed, the desk staff were not informative and our stay definately wasn't worth the money. I have stayed in lots of hotels and this was more like a 2-3 star. Losing points due to lack of service and the state of the premises. Please think carefully before staying here! The only plus points were that it was close to the Vatican, and the continental breakfast was nice - but c'mon thats pretty hard to get wrong!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the ambiance of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hollyorchid
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose the Atlante Star because of the roof top restaurant; however, upon arrival we found that the restaurant "La Terrazza Paradiso" was closed indefinitely (perhaps until summer) for renovation. Naturally, we were disappointed, but we found the other restaurant one floor below "Les Etoiles" was quite charming, romantic with wonderful menu and a Continental breakfast to die for. We never missed our breakfast throughout the entire stay. We look forward to sitting by the window, looking out to the Vatican City, smelling fresh flowers on our table and just soak-up the ambiance of here and now. The entire experience was so romantic. Definitely a place to fall-in-love if you're not already! One improvement should be done during the breakfast was to keep coffee and hot water hot! It was never hot during our entire stay. It was always luke warm. Us American likes hot coffee! Smile :) Our room was so charming, smaller than most American standard, but clean, fresh and comfortable. After a day or two of adjustments with its cute size, we were quite content. We both fell in love with the hotel, the housekeeping and breakfast staff, and the entire hotel as well. One improvement was needed at the front desk among the staff to communicate with each other. We had made a request for a wake-up call one morning at 6:00am but was not woken-up until 6:25am; the second request was for the hotel shuttle to take us to the airport at 8:00am but our reservation was not found at 8:00am but rather at 8:30am. We had to convinced the desk staff on duty that morning that we did indeed made our reservation at 8:00am and not 8:30am because of our 10:30am flight out of Rome. It took some talking but he finally gave in and had a driver took us to the airport; otherwise, the entire stay was very pleasant and comfortable. The location of the hotel was very convenient to the Vatican City, St. Peter Basilica, Castle de Saint Angelo, tons of shops and restaurants. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome and will recommend this hotel to anyone who's going to Rome. Keep up the fabulous job! Goi Holliday & Tani Malaguti

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Atlante Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deano323
Reviews.Content: The staff at this 4 star hotel were fantastic. The Suite we had was well aportioned being at the front of the hotel so we had a fantastic veiw of the Vatican City and St. Peter's. The room had a jaccuzzi which was fun and as we were having our wedding aniversary the hotel management thoughtfully left us a bottle of champange on our arrival. The 5th floor resturant had exellent veiws of the Vatican City as well and the food was terrific. They also have a rooftop garden and resturant but as it was January it was shut but i bet it is wonderful in the summer. The hotel is about 5 - 6 minutes walk from great local resturants and 10 minutes from St. Peters. Overall we both had a great time in Roma and the Atelante Star is a great base to see it from: highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..if you get the right room - not room 304!!”
Reviews.Author: Mouse03
Reviews.Content: We stayed in December and the first room we were given was truly awful, it was room 304. It was dark, smelly, scruffy and not at all what we had imagined. We were so upset that it could have ruined the holiday. I went to see the guy on reception and asked if we could be moved, he couldn't move us until the next day. We did move into room 312 on our second day and that room was fantastic!! The decor was tasteful, the view was amazing!! Now our holiday really started! The food was good and staff very helpful. The roof garden was closed which was disapointing. I would recommend a meal in the reasturant, its expensive but the view and the food is excellent. Overall good, but be aware some rooms are in a terrible condition.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - poor breakfast arrangements”
Reviews.Author: SingletSigma
Reviews.Content: We had a nice three day stay with a comfortable room and good service. The only drawback was the service at breakfast, which became chaotic at the busiest time. The waiters (on the Saturday, 9th December) were poorly organised, running round busying themselves with odd cups and saucers, and not re-laying tables fast enough, or getting extra supplies of food when it was needed. In addition, insufficient cups for coffee and tea were provided, and the "hot" water for the tea was scarcely warm. The waitresses on the Sunday (10th December) were better, but hampered by apparently poor service from the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: jstfne
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this restaurant and hotel! I made reservations on line directly with the hotel, had to make some changes, and they still treated us like royalty! The staff are very personnable and professional! We utilized their pick up service to and from the airport. They made the trips on time and were there to locate us in the terminal, thus easing some of the unknown! When we arrived at the hotel we couldn't even assist in getting our luggage inside, they handled everything! The room was even more than we expected! I asked for a room with a view, if possible, because it was our 25th wedding anniversary, and they came through. The view from the balcony was great! The maid service went above and beyond the "normal" high priced hotels. Their continental breakfast included more choices than we imagined. Plenty, well stocked and always fresh! We booked daily bus tours through the hotel and is was very simple and worry free. Everything that we asked for we got!!! In summary, for the price we paid for these accommodations, I feel you won't be disappointed or find one better! Randy K Ridgecrest, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Special Dinner”
Reviews.Author: SRBZ
Reviews.Content: I emailed the restaurant saying I was planning a very special evening and they did not let me down. Complimentary champagne at the beginning and end of the meal, and a fantastic meal in between! Wonderful view, atmosphere and service. It was a shame the Roof Garden wasn't open due to refurbishment, as I planned to propose there (!), but Piazza San Pietro was fine for that. An excellent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “the most wonderful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: askmetotravel
Reviews.Content: Room 309 at the Atlante Star was the perfect place for a trip to Rome. Looking at the dome of St. Peter's out the right and Castle St. Angelo out to the left, I had an ideal room. The furnishings were classic and well kept, the room very clean and comfortable. A sitting room off the bedroom with french doors that led out to a small balcony was charming. The "party size" jacuzzi tub was just plain fun. We were able to walk everywhere from here. The breakfast (included with our stay) was wonderful. Perched on the top floor of the hotel it gave a panaramic view of the city. The breakfast was typical meats, cheeses, breads, yogurts, fruits and eggs, but very nicely presented and quite an assortment. Coffee was delicious. Staff in restaurant very professional and helpful. We loved the bellman, so kind. The front desk staff was always polite and helpful as well. Very friendly staff. I would definately stay at this hotel again, and hope to be back in Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “4* means 2* star in Rome”
Reviews.Author: majka
Reviews.Content: this is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. I booked the hotel b/c on its website it look beautiful and really like at 4* hotel...at a rate of almost 300 euros I did not think that it would be terrible..upon arrival I was horrified when I saw the beatup stucco building with a huge tornapart metal sign that read Atlante Star. Prior to my arrival the hotel was 45mins late at picking me up at the airport via their free shuttle. The rooms are extremely small with less than acceptable bathrooms. At the time I was there all the hallways were dirty with towels on the floor yet no one told me that they were going through some major renovation. The beatiful terrace that is on their website was closed yet it did not say that anywhere on their website. Their restaurant is only open at night time and in the morning the staff were extremely rude and provided no customer service or assistance. I was pouring at coffee at exactly 10am (when the breakfast ends) and the server literally took the carafe away from me and infomed that breakfast was done. I decided to change the rooms and they ofered me 3 to look at but all were terrible, dark, and small. I was so disappointed so after a night of hearing everyone in the hallways and doors slamming, I decided to take my things and move to a 2* hotel across the street for 100 euros which was the exact same quality. Moreover, the location of the hotel is great if you are walking but all surrounding streets are dirty and there are not many restaurants or cafes around. Actually there are garbage bins right in front of the hotel where you can see and hear locals dropping of their garbage. I would recommend staying across the water closer to the spanish steps and just walking from there. The hotel Griffe where I stayed last time was definetely a more luxurious choice eventhough it was in a more modern style. Also the hotel Locarno near Piazza Poppollo is a great location. Overall, if you are looking for a 4* hotel in a nice neighbourhood this is definetely not the right choice and beware of their website.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet_Potter
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked into the Atlante Garden Hotel which is a sister hotel of the Atlante Star. When we arrived at Atlante Garden (which is undergoing major revamp) we were told there wasn't a room available and that we were being upgraded to their sister hotel which is apparently a four star superior. Arrived at the hotel, room was very small considering it was meant to be a triple - was infact a double with a camp bed. Not really suitable for three adults. So after complaining ended up with two rooms next door to each other for the duration which was a lot better. From what rooms I saw (I was offered other triple rooms) they are generally quite small, but was told by the smiley concierge that 'you are in the centre of Rome, what do you expect?'. Breakfast is great, and the view from breakfast is amazing. It over looks St Peter's Basilica. Location is good for the Vatican City etc but is a bit of a walk from the nearest Metro, probably about 10 mins which is ok when you havent got your luggage. Next time would probably stay in the Barberini or Spanish Steps area - lots of restaurants and more things going on at night.

Reviews.Title: “Roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: lukitos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for a long weekend in September and were assigned a very pleasant room with view over the Vatican. The neighborhood seemed fairly safe at all hours and the Hotel was very well situated. We took full advantage of the complimentary airport transfer to the Hotel which went smooth and the buffet breakfast over looking Rome every morning was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended from Liz - Chicago IL”
Reviews.Author: cetona
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlante Star for 4 nights earlier this month. The location is great and the accommodation very comfortable. Included was a complimentary airport transfer which helped as getting a taxi at the airport we were told is a nightmare and also very expensive. The lobby was very welcoming and the bar pleasant for a nice drink after being around town all day long. Breakfast on the top floor is served in a very elegant ambient and the view of the Vatican is just amazing - great for some photos too. There is a wonderful choice of shops and restaurants in the area where you can find everything you pretty much need. Overall I was extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like this hotel at all-Atlante Star-Rome”
Reviews.Author: damed
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this hotel was recommended by a co-worker and I was completely disappointed. The location is close by to the Vatican if that is your focal point. However, the rooms that are shown on the virtual tour are not the room we got by any stretch. The first room we were given was so small that I could barely get our luggage in. The second room was only a bit larger. Our room was so dark that it felt like a dungeon. I tried to open up the one window which was very thick and was covered by a wood door. This is because right outside the window were the pipes to various sytems to the hotel and it was very loud. There was no view to speak of-just dirty roof tops and people's laundry hanging out to dry. I was also told that using a travel iron in the room was "illegal" which only prompts you to use their very expensive laundry service of which you have to keep calling to get delivered back to your room. The bathtub was so small and narrow that it is almost impossible to take a bath. The sink basin was cracked. The shower curtain was so short that the bathroom flooded after taking a shower. The roof top garden was under construction which is a draw to the hotel. The staff is not very helpful or accomodating. I asked if I could buy stamps at the front desk to send postcards (my hotel in Amalfi gladly provided this service and even sent the postcards) and again I was told it was "illegal" for them to sell stamps. The tabacco shop down the street that they directed me to told me they do not sell stamps. The day before we left, I asked if someone would help us with our luggage of which we were told-no problem. The morning we checked out-there was nobody available so we had to do this ourselves. The hotel is extremely busy so if you are looking for personal attention-this is not the place to stay. I would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “overall dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: vanhobie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located with the Vatican close by, it has a splendid view from the restaurant of the Vatican especially at night. However we had dinner in the evening in the restuarant and the view was spoilt by the attitude of the staff. We were ten minutes early for our booking and we were shown reluctantly to a table as far away from the view as possible, the meal not up to the standard expected from the price they were commanding, my vegetables were tepid, we had two bottles of white wine and when we requested a third they were unable to supply the same so we were supplied with a bottle of cheaper wine which was the same temperature as my vegetables!! I was unable to assertain the price due to the surly disposition of the young wine waiter. At no time were we asked if we were satisfied with our food which was a shame because we had no thoughts about complaining at that point as we had no wish to spoil the evening. The other staff in the hotel were faultless and helpful. Our room was comfortable but very small and dimly lit. Overall in view of the fact that we,ve stayed excellent hotels and have been fortunate enough to eat in some of the best restaurants both at home and abroad, I would have to say that standards need raising to match the price, dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Atlante”
Reviews.Author: Renewal
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were attending a religious conference in Rome and were so please with the awsome view from our balcony. We were in a Jr. Suite, 2 beds. We had an outstanding view of St. Peter's! It was such a refreshing surprise to have a bottle of champagne chilled when we came in after our first day too! The most wonderful thing happened though after we returned to the States. My friend was missing her digital movie camera. On it was footage of the week's events from which she was going to make a documentary for college credit. We prayed, called the airlines, and as a last resort contacted the Atlante. Yes! They had found the camera and needed an address to send it to her! Evidently in the rush of leaving, she had accidently taken it out of her carry on. How refreshing to know the staff of Atlante is so honest and helpful. She received her camera and was SO grateful to the Atlante Staff! I will definitely stay at the Atlante on future trips! DH

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MRSSTEVIEB
Reviews.Content: We were really worried about staying here after reading some bad reviews but we really should not have worried, we loved it. The loaction is perfect, every attraction is a walk away, the furthest being the collaseum which is only 30 mins away. The vatican is right next door and you can see St Peters from the restaurant, a lovely view during breakast. The bedroom was fine, the decor was lovely, bed comfortable, bathroom clean (we had a jaquizzi bath, perfect after a long walk) It was a little noisey but what can you expect being in a city center!? The staff were very friendly, especially the cleaners who would always greet you with a cheery smile and a hello. Would def recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: cleggan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a special anniversary present for my self and my husband, I booked through expedia, what i thought was a 4 star hotel, the room was tiny, dark and was really a single room.with a double bed. The staff were grumpy and really unfriendly and unhelpful, when I asked for an iron and was told 'go out and buy one', when I complained that the room I had booked was supposed to have a jacuzzi, no one knew what I was talking about. I initally thought it was because I had booked through expedia and had paid up front,,, believe me if I had not already paid I would have left this terrible hotel immediately The hotel is in need of a major over haul it was untidy, in need of a major revamp. I would never stay there again.. and intend to tell as many people as possible about our terrible experience... the only saving grace was the location of the hotel, We spent as much time as possible out of that tiny, dark, dungeon of a room. The attitude of the staff was 'take it or leave it' and believe me.. if I could I would have left it. never ever again..

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: claudius999
Reviews.Content: The first night we stayed at this hotel the rooms were so small I thought it was a joke. I complained and they moved us to slightly bigger rooms one with a Deluxe marker on the door. The rooms had leaks, the jacuzzi clearly needed maintenance and the whole hotel has a slightly down ay heel feel. Its not a bad place due to its location, but Luxury...NO..............4 star....NO!! As evidence I include the lights above my bed.....and the air conditioning vent..

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: explorerNun
Reviews.Content: Please do not be fooled by the blatantly incorrect self rating of this hotel. 'Superior 4*' is a blatant misrepresentation of the truth. The Web site is wholly misleading in all but the view of the vatican from the breakfast room. The rooms should you be unfortunate can be dark small and need of complete refurbishment as in the room I was allocated and from which I was unable to move. The Jacuzzi bath had obviously not worked for some time, the roof top garden was closed and has been for some time. If I save one person from making the mistake of booking this hotel I will feel happy.

Reviews.Title: “Under Remodeling”
Reviews.Author: scesak
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the US from Rome. Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. It's very conviently located within walking distance from the Vatican - closer to St. Peter's than the Vatican Museum but still very close. Air conditioning in the room was excellent; staff was quite friendly and helpful, spoke english very well, the breakfast was good The hotel was in the middle of remodelling/redecorating. You can't see it from the lobby, but go up to the 3rd floor and WOW what a mess! Unfortunately our room was on the 3rd floor. The coverings on the walls were newly removed, lights with wires hanging out of the wall, drop clothes sometimes on the floor - along with ladders and other equipment blocking the narrow hallway. Sanding could be heard and the plaster could be smelled in the room. The hotel does have 2 elevators, but beware - we were stuck in them twice! The roof top garden is not open! This feature was one of the reasons we booked this hotel - after all on their site it's the only thing they show besides a few room samples! Once this hotel has completed it's rennovations, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: welblazer
Reviews.Content: what can I say? the staff was helpful and friendly. the room was above average ,as far as hotel rooms go. the breakfast was excellent and fresh. I will book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Star Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: pjmb
Reviews.Content: There were many aspects of the Atlante Star which we liked very much. The pickup from the airport to the hotel was very much appreciated as the taxis were on strike. The location is very close to St. Peter's and the view from the restaurant is outstanding. Breakfast was as we expected for Europe - cold meats, cheese, rolls, fruit, eggs and so on - fresh and plentiful and enjoyable. The hotel is not too large but the rooms are very clean and are in good repair. Staff was very friendly and helpful - no issues here at all. Our reservations (4 in total over two separate stays) were in order. Air conditioning worked and was appreciated in the recent Roman heat wave. We did not stay in a delux suite but the rooms were much like what is shown on the web site. Overall, if back in Rome I would stay at the Atlante Star again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Star Helpful and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DaveMe
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome to be welcomed by a very friendly staff. Unfortunately our baggage was lost due to a overbooking of Alitalia Airlines. Atlante staff was very helpful in contacting the airlines several times until the luggage was finally delivered. The hotel was clean, air conditioned, and located near the Vatican as we had requested. We had a great time and would recommend the Atlante Star for good basic lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: bcgbrandt
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and pleasant and conveniently located near St. Peter's Square. Only problem was that they apparently turned off air conditioning at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip, great city... OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joann68
Reviews.Content: This was to be "a trip of a lifetime"... taking my parent to Rome for their first visit. I booked this hotel from another site... and then found the mixed reviews here.
