I worried for six months and pretty much found the hotel to be what I expected from the reviews on this site. The hotel was OK- not quite what I expected for the price I paid. I think a fresh coat of paint through out would have me feeling better. The rooms we had (82/83) were very quiet- off the main hall but small. The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh linens. My bathroom flooded daily, which often happens in hotels overseas... extra towels on the floor did the trick. The bed was comfortable and clean. The room was maintained daily. Breakfast was great, although the roof top garden was closed and had been from what I was told for a year already and the didn't know when it would be openning- repairs due to changes in safety regulations. Breakfast was not always ready by 7:00am, and we did find that more like 9:00 am. their full assortment of eggs would be served. Be sure to ask for a packed breakfast if you are touring and leaving before they open at 7:00 am. The hotel did provide when asked. A note regarding wake-up calls.. give yourself a few more minutes because the timing is not exact.. could be off as much as 20 minutes. Overall, the staff was friendly and very helpful. We went to see the city... not the hotel. My mother said she was pleased with the hotel and would recommend it to friends. If you want to be near the Vatican, this is perfect. We were there in five-ten minutes and visited nearly each day of our 7 day trip. Hint: the Vatican museum lines are huge in the morning... we arrived after 2 pm and just had a 10 minute wait. Also, the same for St Peter's.. we walked in after 2 pm daily. For the price you'll pay for this hotel, don't expect what you would get in the USA. It is an old hotel with a little remodeling would be just perfect. The place was filled with many US tourist and was quite busy. The famed restaurant was also busy at night.. we saw many folks dining there and they were dressed up for a night out. We did not eat there for dinner, but be sure to visit Port Castello just down the block- wonderful dinners with a great family serving. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We could have seriously not asked for more. A long weekend break in Rome of absolute tranquillity. Hotel and services were well represented on their website, great central location just a few footsteps from St. Peter's square and more, professional service all round with a homely feeling and to top it of a free shuttle bus transfers from the airport. The rooms were very cosy and well kept and the jacuzzi was just perfect to relax in after a long day around town. It was exactly what we needed for a quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Japanese staff is very helpfull for Japanese traveler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In the first evening(16th May 2006), we had a trouble with a bath-tub. After I took a bath, water in the bath-tub was not dicharged, I asked front desk to send repairman, but he promised me to send him soon, but nobody came and I went down to the front desk and ask the front man again. He told me, repair man did not stay at your hotel and to wait until tomorrow morning. I could not wait until tomorrow morning, because my wife could not take a bath that night. I strongly asked senior staff who told me he is a manager in your hotel to come to my room and watch the bath-tub. He came with me and he realized what the pjroblem was, then he went to upstair to get vacum rubber from restaurant and by using rubber, he picked up a bolt in the bath-tub, as a result the water in the bath-tub was discharged. We have traveled all most all European countries for twety yeas and stayed grade four to five or luxury hotels, but we have no experience like this kind of trouble. Duaring this travel we stayed at Grand Hotel Duomo for three nights, at that time we had some problem at midnight, but repairman came to our room in a five minutes and repaird some part of the room Like this hotel, I think repairman shoud stay for 24 hours. The second poit is not so important, but as your mail and your hotels leaflet tells the gusts to give us an olive oil as a souvenir. but this time Mami told me, not to be prpared, it is botled in large size and she promiced me if it is possible to rebotle but she forgot to tell me, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Rome didn't disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 day visit to Rome to celebrate our 24th wedding anniversary and I just wanted to write and thank you for making our stay at the Atlante Star so pleasant and enjoyable. The staff were friendly and helpful and service was given with a smile. I had emailed you requesting a nice quiet non smoking double room (room 508), and you didn't disappoint..thank you for that as it made all the difference to us. We also appreciated the gesture of complimentary wine even though we never got round to drinking it...it's those little things that make all the difference. Fresh, delicious breakfasts overlooking a stupendous view every morning were priceless! We will definately stay with you again and will recommend you to our friends. Once again..thank you for helping to make our trip to Rome such a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip of a lifetime and Rome was the final destination-from checking in, to asking questions (meals etc.), we encountered the rudest staff, I have ever met, especially the front desk, the room was not even average for the price, I expected luxurious decor and felt like I was in a seedy motel, we didn't even go to the rooftop restaurant, when the elevator opened to enter, the staff was so rude, we went, back down and out the door, there is a charming cafe down the street with a lovely, and friendly staff who make you feel right at home, I guess I just expected more for the money, and the saddest part is it ruined (almost ) my time in Rome which I will probably never get to return-Loved the city-no rudeness-just at the Hotel- I realize everyone has bad days-but-

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Star - a Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4 night stay at the Atlante Star Hotel with my sister and my mother. Did some of the people who've written reviews stay at some other hotel??? It was nice and we can't work out why some people disliked it so much. The view from my mother's room was fantastic - St. Peter's beautifully framed in her window. We were celebrating her 80th birthday and she was thrilled. The rooms were charming, the staff were lovely, the service was good, we had clean sheets and towels everyday, the bathrooms were nice, the breakfasts were lovely with a great range of choices. The lounge/bar was nice. The restaurant was nice. It was all nice. Yes the rooms are smallish but this is a city and ithat's what you get with a city hotel. I shared a twin with my sister and we had plenty of room. If you're looking for something big and modern this one's not for you but if you are looking for a slice of European life with some character and charm then this will suit you well. Rome was lovely, the hotel was lovely, we had a lovely trip. Go. Enjoy it. Ignore the whingers - we are certain they stayed somewhere else! And yes - we have stayed in hotels before and we have been abroad before!!!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with a view to die for”
Reviews.Author: Goldenwords
Reviews.Content: The view one has at breakfast is breathtaking, but the breakfast choice is very limited. It could be better. Our room 403 had a small balcony, unusually large with bathroom also large. Maid service was good. Never tried the restuarant, breakfast put us off. Corriders could do with redecorating, the term Shabby-Chic would describe the general areas of the hotel except for reception which was well designed. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Expensive for what you got although other hotels seemed to be just the same. Would go back to Rome but try another hotel, in another area. Situation was good for the Vatican only, far away from other sites to visit. Be prepared to walk or take taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Atlante Star is an excellent stay. If you are looking for a comfortable, clean and very friendly place, this is it. A walking distance to the Vatican and a shopping square. Prices were excellent along the walk in comparison to other tourist stops. If you like to walk, you can get to many sites by foot, we did and we did not tire out. Sites we walked to were Fontana of Trevi, Pizza di Spagna ( The Spanish Steps), The Colosseo, The Pantheon and many many more. Along the way you can eat their terrific ice cream, Gelateria. Oh, I must not forget their restaurant with a beautiful view of St. Peter's Basilica and of course their delicious and hearty breakfasts. Also, they provide a hair dryer and plenty of hot water. I asked permission to bring their pictorial advertisement to share with my family and friends so they can also have a comfortable stay when they visit Rome. Honestly, I had a terrific stay and I am glad I spend time locating this place. Many thanks to the management and their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not Luxurious, by any means.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four spent the week of March 22-28th 2006 in Rome and booked the quad "family" room for the week. I had so many visions of luxury in my head from the website . I had read some bad and lukewarm reviews on this site, but there were also some good ones so i decided to keep an open mind. The rooms are dark and cramped. I thought our room would be bigger because of the description on the website. My two sons slept on nothing more then elongated chairs. They were hard and uncomfortable. The master bed was hard and uncomfortable as well. What was that crack in the middle of the bed? We pulled the sheet back to realize to our horror tnat these were two twin beds pushed together!!! We were not given enough bedding. On to the shower. We actually flooded the bathroom once because the plunger in the shower was broken. Maintenance came in twice and the problem was somewhat fixed. We were disappointed that the rooftop restaurant was not open. They really should take that off their site . That was the reason we booked this hotel and paid over 300 dollars a night. The continental breakfast was nice..and the view amazing from Les Etoiles restaurant. The location is wonderful. Within walking distance to everywhere. The staff is somewhat helpful and pleasant for italians. The maids were excellent. If you have never been to Rome ..it's a culture shock..or at least is was for us. My family has lived in Japan, and all over the U.S. I have also lived in Germany . I speak italian very well..studying for many years...but found that italians were very rude. No one smiles...you will get knocked over in a crowd if you don't move to the side. I was really dissapointed in the overall attitude of the italians. Like I said, I have lived in other countries so I am not naive to other cultures. I just thought I would add this. ALSO...STAY OUT OF PIAZZA NAVONA..if you want a decent meal. They will pull you in and sit you at their outside cafe's and you will have the worst italian food you have ever tasted for a couple hundred dollars. I recommend taking a Frommer's book and looking up the restaurants in the "Where to Dine" section. That really helped us to find great restaurants. Also ...the Rome day by day is a great book and our holy grail when we were in Rome. I hope this helped. I wish I would've read a review like this before my trip..so I hope this will help someone else. Oh...and don't stay at the Atlante Star. For the price there are much nicer hotels . It tries to give the "air" of luxury...but you know the saying ...and I won't say it...put it's like spraying perfume on ...well , you know!!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend in Hotel Atlante Star in the end of March. The helpful and friendly staff assisted us in planning our 2 days in the city. The hotel is on a great location and the housekeeping service was wonderful. Our room was nice and well kept, with chocolates and flowers on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “don't go!”
Reviews.Author: poppy57
Reviews.Content: We had initially booked at its sister hotel - Atlante Garden, but after struggling down a long flight of stairs with our cases to reception we were told there was a problem with our room and we would be transferred to the Atlante Star. We were shown to our room along a dark corridor to a tiny dark room with an even tinier shower room( we had been led to believe all rooms had a jaccuzi bath from their brochure). The bedcover was dirty and the bathroom was grimey. Disappointment was followed by disbelief that this was a 4 star hotel. We asked for another room which was clean and had been recently decorated. However the shower didn't work properly and there was no room for 1 case never mind 2! The roof garden was closed for repair. The view from restaurant was the best feature in this hotel that has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel; pictures prettier than the truth,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Atlante Star for five days during the first part of our honeymoon, before moving on to the Amalfi Coast. I had expected the hotel to be somewhat "luxurious" from the website, and had also arranged for the honeymoon special (a free room upgrade and complimentary bottle of champagne, etc.) When we arrived, check in took a long time and when we were finally brought to our room we realized that, not only had there been no upgrade, but the room itself was so small that putting our suitcases down left little space even to walk. Here, too, the mirrors had a seedy, blacked out quality. The saving grace of our room was the window opening out onto the street. A nice view. Other than that, our room was cramped, musty, and dark. The rooftop patio is the best feature of this hotel. While, again, not as splendid as the website would have you believe, it offers a lovely view of the city and, when you can actually find one, the waiters are very nice and friendly. One in particular, named Joseph, chit chatted with us while we looked over the wine menu and when he found out that we were on our honeymoon, he brought us that complimentary champagne, as well as some appetizers from a party that was going on. Housekeeping seemed to be a sporadic occurence that varied in quality. The breakfast was continental and fair, but certainly nothing special. If you are in a hurry, go for it, but if not, don't worry. In Italy, you have so many options that I would suggest that you not waste your time and money on cheerios and lipton tea. As it was my honeymoon, I still had a wonderful time in Rome, however, when I go back again, I will be trying a different hotel. I, like a flower, need sunshine to flourish.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JoeBo1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned today from a 3 night stay in the Atlante Star hotel. We had originally booked the Atlante Garden Hotel but on arrival we were informed that a room was waiting for us in their sister hotel. Apart from pleasant staff and the proximity to the Vatican, this place does not deserve its 4 star rating. We stayed in a cell 7 feet wide at its widest and 4 feet wide at its shortest (also known as room 304) The bathroom was miniscule. The bath was too small to use and the shower head had to be hand held due to a missing wall mount. The airconditioning didnt work and we sweltered in the room at night. Opening the windows also increased the noise, you loose either way. Loose wiring behind the door, torn wall fabric beside the air conditioning control unit and missing bulbs gave the air of decaying grandour. This place seems to be standing on the laurels accorded to the views from its roof top restaurant (expensive). Since the rooms are too small and the restaurant too expensive (55 euro per head excluding wine) shop around to get a better deal and when you visit the Vatican area, drop in to see what this review has saved you from!! You cant miss it, its next door to a sex shop. 4 star and classy it's not!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very good located hotel with excellent service! Very good rooms and restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Star - Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! lovely reception and bar area on arrival. Staff helpful and knew their stuff! Room was very nice, basic but that is all you need as you are out all day walking! We had a balcony which did over look apartments opposite, but I didn't expect nor want a beautiful view and I enjoy people watching. The room was prepared each day on our return home. Everything was clean. The breakfast was a "continental" style. cereal, fruit, yogart, bread cheese and meats. Great start to the day, with a lovely view over rome from from restaurant window. We didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening sadly, but we will return and we will dine there. If you compare this to a hotel in the heart of London, and for the price we paid to be so close to the vatican and to be so central we couldnt believe how nice it was. The atlante star was not over the top, frills and spills, but clean, effecient, nice staff, food and drink superb, lounge and bar for when you return home weary absolutely fantastic. We will return and we will not stay anywhere else. Arrivederci - but not for long!! x x Mal and Martin Harrison Chelmsford

Reviews.Title: “Kind & professional service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Atlante Star for 4 nights and the hotel was beautiful including excellent service. The buffetbreakfast was also very good with various sortiment and incredible view of St Peters. It was also quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Under Rated”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2072
Reviews.Content: Prior to our vacation in Rome we read the reviews of the Atlante Star Hotel and were concerned about our choice of hotel. We found the hotel to be a great value and well situated. People stated that the hotel is noisy. Noisy is a relative term. Yes there is noise but that is because it is located near the Vatican and Castle San Angelo. There is also a police station within a few hundred feet. We found the location of the hotel to be perfect. We could walk to the Vatican or castle within 5 minutes. The police station also makes you feel safe as you go for walks in the evening.The quieter hotels are located farther from the center of town. If you wish to use public transportation the 40 bus stops within a block of the hotel and will take you to the main parts of town. The employees all went out of their way to help us and Raoul the front desk manager was especially helpful in advising us about activities in Rome. The buffet breakfast was great every morning. We paid about a $180 a night and thought this hotel was a bargain compared to others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Incredibly Helpful Reception!”
Reviews.Author: npdeasy
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Hotel Atlante Star for the week of my wedding. Ilona and the rest of the very warm and very accommodating staff made a world of difference to the success of our trip! While the rooms, yes, are small, I found the hotel to be charming and ideally situated for my wedding at St. Peter's Basilica. (The Vatican is about 2 blocks away!) The breakfast also cannot be beat! However, what made my stay at the Atlante Star truly unforgettable is how Ilona and the rest of the staff went above and beyond all expectations to help make my wedding such a wonderful experience! Weeks before my arrival, I emailed the Atlante Star asking for some vendor referrals. Ilona was amazing! Rather than simply providing me with names and telephone numbers, she organized a great deal - including arranging for Patrizia, a very talented florist, to deliver to the hotel flowers and bouquets for my bridal party. She also contacted a limo and shuttle van service for my guests (Angelo, the owner and operator was extremely courteous, professional and helpful. He even escorted my Father and I past all the throngs of tourists into the chapel). Ilona and the staff also helped arrange a very fun after-party for my guests in the Hotel bar! (The bartender, Giuseppe, was also wonderful!) All the vendors that Ilona contacted on our behalf were top-notch and reasonably priced (something that I have found to be extremely rare when a wedding is involved!) I will always look back on my stay at the Atlante Star with great fondness! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Garden Hotel Was Ideal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a pleasent surprize -- Shortly after I booked it (a month before we flew to Rome), I found a bunch of negative reviews for the Atlante Garden. We found none to be true. It was very clean and comfortable, the price was very competitive, considering the location (about 3 blocks from the Vatican), staff was extremely friendly and helpful. A small lounge off the front desk has a PC for hitting the internet, which was always available, breakfast was good. etc. We had no complaints per se, though late night, the street noise was a little excessive on a couple occasions (we were on the first floor facing the street) --the hotel it was about a block from a rest/bar. Also, remember to bring a clock, none in the room. We stayed in a quad room --2 adults, 2 small kids. Perfect size for what we needed. I'd recommend this small hotel to anybody without hesitation. The location was really ideal. Great value, very tourist friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: sibpoc
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 splendid nights in Atlante Star. We were delighted by the hotels close proximity to many key tourist attractions in beautiful Rome. The rooftop garden offers amazing views of the city and spectacular views of Vatican City. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms were neatly decorated and clean and the breakfast was second to none. We could only recommend Atlante Star for anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply great! I wish I could still be there.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that I'm shocked to read the reviews prior to this one; me, my wife and two children had a marvellous time thanks to beautiful Rome but also thanks to the Hotel and the Hotel staff. What I read is in such stark contrast with the experience I had that it makes me wonder what some people expect. You want 5-star? You pay 5-Star! Anyway, we arrived from Denmark and even though our flight was late we found the hotel shuttle waiting for us and they took us straight to Rome. I had booked a family room and was given to adjacent rooms which comunicated via a door which was ideal to keep the children at bay when my wife and I wanted to relax. The rooms were not huge but clean, cosy and elaborately furnished, personally I would have chosen lighter colours but when in Rome.... All the amenities were there and they sufficed, although bathroom size and the conditions of the bathroom accessories did leave space for some improvement. The hotel position was the reason I had booked the Atlante star(having been advised on this hotel by a work colleague who had also travelled there with his family and had returned very satisfied) and all the advantages of being so close to many of the monuments paid off. We walked to all the major sites and everyday was just a great promenade, which also thanks to the weather (great, six-star!!) allowed all of us to really appreciate the city. We were carefully advised by the concierge on the best routes to take and best restaurants with maps and indications, so I managed to use my guide only for the description of the various sites. Regarding restaurants we did have a couple of mishaps there since we followed our instinct and unfortunately fell into TOTAL tourist traps. We always returned tired to comfortable clean rooms with SOME view and cortieous smiles. Considering now I'm back in my office, I wish I could be there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Disgusting Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: GoneItalian
Reviews.Content: After searching the web for hotels close to the Vatican, I selected this hotel. Although reviews were varied, the descriptions and photos implied a well appointed hotel with 4 star accommodations, rooftop garden dining, and prime location for touring the Vatican. Other than its proximity to the Vatican, this hotel was a disgusting disappointment in every other way. I pre-booked two suites in this hotel through Priceline, weeks before departing on my trip. After three attempts, I was finally able to reconfirm my specific suite reservations directly with the hotel prior to leaving the US. Both suites were confirmed to include king beds, showers, jacuzzi tubs, and Vatican views. Upon arrival, the lobby area of the hotel seemed pleasant. Only one suite (309/10) was ready and we chose to store our luggage there until the second suite was ready. Exiting the elevator on our appointed floor and upon entering the first suite, we were visually assaulted by a decor which personified tacky 1970's Las Vegas. There was nothing of the decor or room that related to the photogrtaphs provided by, or about this hotel on any web site. The suite was dark, dingy, tiny and cheap; no where near a 4-star rating or the 4-star price they charged. When returning to the hotel after sightseeing, I was given a key to the second "suite" (407); only to find it was not at all what was not reserved or confirmed. It was an L-shaped queen room with a extra twin bed where a sofa would have been. A trip back down to the front desk to request a change proved useless. The desk clerk informed me that this was the only room they had. When reminded that I possessed a fax confirmation from the hotel for two identical king suites, he told me that there were not two suites which were the same, that it would be impossible for me to have an identical suite, and that he had no other room to give me. Realizing I was extremely dissatisfied, he reduced the price of the second room by 100 euros. Between the two rooms, we experienced: stiffling heat, which could only be alleviated by opening windows and shutters (making any attempts at sleep impossible due to all-night traffic and pedestrian noise); visible mold all over the marble shower; a toilet that would not flush - seemingly without running water to it; a tub drain that belched and gurgled all night long; a room door handle that was literally falling off (on the inside); one room phone that did not work, which required the bellman to come knocking on the door in the morning for the wake-up call; a room wake up call that was almost an hour late; mattresses that were totally shot; housekeping that was haphazard; lights burned out; and complimntary champagne in ice buckets without ice - just two inches of tepid water. The rooftop garden where breakfast was to be served was not open - without explanation; and breakfast was served on another floor. Breakfast was not set up at the appointed opening time and the full offering was only available some 45 minutes later, when guests who needed to depart the hotel for the airport would have already left; perhaps a good strategy for controlling food costs. The hotel does offer "free" shuttle service from the airport, but seems to have trouble coordinating the pick-up; ours did not happen. Curiously though, the return trip is always on time, but is only provided for a charge. Every aspect of this hotel experience was dismally disappointing, a misrepresentation of every known marketing description, and a total rip off. I cannot warn travellers enough to avoid this hotel chain at all costs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “verminous bathroom, dirty and small”
Reviews.Author: privatfrau
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 88-year-old (nearly blind )grandmother and I spent 4 nights at the hotel. We booked a suite with "2 separated sleeping rooms" and got a small sized room with a double bed and a pallet, separated by a torn curtain. After we complaint, we got a single room for my grandmother and a double for me and my husband. The shower did't work, we had bugs (!!) in our bathroom, and the toilet seat was broken. My grandmother loved the overwhelming view over St. Peter's from the restaurant. We only stayed, because it was her birthday and her lifetime wish to see Rome. Conclusion: Stay away from this hotel! It's not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception, Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Atlante Star in September. Roberta, and her staff could not have been more accomodating. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic. Great shopping and restaurants nearby. I would reccomend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I couldn't beleive the reviews until it happened to my partner and I. We arrived and waited 1.5hrs for a lift to the hotel. When we arrived we were told that there was no room for us and we could go to "the recently reonnovated" Atlante Garden and walk back for breakfast. We could keep that room as it was bigger than the one we had booked!!!! It was appalling. mould on the walls, wallpaper stapled in place. Mirrors from a 70's porn film and dank and dirty. Having paid £2,300 for 7 nights we were not impressed and got in touch with Thomas Cook, our travel organiser. They spoke to the hotel who would do nothing for them and didn't care (presumably as long as they got their money. It seems that they over book the Atlante Star and use thier sister hotel, the Atlante Garden (a 2*/3*)as an overflow - rather like other sewers!! We took a refund from the tour operator, who were also ignored, and walked around Rome in the rain looking for a new hotel rather than stay. The room was appalling, the staff lied and seemed to see us as a cash making machine and the smug attitude made me so angry.... Hotels like this give the city a bad name and having booked this hotel as a get away after my partners treatment for cancer and having seen our dream holiday nearly ruined I will only say that no one should book this hotel. I am getting in touch with all the tour operators and hotel bodies to complain and would say to anyone thinking of booking here to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wow !! Impressed !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: good bargain in Rome We stayed here in september and cannot agree with the reviews we read. Our stay was simply gorgeous, everything was perfect. The rooms are small but tastefully decorated and ours had a beautiful view, to the Dome. infact, the location cannot be beat - it is a stone's throw from the Vatican and easily accessible to the major attractions. The staff was very helpful with informations for tours and performances like the Opera ballet at Caracalla - unforgettable! We will come back

Reviews.Title: “The Roof Garden is still under renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights. Didn't expect much after reading the reviews and I learned not to be mislead by the star ratings for European hotels. The best the hotel ever offerred was the free breakfast. For the rest, it's definitely not worth your money in this 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it”
Reviews.Author: travelngurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights total in early September. I would recommend skipping this hotel. Not a good value for the $$. The location is good and close to the Vatican but aside from that it has very little going for it. The employees at the desk and in the restaurant were all very pleasant and we had no problems in this area. I especially booked this hotel with the rooftop bar in mind only to find out that it was under renovation when we got there. Very disappointing since we had no view what so ever from out little room. And as another person said in his review the bar in the lobby is small and lacks atmosphere. I'm used to small european rooms but this was a "cracker box" room they put us in. They are tastefully decorated and clean. But don't be looking for anything extra with these rooms because you will surely not find them here. We had problems finding a place to put our suitcases down and not having to step over them to move around in the room. We found no english speaking tv stations the second time we stayed there (later in our trip and on the way home). We were told it was a satellite problem. Not even CNN. It made for a long night since the rooftop bar was closed as was the lobby bar closed due to the employee being in an accident. So relaxing at the hotel wasn't an option that evening. Breakfast is what you normally expect for european standards (rolls, meats, danish, horrible juice, horrible coffee (mud), etc) and wasn't altogether terrible but nothing outstanding. They must bring the hot breakfast out later in the morning as we caught it once in our stay since we were leaving later that day. I will give then credit for the view during breakfast which is in the hotel restaurant. Wonderful view of the vatican. We did not eat in the restaurant for dinner which looked a little pricey. The whole hotel was just alright. I would not stay there again by any means and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlante Garden, but had our wedding dinner at the roof garden rastaurant. The service was fantastic and so was the food. I highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good service and good quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our weekend trip to Rome and stayed 3 nights in this gorgeous hotel. The staff at the reception was professional and very friendly. We had to wait, because the room wasn't ready, so they offered us breakfast in the restaurant, really good welcome and good service! We booked a deluxe room with jacuzzi and elegant furniture - beautiful paintings in the room, and from the window we could overlook St Peter's...it was fabulous. We definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Staff very friendly. Very close to the Vatican and many other features. Beautiful breakfast room and view. Will definitly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Letdown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from this hotel and although we thoroughly enjoyed Rome, the hotel was a big letdown. Firstly, there is NO rooftop restaurant, hasn't been for some months, and won't be for the rest of the season due to maintainance work. This means that there is no bar to relax in (except in the lobby which is very small and dark and lacks atmosphere) and nowhere reasonable to eat in the hotel ( the 6th floor restuarant is very expensive -£55 euros each for the set menu). There is also no Sky tv as advertised, no tea making facilities in the room and no information booklet about the hotel. The front panels are missing from the tv's which are still operational from the remote controls but makes the tv's look scruffy. We had room 508 which was incredibly small making it difficult to walk around the bed. The decor was very tastefully done, especially in the bathroom but one of the controls was broken on the jacuzzi. We informed the staff on our arrival that we were on our honeymoon but they were completely disinterested and forgot to provide us with champagne in our room as per our booking. We seem to have got off fairly lightly though. Many guests were complaining in reception. One couple had not been allocated a room for 2 days despite booking 3 months in advance so they had to find a B&B till their room was ready. They were blaitantly lied to and the staff were inconsistant about the reasons for the delay. Staff tried to move them into the basement but they quite rightly refused. Breakfast was nice. A good variety and a great view of St Peters. The view from our room looked out onto a back street although we weren't promised any particular view when we booked. Overall, an enjoyable trip based on Rome itself, a beautiful city. Give this a hotel a miss if you are chlostrophobic or expecting 4 or 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Inferior room/inattentive concierge staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rated as a 3-4 star hotel---which it may have been at one time, but it certainly isn't now. Worth half (if that) of room rate charged. Small, cave-like room. Barely room to move & in dire need of refurbishing (dirty, darkly stained carpets; loosening wallpaper; broken or missing knobs on t.v.). Room photos posted on internet are grossly misleading. I should have paid heed to previously posted negative reviews but "upgraded" to the Atlante Star based on their internet site room pics & descriptions. Lesson learned. Bathroom was clean but hand-held shower didn't function properly (dribbled when it worked at all). It was never fixed. It took 5 requests to have a t.v. remote control delivered to the room. We met 4 other U.S. couples staying there and all were quite disappointed with their accommodations & service & wouldn't stay there again. Never again for us, for sure. One guest mentioned she requested an iron (none in our room either), but none was available even on request. Another requested laundry pick-up, but dirty clothes were still at door at the end of the day. Restaurant on top floor is well appointed & offers a good view of St. Peter's dome. The serving staff was excellent as was presentation, but the food was mediocre at best (tough meat) @ approx. $250EU for dinner for two with one glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend the Atlante Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just before the beginning of the high season yet it was full. I felt like I was welcomed into a family style atmosphere. Everyone was always helpful. The hotel is situated in a perfect location, near to the Vatican but easy to walk anywhere in the city, although all methods of public transportation are availalbe. The rooms are not large but have everything you need. The breakfast buffet is good and the view can't be beat, you get a panoramic view of much of the city including the Vatican. I felt very safe and could walk to restaurants, shopping, and any sites including Sant'Angelo and the Vatican in minutes. I've stayed here two times and would return on all my visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: The Traveling Commander
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 18-20 July 2005. What a disappointment! Advertised as 4 Star, but definitely not. More like a 2 Star hotel. They were supposed to pick us up at Rome airport, but didn't, even after repeated phone calls. Had to take a taxi. The room was very small, only slightly larger than the bed. The bathroom was terrible. The shower just dripped water, and the tub filled up while taking a shower half way to the knees. The breakfast buffet was a mess. If you didn't arrive when it first opened, forget it. They never replenished anything. Items that should have been cold, like yougurt, were just sitting on a tray. The only thing that was cold was the coffee. The only good thing about the hotel was the view from the restaurant. It was very nice. All in all, a terrible hotel. Stay somewhere else. There are many choices in Rome. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Lacklustre honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I married last October and because of being blessed!? with 5 rugrats stole the opportunity to take a late honeymoon. My husband made all of the arrangments and booked us with the Atlante Star due to it's 4 star credibilty and rooftop restaurant. When we arrived we were behind a couple to book in at reception and we were excited to see them being given a brass key with burghandy tassels and a porter duely whipped their luggage upstairs. Imagine our horror when we were given a key with a black plastic keyring and left to heave our bags alone! The room can only be described as staff quarters. We were bitterly disappointed. My husband had informed the Atlante Star in advance that we were honeymooners and to receive a dingy cupboard with a scummy cracked sink for £110 a night was beyond a joke! Although we did have a giggle about the porn mirrors! Talk about Italian Stallion! They must need a spectators view to perfect their moves! We were upgraded the next day. To be honest the room wasn't much better it was slightly nicer but smaller! And rooftop restaurant was closed! In all it did taint our visit to Rome. I loved my trip to the city however I will find a better hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well-equipped rooms, helpful & courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 adult sisters and our mother enjoyed 9 nights/10 days in Roma at the Atlante Star Hotel. The hotel is in a great location, near major sights and buslines, from which it is easy to see all of Rome. We shared a "Quad room" equipped with hairdryer, soaking tub/shower, bidet, two separate sleeping rooms, stocked fridge, flat screen TV (who would bother with infinitely wonderful Rome at your fingertips?), air conditioning. The rooms are smaller than American hotels typically provide. The queen bed was comfortable but the two singles were more like cots...though we slept like logs after walking all day long. Shutters assure quiet even though our room overlooked a busy street. Housekeeping is very good. The lobby sitting room contains a computer with Internet access for a reasonable price-per-minute, or, for the same price, you can hook up in your room. Italian newspapers are available gratis every day, and the Herald Tribune if you are an early bird. The staff are courteous, especially if you ask for concierge assistance getting tickets, for example, and for ideas for activities and transportation routes/modes. We learned from the staff about an inexpensive bossa nova concert at a modern outdoor auditorium one night, a contemporary respite from historical Rome. We also asked for a picnic breakfast to take to the airport when we left for an early flight home, which the hotel then provided as part of the service. Most importantly, we asked for a room change for more comfort after we checked in, and were accomodated the next day even tho the hotel was sold out. But be sure to ask for what you want or need. Most of the staff speak English, some are multi-lingual. Breakfasts are generous--a buffet of tasty selections but other than hot hard boiled eggs, hot meal choices are not offered every morning. The breakfast room is situated on the top floor and offers one of the best views of the city, an inspiring way to start the day. It becomes an elegant and pricey dinner venue in the evening. Above is an open-air rooftop patio that catches the morning and evening breezes--a delightful spot day or night, with relaxed evening bar service. Within a radius of 3-4 blocks there are many trattorias offering reasonably-priced meals and cafe refreshments. Also nearby is a large mercado where one can buy fresh fruits, vegies, flowers etc. and a major shopping boulevard with boutiques and department stores. (Not that I'm into shopping.) Walking the back ways to St. Peter's and Castel Sant' Angelo (just a few blocks either way) is more charming than the main boulevards because of the little shops and gelatorias along the way. One still must dodge the occasional scooter or Mercedes even on the most obscure cobblestone alley, however. But hey that's half the fun of a Roman holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay again at Atlante Star!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Atlante Star was faultless and we have no real complaints about the Hotel. I had arranged months in advance for a romantic touch for our trip as it was our one year wedding anniversary. We were promised a room upgrade and a sparkling bottle of wine. We did get both of these but the wine was red and i had to ask the desk if we had been given an upgrade as it didn’t have the deluxe feel i expected. Anyway i was assured that all room on the fifth floor are the deluxe rooms so i decided to forget about it and get on with the holiday. The room was tiny and only enough room to walk down the side of the bed and around the desk. A little more room would have made the room a little more 'Deluxe!!!’ The bathroom was quite large and tiled in marble. The Jacuzzi looked ok but we never used it as it looked old and as if it needed replacing. The shower pressure was poor and the fittings were falling off the wall or had actually been removed and not replaced? The sink was great and there were plenty of towels made available. All in all the room was comfortable apart from the 6ft square mirror behind the bed, which if you are not the most confident person regarding your body then it will definitely set you off in a good mood in the morning. On the other hand you can imagine you are on the set of some 70's blue movie and have the time of your life!!!!!!! a nice picture would of done!! The location of the hotel is good for the Vatican museums and St Peters. If you like walking the rest is easily reachable and bus routes pass the hotel frequently. On the first day we walked to the Roman Forum which wasn’t too far, but Bus 190 back was a good idea after a full days walking!! I recommend eating in Trastevere at night. The restaurant next in Santa Maria next to the bar with the oranges is fantastic! Explanation seems strange but you will see what i mean when you go. Travellers were easily changed at the front desk as long as they have enough EUROS to do it. A few times they could only change 100 at a time. The restaurant seemed to be busy every night and the smells coming down the stairs towards our room were always tempting early in the evening. Breakfast gives you an insight to what it would belike to eat dinner up there. To be honest I don't think I would rate it that highly. If you don't get a table near the side window then the view of St Peters is non existent. I would recommend to the hotel that they allow people to eat breakfast or serve special meals on the roof garden terrace as this is where the view is especially spectacular. After breakfast, walks up the stairs next to the lift and take in the view…it is amazing and the selling point of the hotel and restaurant. Anyway to sum up the hotel needs a facelift and the bathrooms need replacing. They need to provide a personal safe in the room and restock the mini bar when something is used. Warnings as well, make sure you have a travel iron as they do not provide irons due to insurance. The beds are comfortable and the room elegantly decorated. The air conditioning is really good and the lighting options in the room convenient. I just felt like it didn't have the special sparkle you would expect from a 4 star superior, maybe 3 star to be honest. Anyway for a comfortable stay with great views and convenient location for the Vatican then stay here but if you hunt I am sure you can find a better place to stay. If you would like any further information then please do not hesitate to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view over the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've read the reviews on this website, and to be honest, we were a bit worried, but after our unforgettable stay in this wonderful hotel, we can only praise it! The locations is best I have ever seen. Room with view to the vatican, and a restaurant with view to everything, do you wish more? The rooms are not to large but we've been coming to this city to see the city and not to spend the whole day in our hotelroom! We took the shuttle service on arrival, which was really comfortable after a long trip and arrived at the hotel, we used the jacuzzi, just to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service, Arrogant staff, overbilled Credit Card”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was arrogant, no provision to bring luggage up, porter drags luggage up, Dirty rooms and smelly bathroom. Mildew on carpet. Lost some items in room (could not prove to manager). Got overbilled when my credit card statement came in. Hard to remedy as staff speaks english selectively (only if it suits them). Avoid the hotel chain as they have several hotels with the same management.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at The Atlante Star in Rome, for two nights, at the end of a glorious trip throughout Italy. I must say that it was a colossal disappointment!!!! First the good – At least the room was clean – And now the bad. -The entire staff, except the bellman, had very snobbish attitudes and were less than helpful with directions, etc.. -The one exception to that was the bellman who was most courteous and helpful. He also seemd to do most of the work. Everytime I saw him he was either hurrying to get luggage or mopping or vacuuming, while two or three desk staff stood around and did nothing. It is the first “four star” hotel I have ever been in where the bellman doubled as a janitor. -The Jacuzzi tub did not function at all. -The photos and indications of a trellis covered viewing deck are very misleading. Yes, you can actually see the Vatican – But we had to practically beg the bartender to serve us a glass of wine in the bar to take up to the viewing deck and promise to return the glasses. Another aberration for a supposedly four star hotel. The deck itself was littered with trash and suffered form very poor lighting. -The restaurant at breakfast was utterly filthy with stained and unclean table cloths and all manner of food and crumbs on the floor. We had originally planned to eat there for dinner, but decided against it after seeing the state of the restaurant at breakfast. The food itself was very below average. We have stayed in many three/four star hotels in Italy and elsewhere and for much less than The Atlante Star charged.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time but with some problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Atlante Star in Nov 2004. We had a great time but with some teething problems. Firstly, as mentioned by some of the other posters on this board, they overbooked us (we were originally booked into the Atlante Garden). The room they booked us into didn't have a jacuzzi tub, so we asked to be moved - which happened the next day. The next room we were in was TINY, much smaller than our first, but with a tub. Also, the TV didn't work. We didn't bother to complain because the whole point of the trip was to have a relaxing holiday - not to stand around arguing with the manager. Once we just got on with the holiday, it was fine. The rooms are very clean, the staff courteous and the breakfasts great. I wouldn't stay here again, partly because of the location - if you want any nightlife, over and above restaurants, you're best to look elsewhere. However, the hotel was nice, aside from their deceptive practice of overbooking and room changing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and the service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early December and we were surprised about the warm welcome. The shuttle from the airport was right on time, and the room was clean and quiet. We enjoyed this week and we'll never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Atlante Star for three nights we were booked into the Atlante Garden for four,but they had a problem with the water and they put us in a ground floor apartment a couple of streets away, horrible bedroon damp and musky defiently not 4*. We were moved the following morning to the star, nice room old fashioned but spotlessly clean. a little on the noisy side, but comfortable staff where very helpful. Breakfast served in the rooftop resturant was nice, stunning views of St Peters and the Vatican. Hotel was convienent for the Vatican and St Peters quite a walk to the other sites, but as there is such a lot to see around St Peters etc didn't have a problem. Found some really nice and very inexpensive restaurants in the streets just by the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: first time to rome, although have been all over the world--not to brag, but i have done quite a bit of travelling- very nice overall the airport pick up is very valuable and a pleasure after a long,nasty flight location is great for everything-neightborhood is a little too quiet for me very nice breakfast each morning room was clean and comfortable in the intalian style paid Euro150 over Christmas recomended if you don't have anything else (i just lucked on to this on the net)

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Atlante Star
HotelInfo.Address: G.Vitelleschi n.34, 00193 Rome, Italy
